subject: Announcing AWS Import/Export for Amazon EBS
description: Dear Amazon Web Services Customer, Today we?re excited to announce support for importing data into Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) using AWS Import/Export. AWS Import/Export accelerates moving large amounts of data into and out of AWS using portable storage devices for transport. Amazon EBS provides storage volumes for use with Amazon EC2 instances. With Import to Amazon EBS in the US East (Virginia) and US West (Northern California) regions, you can now quickly transfer data into Amazon EBS by shipping storage devices to AWS. AWS Import/Export transfers your data off of storage devices into AWS by using Amazon?s high-speed internal network and bypassing the Internet. If you have large amounts of data to load and an Internet connection with limited bandwidth, the time required to prepare and ship a portable storage device to AWS can be a small percentage of the time it would take to transfer your data over the internet. If loading your data over the Internet would take more than a few days, you should consider using AWS Import/Export. AWS Import/Export now supports importing data directly into Amazon EBS snapshots off of eSATA and USB storage devices, as well as internal SATA hard drives. Once loaded into an Amazon EBS snapshot, you can create a volume based on that snapshot and attach it to an Amazon EC2 instance, or you can share that snapshot with others. To import into an Amazon EBS snapshot, simply: - Prepare a portable storage device with your data onit. - Submit a Create Job request to AWS that includes your return shipping address. You?ll receive back a unique identifier for the job, a barcode to identify your device, and an AWS address to ship your storage device to. - Securely identify your device by attaching the bar code to it. - Ship your device to AWS. When your package arrives, it will be processed and transferred to an AWS data center for data loading. After the data load completes, the device will be returned to you. Get started using AWS Import/Export today at http://aws.amazon.com/importexport. Sincerely, The AWS Import/Export Team We hope you enjoyed receiving this message. If you wish to remove yourself from receiving future product announcements and the monthly AWS Newsletter, please update your communication preferences at https://aws-portal.amazon.com/gp/aws/developer/account/index.html/104-4543842-2170300?ie=UTF8&action=edit-communication-preferences Amazon Web Services LLC is a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc. Amazon.com is a registered trademark of Amazon.com, Inc. This message produced and distributed by Amazon Web Services, LLC, 410 Terry Avenue North, Seattle, WA 98109.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: SPS pop-ups about lost IDR connectivity
description: Zurich and BMC have reported seeing pop-ups in SPS saying "Service Error / Cannot contact SinglePoint server" and Matthew, David, and I have all seen similar messages. Although we can click "ok" and keep working, it's distracting and doesn't boost customer confidence. Is there a threshold we can adjust to reduce these spurious messages?
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Custom Portal API documentation needs details on secondary messages
description: Customers may want to provide different error messages depending on whether a user has provided invalid credentials or no credentials (like if they've been redirected to the portal page by trying to access a protected resource like an H-Fed app). Our API docs only specify that we use the NOT_AUTHENTICATED code, but we also apparently provide a variety of secondary messages that go into further detail. It sounds like some of these secondary messages may have changed between 8.8 and 8.9, and (although I'm still verifying) it looks like Zurich may have been keying off of an old string. Can we add documentation on these secondary messages to the API docs (and verify they're correct between releases)?
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Re: SFDC - Delegated AuthN???
description: Cool people attach files. On Fri, Jun 17, 2011 at 10:15 AM, Matthew Boeckman wrote: > That question is a bit vague, but I will take a stab at an answer here: > > Delegated Authentication enables us to allow mobile clients to login to > SFDC remotely with their AD (or other user store) credentials. The attached > document outlines the requirements and configuration for Delegated > Authentication. > > As for "official support" that is a Jay question. I just logged into SFDC > on my phone, android 2.2, using delegated auth. I cannot speak to anything > else :-) > > > On Thu, Jun 16, 2011 at 6:28 PM, Carla Ewing wrote: > >> Hi guys - >> >> I got this question from CSC today regarding their Motorola account. I >> think what it describes is handled by our SFDC delegated authentication >> functionality, but I wanted to check with you guys first to confirm or deny. >> And I think this capability gives us support for SFDC on mobile devices as >> well, correct? >> >> Sorry -but haven't sold this feature yet, so still get confused by the >> variety of questions we get around it. Thanks for your help! >> >> Carla >> >> If memory serves me correctly there were two primary technical questions >> we needed follow-up on. The first is what if anything the Symplified >> solution can bring to the table to overcome a current shortfall of SAML >> support with the SFDC platform. One of the issues we initially encountered >> with SFDC that kept us from implementing a SAML based solution with them is >> the Outlook plug-in they offer which at the time (and currently) does not >> support SAML. According to some information on the SDFC Ideas forum this is >> supposed to be finally available in the ?upcoming release?. However, >> considering that this is a 2-year or older issue I will believe it when I >> see it. In general though, we also would like to know if the Symplified >> integration with SDFC supports mobile devices. If so what platforms? >> >> >> >> -- >> *Carla Ewing* >> *Director, Systems Engineers >> *Cell: 720.315.8362 >> Office: 303.318.4212 >> >> *Symplified* | The Cloud Security Company >> http://www.symplified.com >> >> > > > -- > Matthew Boeckman > Sr. Solutions Engineer > 303.318.4156 > mboeckman@symplified.com > > Reach Symplified Support here or > call: 303-318-4188 option 2 > > Symplified | The Cloud Security Company > http://www.symplified.com > > -- Matthew Boeckman Sr. Solutions Engineer 303.318.4156 mboeckman@symplified.com Reach Symplified Support here or call: 303-318-4188 option 2 Symplified | The Cloud Security Company http://www.symplified.com

subject: Duplicated Query String with HTTP Basic
description: We are utilizing HTTP Basic to protect a customer application. Application logs in to portal successfully but fails to access subpages because query string values are repeated twice. Stephanie was kind enough to confirm this problem, but did not see an immediate cause. The customer is attempting to have this done by the end of the May so it is fairly urgent. I have a packet dump that shows we actually make three requests to this subpage: 1. GET with the correct query string but no authorization string --> returns 401 2. Get with the correct query string and authorization string --> returns 200 (with valid subpage) 3. Get with the invalid query string and authorization string --> returns 200 (with error message due to invalid quer string) Valid Request URI: /Reports/Pages/Folder.aspx?ItemPath=%2fMy+Reports&ViewMode=List Invalid Request URI: /Reports/Pages/Folder.aspx?ItemPath=%2fMy+Reports&ViewMode=List&ItemPath=%2fMy+Reports&ViewMode=List

subject: Generic SAML 2 adapter format error
description: I am working with crytocard. With the fix we got past the IsPassive issue. Now we are seeing an additional problem. They are saying we aren't formatting the request properly. This is what we send 1f99uylhnnfcp They need Also they suggested that we test against a "Shibboleth Test Server" http://www.testshib.org/ http://www.testshib.org/testshib-two/index.jsp There you can test your Service against Shibboleth Identity Provider Test Bench (SAML2 and SAML1 standards compliant). It also gives you access to the ?Log file? over http. If you can make your ?Service? work against it, it will for sure work against any ?Identity Provider?. We did test it and it works for us that?s why our service is working without any issues against Google, Sales Force and Our own internal Service. Thanks -Zheng Lu(RZ) AVP, Moody's Middleware Engineering 212.553.2797 From: Cheung, Ben Sent: Tuesday, May 17, 2011 7:28 PM To: Lu, Zheng; Sharma, Deepak (non-empl); Sarangi, Joydeep (non-empl) Cc: Pichumani, Balaji (non-empl); Yadav, Aditya (non-empl); Aitha, Pradeep (non-empl); Gadekar, Prajeet (non-empl) Subject: SFDC QA IDR Setup Instructions Importance: High RZ/Joydeep/Deepak, As discussed in our meeting today, the following is the instruction provided by our SSO vendor to setup SSO in our SFDC QA environment. The attached email includes the "pem" file, and also the SFDC public key. After you complete the setup in QA, please take a screenshot of the setup page and email it to me. Should you have any question, I can get you in touch with Max, our vendor engineer. Thank you very much. Ben From: Max Parris [mailto:mparris@symplified.com] Sent: Monday, May 16, 2011 11:35 PM To: Cheung, Ben Cc: Lin, Mark; Conte, Michael Subject: Re: QA IDR Project Update Ben, Here is the process for setting up SFDC in the Test Environment: Step-by-step instructions: Login as an administrator in SFDC and go to Setup --> Administration Setup --> Security Controls --> Single Sign-On Settings -You will enable SAML 2.0 -Upload the attached pem file for the IdP Certificate (from original email) -Issuer should be fed:qa:moodys:sfdc:saml2 -IdP Login URL is blank -IdP Logout URL is blank -Custom Error URL is blank -Assertion contains User's salesforce.com username is chosen -User ID in the NameIdentifier element of the Subject statement is chosen. Please have your admin send back a screenshot of the completed configuration so that we can keep for our records. Regards, Max Maxfield Parris Sr. Solutions Engineer 303.318.4207 mparris@symplified.com Reach Symplified Support here or call: 303-318-4188 option 2 Symplified | The Cloud Security Company http://www.symplified.com ----------------------------------------- The information contained in this e-mail message, and any attachment thereto, is confidential and may not be disclosed without our express permission. subject: IdR cannot support multiple SFDC SAML Adapters
description: Prospect: BMC Customer plans to host multiple Customer Portals within Salesforce. Each Customer portal (this case applies to SFDC sites too) requires a unique SAML Assertion containing the ID of the portal (or site) which requires us to derive a new adapter from the Generic SAML adapter. Each adapter requires a unique IDP Entity ID for its IDP URL. The issue is that SalesForce expects a single IDP Entity ID and only allows for a single IDP Entity ID in its SSO configuration. This means that a single IdR could only support a single SFDC connection - just the internal facing cases and not the external facing cases. Is there a way to have any SFDC adapters share the IDP ID? Is there a way to reference the IDP ID in a global setting?
name: Symplified SE Team

subject: Images not loading correctly with IE8 on Provider portal

name: Schumacher Group

subject: Issues with IE
description: This started recently (not exactly sure when, but it cannot have been more than a week). Certain images are not being loaded for users using our provider portal with IE (both 8 and 9 are affected - don't know about earlier versions). The images all load fine on Chrome, FF, Opera, and Safari - only IE is affected. It happens on both sides of our firewall, so I don't think it is related to any changes in our network setup. In a nutshell, when certain images are requested IE fails to load them. It is not our server returning a not found error - in fact our server is returning a 200/OK and the fiddler logs show that the IDR is also returning a 200/OK. However, the response headers are loaded with this set-cookie statement: Set-Cookie: SPBALANCEID=balancer.172.16.1.86; path=/; domain=.tsghealthcare.com It repeats at least 200 or more times in the header. That is the only thing I can see different about them. I think IE is choking because the header is too big, but that is just a guess. No matter how many times I retry the request, I get back the same header with tons of set-cookie statements. If I alter the case of the path (i.e. "LOGO.gif" instead of "logo.gif") the request completes normally and the header only contains 1 set-cookie statment. I have fiddler logs if needed. This is a very serious concern for us at is is dramatically affecting certain functionality on our portal for everyone using IE (which is probably the majority of our users). And help you could provide to expedite the handling of this would be appreciated.
name: Schumacher Group

subject: Zurich Domino Bug - Unable to retrieve attributes from Domino LDAP with mixed case (from schema)
description: Zurich is trying to retrieve an attribute from its AuthN user store which pertains to a password reset flag. The actual name that we pull back from the schema is HTTPPasswordForceChange. The actual name when on a user object is httppasswordforcechange. With any attribute where the case doesn't match from what we pull back from the schema to what the attribute name is on a user object, we are unable to pull back. When this is done via ldapsearch, it will work fine: [root@my symplified]# ldapsearch -h ldap.zurichna.com -p 389 -D "cn=uszlxu1,o=zis" -w - -b "o=uszweb" uid=upass123 HTTPPAsswordForceChange Enter bind password: version: 1 dn: CN=Upass Replacement,OU=upass123,O=USZWeb httppasswordforcechange: 1 Note that it looks like all of the attributes being retrieved from domino are coming back as lower case: [root@my symplified]# ldapsearch -h ldap.zurichna.com -p 389 -D "cn=uszlxu1,o=zis" -w - -b "o=uszweb" uid=upass123 Enter bind password: version: 1 dn: CN=Upass Replacement,OU=upass123,O=USZWeb cn: Upass Replacement mail: linda.frazier@zurichna.com objectclass: dominoPerson objectclass: inetOrgPerson objectclass: organizationalPerson objectclass: person objectclass: top mailaddress: linda.frazier@zurichna.com policy: /ZNA External Web mailsystem: 5 messagestorage: 1 encryptincomingmail: 0 roamcleansetting: 0 roamcleanper: 1 availablefordirsync: 1 checkpassword: 0 passwordchangeinterval: 0 passwordgraceperiod: 0 httppasswordforcechange: 1 givenname: Upass sn: Replacement uid: upass123 userpassword: (6D4F0FB05D38200C2A08AFEE8AA176E2) dsphttppassword: (6D4F0FB05D38200C2A08AFEE8AA176E2) roaminguser: 0 [root@my symplified]# ldapsearch -h ldap.zurichna.com -p 389 -D "cn=uszlxu1,o=zis" -w - -b "o=uszweb" uid=upass123 HTTPPAsswordForceChange Enter bind password: version: 1 dn: CN=Upass Replacement,OU=upass123,O=USZWeb httppasswordforcechange: 1
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Make SAML Adapters Compatible with User Store Hunting
description: Currently each SAML adapter can only use attributes from one user store. If a customer is using multiple user stores, we can currently only associate one user store with the SAML application. Enabling the ability to associate multiple user stores and associated user store attribute with a SAML application (enforcing the same user store hunting order), will enable one SAML application to be used with multiple user stores. In addition, SAML adapters should have the ability to choose multiple extended attributes from multiple user stores. I.E. the sAMAccount Name from Active Directory and the email address from the Google user store, both attributes to be included in the SAML assertion. Please see Avery if any further clarification is needed.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Default Portal config does not warn for url's lacking http/s
description: In the new Default Portal customization screen, where you can specify Home, Portal, Help and Settings URL's, a user can enter a valid URL without the http:// and publish successfully. What is then appended is the url as a path under the existing default portal. For example, changing the Home link from /content/home.html to www.cnn.com results in a 404 : Not Found The requested URL /portal/ribbon/www.cnn.com was not found on this server. Perhaps a tooltip or a warning popup stipulating the requirement of http:// to prefix external URL's?

subject: Post 8.6 Upgrade create OpenID Adapter and then publish - publish hangs on IDR
description: HP Enabled a new OpenID Adapter to take advantage of the new attributes that were setup for them (IDP Name and Type). After doing this an publishing, the publish would never succeed, but there were no errors on the IDR. This occurred on ALL Idrs in their environment. After the 8.6 upgrade, we rebooted all IDRs and did successfully publish. I have bundlelogs from all of their IDRs. 2011-02-09 11:15:32,010 [http-8080-1] INFO com.symplified.service.appliance.core.ApplianceServiceImpl[209] - Pulling customer, adapter pom, and application server configs... 2011-02-09 11:18:45,040 [http-8080-1] INFO com.symplified.service.appliance.core.ApplianceServiceImpl[209] - Pulling customer, adapter pom, and application server configs... 2011-02-09 11:25:33,982 [http-8080-1] INFO com.symplified.service.appliance.core.ApplianceServiceImpl[209] - Pulling customer, adapter pom, and application server configs... 2011-02-09 11:30:38,173 [http-8080-1] INFO com.symplified.service.appliance.core.ApplianceServiceImpl[209] - Pulling customer, adapter pom, and application server configs... 2011-02-09 11:32:19,676 [http-8080-1] INFO com.symplified.service.appliance.core.ApplianceServiceImpl[209] - Pulling customer, adapter pom, and application server configs... After a service singlepoint force-restart, all services came up fine and a we were able to publish.

subject: Applications Discover but Connecting to the Application Fails
description: There have been a few applications where I have used the Trust Connector to discover an app and it works perfectly. When I try to connect to the app within the user portal, authentication fails. Examining the application form in the Trust Connector tab in SPS, everything looks fine. In addition, if I create a form on a separate web server (Apache on my laptop) and submit the credentials via POST to the application login URL, I get authenticated and logged in correctly. After talking with Andrew regarding this, he thought it may be a Trust Connector issue that can be fixed. Application Name: Veracode Application/Login URL: https://analysiscenter.veracode.com Action URL: https://analysiscenter.veracode.com/j_security_check Login Name: Cewing@symplified.com Login Password: Claire627 Application present in SP12, login creds are cgewing and passwordce

description: When discovering Hubspot via TC, the application discovers fine. However, when using the Dashboard tab as a landing page, it works the first time, but subsequent clicks on the Dashboard tab bring the user back to the login page. When using any of the other tabs as a landing page, it works great, except that the Dashboard tab brings you to a login screen. Two hostnames are used for this app and two web servers need to be created. When logging in via the Portal and receiving this issue, a cookie is missing that gets created during direct login.

subject: Keychain CLI Key Load Corruption
description: Email from Greg: Since turning up production, I have received a several calls where the SSO to HR TMS has failed. The fix thus far, has been to re-load the effected ID's, even though the ID's already existed. Before each of the updates I verified that the ID's existed in the IR (idr-describe-keychains), and verified that the password used with the prior batch update was the same as that with the requested correction. I suspect it has something to do with the errors encountered with the CLI IDR-Update-keychains -f. (see below for a reminder) at the end of the updates. Anything we can do to expedite correction of the CLI? I would like to re-load the entire list to slow the phone calls, but fear clobbering others. The ID's corrected this morning with a reload: CSI0298, FIGC009, and BRG0276 Thanks, Greg Creating keychain for user 'csi0235'. Creating keychain for user 'tech136'. Creating keychain for user 'test0003'. Writing batch of 1343 keychains ... Failed to update keychains. Make sure that the identity router is running properly. usage: idr-update-keychains -s [-p ] -k | -keyfile -f [-h] [-v] [-d] -d,--debug Used to debug problems with the CLI -f,--filename Name of a XML or CSV file that contains keychain information. -h,--help Print usage -k,--key IDR API security key -keyfile IDR API security key file, must have key= line in file -p,--port IDR API's port -s,--server IDR DNS name or IP address -v,--verbose Print verbose progress information C:\symplify-cli\bin>

subject: Certificate update @ Salesforce
description: We received an e-mail from Salesforce about an update to a certificate and wanted to ensure that our connectivity will be uninterrupted. Is there anything we need to do in order to avoid any issues using the Salesforce service through Symplified's SSO product? Thanks! Scott At salesforce.com, customer success is our top priority, and it is our goal to make you aware of any changes that could affect your use of Salesforce. You are receiving this email because we have identified you as a system administrator of a salesforce.com organization that may be impacted by the upcoming expiration of a client certificate. What is the change? The salesforce.com client certificate named proxy.salesforce.com is expiring on January 7, 2011. Customers who authenticate this certificate via any of the following methods may need to download the latest certificate: * Delegated authentication with a HTTPS URL * Workflow outbound messaging with a HTTPS URL * Customers using service provider (SP) initiated SAML for single sign-on When is this change taking effect? The old client is expiring on January 7, 2011. The new client certificate will be updated on January 6, 2011. What action must I take? If your delegated authentication or workflow outbound messaging servers do not require client certificates and if you do not use SAML for authentication, then no further action by you is required. If your servers request a client certificate, or if you use SAML, then you may need to download the newest proxy.salesforce.com client certificate prior to January 6 by visiting http://wiki.developerforce.com/index.php/Client_Certificate, or logging a case with Support. Servers and SAML identity providers that match the complete client certificate from an incoming connection with the old certificate will need to be updated to also accept the new version of the proxy.salesforce.com certificate. After the old certificate expires on January 7, 2011, the expired certificate can be removed from the servers and SAML identity providers. Servers and SAML identity providers that do not match the complete client certificate with a stored value, but check the client certificate's distinguished name (DN) and verify its trust chain will not be affected by this update to the proxy.salesforce.com client certificate. How can I get more information? For more information on client certificates and best practices recommended by salesforce.com, please visit http://wiki.developerforce.com/index.php/Client_Certificate. If you have further questions, please contact Customer Support. Best regards, salesforce.com Customer Support Copyright 2000-2010 salesforce.com - All rights reserved. Salesforce and the "no software" logo are registered trademarks of salesforce.com, inc., and salesforce.com owns other registered and unregistered trademarks. subject: Publishing Error Workflow Bug
description: After receiving a publishing error and having the associated dialogue box appear, I clicked on the edit button which brought me to the application creation dialgue menu. I updated this menu with the correct URL, clicked save and was brought back to the publishing error dialogue box. This box presented me with two options- force publish or cancel. If I've had the chance to correct the error, I should see the option to publish and have the application throw another error if I still have not correctly fixed the problem.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Publishing Error Menu Text Description Error
description: While receiving a publishing error, the error describes a malformed "Menu URL". In the application creation dialogue box, there is no descriptor named Menu URL 8.5.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: SPS bug for ldaps
description: SPS does not allow you to specify ldaps:// in the user store configuration. This is supported by the code per Brandon, but not allowed in the UI. This is required to run LDAPS on a non-standard port, such as a LDAP-GC port of 3269
name: Symplified, Inc.

name: Moody's

subject: Potential Header Session Flipping
description: This came in from a call from Heath. This issue is currently being tracked down by his team. He does not know if it is a Symplified issue or not. It has happened approximately 5 times in the last year. When a user authenticates, Heath reads the symplified headers to pull out a GlobalID. All other application data relevant to this is populated into a memory session. Sometimes this session times out. A few times, when being re-read in, it grabbed the same SinglePoint session, but the GlobalID changed. This gives one user another user's information.
name: Schumacher Group

subject: App Discover - Cannot create multiple text fields
description: Had to discover the Jamis application: URL: https://etime1.jamis.com/etime/login.aspx (pop-ups MUST be allowed on this site) username (use the employee number): 9999 password: Bird1210 Company: MOCA Go To field: There is a drop down box. Choose "Enter a Time Card" When doing this, I needed two text fields and one password field. Set the username and Company fields in the form to "username". When I then try to label these and save, SPS will re-label to one of the labels that was used and when used, a user will only see 2 credential fields.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: IdR Reboot - NTP needs to be checked on startup
description: Schumacher External had a Datacenter outage and the IDR was rebooted during the process. When it came up, the clock was off by 1 hour due to daylight savings. This results in the inability of users to access Google until an ntpdate is run: [root@ssoproviders ~]# ntpdate -u pool.ntp.org 27 Dec 09:31:33 ntpdate[7972]: step time server 69.41.163.31 offset -3600.039608 sec We should be syncing clocks when the service comes up since we are so dependent on accurate time for cookies and for SAML requests.
name: Schumacher Group

subject: Web Service User Store - Reusing invalid Session
description: From Jason: We did find one anomaly: If the IdR has a session uuid that is no longer valid (e.g. a logout was received), our user store service return an error (404 I think), but the IdR continues to try to make requests with the invalid session uuid. Seems like the IdR should attempt a logout/and then login to get a new session uuid. Seems like we need to force a new login after we receive a 404 after a logout. This is a potential bug with the Rest V2 user store.

subject: Dynamic Loader Service pauses after pushing out new adapter
description: On the BP IDR, I pushed out a config string for the Salesforce SAML 2.0 adapter. Upon the first publish, I noticed that the publish did not succeed. I went on the IDR and noticed that the Dynamic Loader Service was paused but all 31 other services running. SinglePoint Identity Router StatusSINGLEPOINT IDENTITY ROUTER STATUS : FAILEDSERVICE STATUS : FAILED RUNNING : 31 - bootstrapService cipherService cacheService keychainService updateConfigService applicationServerService adapterService ssoService customerService simpleLinkVpnService virtualUserStoreService authenticationEngine authorization virtualIwaService provisioningService provisioningPollingService spService dnsWatcherThread applianceScheduleService haService featuresService idpService sessionService policyEngineService cookiePoolService loginService cookieFilterService keychainUpdateService keychainRetrievalService networkBridge modsinglepointRequestServer PAUSED : 1 - dynamicLoaderService STOPPED : 0 - MEMORY STATUS : OK MAXIMUM : 1820 MB USED : 43 MB FREE : 1776 MBFILE SYSTEM STATUS : OK TOTAL : 69931 MB USABLE : 64416 MBSESSION STATUS : OK TOTAL : 0 REJECTED : 0 Tried another publish. The IDR is stuck at Pulling Customer, adapter pom, and application server configs. It essentially will not respond to anything until a service singlepoint force-restart is done. Will then publish fine in no time.
name: Symplified, Inc.

Could you please look into it? 2010-11-06-10.13.23.000000 - Create/Update Users Command Status Code ? 7 From IDR with a test I did: [root@mdyptcsso102 bin]# ./idr --server 10.6.1.19 --key Moodys help singlepoint> help Command Name Description --------------------------------------------------------------------------- help Displays this help. verbose Toggles between verbose and quiet modes. debug Toggles between debug and non-debug modes. describe keychains Outputs keychains information. describe keychain Outputs keychain information for a specific user. describe application Output application information. describe applications Outputs all application information. create keychain Creates a keychain. remove keychains Removes keychains. remove keychain Removes a specific keychain. update keychain Modifies a keychain. rename keychain Renames a keychain. exit Exits the command shell. --------------------------------------------------------------------------- For help on a specific command type 'help ' singlepoint> describe keychains Failed to get users from the server. Make sure that the identity router is running properly. singlepoint> [root@mdyptcsso102 bin]# cd /usr/local/symplified/cache/keychain/ [root@mdyptcsso102 keychain]# find ./ -type f | wc -l 3570

After publishing a change to our test Workday application I could no longer authenticate to the production Workday application. I wasn't sure if this was a result of a. my changes b. the error noted in #1 above c. temporary expected outage due to publishing I backed out my change, got the error again when publishing, but could eventually log into production workday app again. Please advides on the error and whether I should expect disruption to SAML protected apps when publishing.

subject: DOCS - Web Service User Store
description: The Web Service User Store API document needs to be updated to reflect to the reader that "If you do not implement like this, things will not work" This is especially important with the error messages section. We need a note in that section to tell the user that you MUST implement to these specifications, otherwise your web service user store will not work. There are some other minor modifications I would like to be made. In general, each section needs to tell the user along with API specs when these calls are made by the IDR and what they are used for. Appliance Login URL: need to say that this must allow for multiple concurrent logins by and IDR and a login without a graceful logout. We should also specify when this would be called: on an IDR startup, if "test" is pressed in the user store screen, if "refresh attributes" is pressed, or on publish. ID Router Logout URL: need to say when this is actually done...not actually sure when this is and might be a product bug, but should be done on IDR shutdown and publish. User Store Properties URL: Might want to put a screenshot of the attributes screen of a web service user store so that a developer knows how this is used. Otherwise, they don't see how it plays into the IDR. User Detauls URL - I would put this after the User authentication URL section. Say that this happens after a user authenticates and these values are used to either pass to applications in the header or for access controls that have been put on application. User Authentication URL - Say that this happens each time a user authenticates to the IDR. This gives the developer a better picture of how often this page is called. Error Handling: The Web service MUST respond with a message.... instead of should respond. I would also do. I would also reformat the way that this section is to better match the other sections. I would have each error type have its own heading like is done for User Authentication, User Details, User Store Properties URL, etc.... This will drive home the importance of a properly formatted Error Type. In addition to changing the actual document, we need to provide sample code for a web service user store and Web Service Description Language (WSDL) that a developer could point to and implement all of these methods. This would make things much easier and ensure that it is implemented to our specifications. Last, it would be great to have a test script to where a URL can be plugged in and it tells them if they have implemented each page correctly. This could be part of the sample code.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Concur - Session Timeout with IDR
description: When a session timeout occurs with both the concur application and on the IDR in an IWA environment, clicking on the direct concur link will fail on force-sso and the symplified IDR will direct you back to the login.jsf screen with no redirect link embedded. If you login, you will get to the SSO portal and not to the concur landing page. With IWA, this should not do a redirect to login.jsf and instead do a redirect to the login Servlet to leverage IWA as IWA is ignored when the login.jsf page is accessed. The redirect should also be embedded within the login process so that the proper concur page can be "deep linked" when this condition occurs. This has been validated locally in an IWA environment using Moodys Concur configuration and account and is also occurring at Moodys. Confirmed that this is related to the inactivity timeout. If this timeout is increased to a value larger than the Concur timeout and a Concur timeout happens, you can deep link back into Concur. Please see Max for more specifics.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Continue Authentication of end users even if user store is unavailable.
description: The way user store hunting works (when you configure more than one user store), is not programmed to provide setting up a "back-up" user store. Specifically, if you have more thane one user stores configured, and one of them becomes unavailable, then when a user goes to authenticate, the downed user store times-out and the entire authentication process is aborted. So, no user will be able to login. Multiple user stores can be setup as user store objects. But at the application level, of all the user stores listed, if any of them are unavailable, users will not be able to login. This request is to change this functionality so that if multiple user stores are setp and the App and App Folder level, if one is unavailable, the others are used for Authentication. This will allow us to setup "back-up" user stores and our customers will get uninterrupted service if one of their user stores becomes unavailable. Thanks ---------------- Current work around is to leave only one user store setup at the app level. In the event the configured user store fails, you will have to change the configuration in SinglePoint Studio so that an available user store is active, and then publish. This would take a few minutes. All your existing user sessions would not be affected - during these few minutes of downtime, all that is affected is new users logging in.
name: Symplified, Inc.

So far only a few users have been impacted, but we have a small user pool for the application useing SSO. On October 11th we go production with Workday which will be used by all employees. subject: Docs - SimpleLink2
description: Some changes for the SimpleLink PDF included with the SimpleLink.zip bundle. This might also impact docs in SPS. 1) name of RPM file in zip doesn't match what is in doc 2) rpm process should actually use yum and not rpm to install. Command should be: yum localinstall SimpleLink.rpm --nogpgcheck. This will grab dependencies 3) should mention in the web config that ip of IDR should be the portal interface if an on prem is deployed 4) Need to include how to stop/start/check status of SimpleLink client 5) Should include how to turn off simplelink_configure as once a configuration is done, it doesn't need to be running.

subject: LIveOffice Freeze Issue
description: Good morning, Gentlemen... We?ve run into an issue rolling out Discovery Archive to our employees using Symplified?s single sign on tool. Having rolled it out to approximately 25 pilot users, we have encountered some problems with part of the population. While several users have been able to get into Discovery Archive without a hitch, several others have encountered freezing-up problems during sign in. Specifically, the symptom revolves around the login apparently succeeding, as the correct mailbox is opened, but the screen freezes during the painting process. The outer portions of the screen paint successfully...showing, for example, Bob Goalwin?s mailbox in the upper left corner of the interface. However, when Discovery Archive attempts to actually load the email records...displaying the circular processing icon...the icon eventually stops spinning...and the app locks up. For those who encounter the problem, the issue shows up when running both Internet Explorer 6 and Firefox 3.5.8. The same issue occurs when opening from a web folder within Outlook. The interesting thing is that for most of those encountering the problem, we can get the system to work every third or fourth attempt. Symplified folks...any idea what could be causing this from within your interface...? LiveOffice folks...have you encountered anything like this with your normal sign on...? Is there something that some of us may be running...or not running...that causes this problem for some and not others? We?d like to roll this out to the company as soon as possible, but can?t do so as it currently stands. Any help you can offer would be appreciated. Bob
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: amylin.peoplecapital.com link problem
description: Hi Josh ? We?re having an issue with People Capital SSO. The internal notifications that go out to non-PeopleCap users are created as described below. subject: Web Service New Auth Token Request
description: Post R7.7 Patch for Web Service Auth Token, after customer restarts IIS instance, the IDR still holds the old auth token. When this auth token is sent to the web service, the web service responds back that the auth token is invalid. This should trigger a new login by the IDR to get a new auth token, but the IDR is not performing this login. This will result in no end users being able to login with the web service. As a temporary fix, customer has trusted all requests with Web Service. This needs to be fixed ASAP so that security can be re-enabled for the web service. Every 8 hours the IDR seems to login to the Web Service to get a new auth token. If IIS restarts, the IDR should request this immediately.
name: Schumacher Group

subject: URL Rewrites in eLeap?
description: Hi Symplified support. Please see the message below. I'm cannot make the URLs below work, and we're guessing that Symplified may be modifying the request before it goes through to the eLeap server. Any insight you can provide? ----- Lincoln, Here's a sample link for completion reports for a course in our demo account: https://demo.2leap.com Link: https://demo.2leap.com/export_excel.php?report=users_progress&id_course=10030&sort=1&coloumn=Progress&usergroup=&start=&stop= According to my developers, it seems something is causing a local machine rewrite of this URL. This means its possible that even if you change the two highlighted values in the URL, it still might not work. I recommend talking to Symplified to see if they can add an override to the URL rewrite for your reports: Your link would be something like: https://merit.2leap.com/export_excel.php?report=users_progress&id_course=10030&sort=1&coloumn=Progress&usergroup=&start=&stop= ** You can take note of the course ID value, if you put your cursor over the [Export to excel] link. Sincerely, Don Weobong President Telania, Inc | eLeaP ------------------------------------------------------------ We're Here To Help! Hours: 8AM-8PM ET Mon-Fri & 9-5 Sat. Email: http://www.eleapsoftware.com/support.html US Phone: +1 502-291-4650 Live Text Chat: http://www.eleapsoftware.com/ 845 Barret Avenue, Ste 2, Louisville, KY 40204, USA

subject: Error joining domain, but Kerberos works
description: The following error will appear in the logs although the IDR does join the domain. The context box will not display that says "Joined to the Domain" but both IDRs are joined. This was seen when leaving and joining the domain. Mar 4 16:57:22 symsso1 lsassd[3374]: 0x30b0ffd0:Failed to load provider [] at [/opt/likewise/lib64/liblsass_auth_provider_local.so] [error code:32811] Mar 4 16:56:55 symsso2 lsassd[23272]: 0xf7c16fd0:Failed to load provider [] at [/opt/likewise/lib64/liblsass_auth_provider_local.so] [error code:32811] IWA has already previously been verified as working.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Logging access to SAML Direct Apps
description: Currently, when users try to access SAML Direct apps, it is not logged in symplified-audit.log. Each access attempt should be logged. Would also be good if the result of that access request is logged - allowed or denied.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Loss of Customer Keychain Feature
description: Post 7.5 upgrade, the Keychain feature on customers is disabled. This has impacted the following customers (some might have been fixed, so it might be all customers): Scriptlogic Merit Amylin 1DOT Amylin PoC Forest Pharm Ivie Mach16 Mach17v2 Perftest Schlumberger Schumacher Internal Singlepoint03 Singlepoint05 Symplified Home QA Canary Not an issue until a publish is performed, but still presents challenges after an upgrade unless all features for all customers are verified.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: CIFS/NFS Share info goes away when disabling Keychain Feature for HA Client
description: If you have an HA deployment and disable the keychain feature, the CIFS share is unmounted and the SPS gui will lose the info for the share. When re-enabling the feature, the CIFS share will not mount as no info is within SPS.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Loss of CIFS Share erases all Keychain data
description: When the heartbeat script for checking the CIFS/NFS share detects a failure and pauses the service, upon the service coming back up, all keychain data will be lost.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Access Denied Message when going to People Capital
description: When accessing People Capital, an access denied message is displayed. There are no access controls on this application at the current time.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Kerberos Authentication not working
description: Kerberos authentication fails and falls back to the portal login page.
name: Merit Medical Systems

subject: User cannot edit keychain
description: User had no option to edit keychain.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Google SAML Direct Adapter Questions
description: Question from customer about Google SAML Direct Users: Our MIS team is preparing to synchronize some network accounts with Google Apps for our worldwide distributors. Apparently, the network accounts were created such that their email addresses do not match their usernames (see below). What do you expect the results would be for the sso portal? Do we need to change these to make the email addresses match the usernames? Thanks, in advance, for your feedback.
name: Merit Medical Systems

subject: IdR not connecting to Cloud
description: When we switched our mgmt server to Viawest, the Merit IdR was connected. When it was rebooted for the BIOS upgrade, it lost connectivity. Ole believes this is because it went to re-find the mgmt server and since it is on a protected network, an IP-based firewall rule (set with the old mgmt IP) prevented it from connecting. Josh has contacted Kurt about a new fire rule. Kurt said he would open a ticket with his IT.
name: Pfizer

subject: IdR not connecting to Cloud
description: When we switched our mgmt server to Viawest, the Merit IdR was connected. When it was rebooted for the BIOS upgrade, it lost connectivity. Ole believes this is because it went to re-find the mgmt server and since it is on a protected network, an IP-based firewall rule (set with the old mgmt IP) prevented it from connecting. Ole will contact Jason Threft to modify their firewall.
name: Merit Medical Systems

subject: IdR Time synchronization not happening
description: Please make sure all IdR clocks are accurate at all times. When they are not, it causes issues with SAML connections (logins fail that should not).
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Test Ivie IdR Connectivity
description: There is a possibility that the next time Ivie publishes, their IdR will lose connectivity to our mgmt server. This is due to us moving the mgmt server to Viawest. It may be maintaining the VPN connection through the proxy IP, and the next publish will make it attemp the connection thru the mgmt IP. There is likely an IP based firewall rule that would prevent the IdR mgmt interface from talking out to the new mgmt server IP. Ole knows all the details.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Documentation: Web Service User Store
description: In SPUG, the web service user store section, step 5 says "If the user store is provided, check the Proxy checkbox". What does "if the user store is provided" mean? Do we mean to say something like "If the user store is accessed through a SimpleLink connection?" Please clarify this statement. Thanks.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Rally adapter does not allow for downloading of attachments
description: When clicking on an attachment within Rally, a blank screen will appear. If you right click to save the attachment, the attachment name will download, but it will be of no size.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: IWA Shortname Certificate Warning
description: After the 7.5 upgrade, IWA was toggled to use the shortname. This will result in certificate warnings as the certificates are wildcard certificates made for the domain of the customer. With shortname enabled, the IDR will do a redirect to https://shortname from https://shortname.domain.com.
name: Merit Medical Systems

subject: HA Configuration with IWA error page URL display
description: In a HA configuration, the URL will display the IDR name instead of the vip name when an error page is accessed. The VIP url should be displayed instead.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Certificate warning on Chrome and Safari
description: Customer experienced certificate warnings with chrome and safari after 7.5 upgrade
name: Merit Medical Systems

subject: Copying adapter doesn't copy associated authentication config
description: When copying an adapter in SPS, the associated authenticated config will not be copied for the customer. This will result in an access denied page being prompted and an error in the symplified.log when accessing the proxied application.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Timeout when publishing to IDR
description: Customer experienced timeout when publishing a configuration change to an IDR. The publish did go through, but the UI reported back a timeout.
name: Merit Medical Systems

subject: Eleap redirect to SSO Portal
description: Customer wanted access to the eleap application (customer specific domain name) to redirect to the SSO portal and wanted implementation advice.
name: Merit Medical Systems

subject: Documentation: SFDC User Store needs more info
description: In the Setup SFDC User Store section of SPUG, this is all that is said about the 'Type' drop down: Type - Select the appropriate type from the Type drop-down list. If you select 'Non self-service user', many more fields pop up. None of which are explained in the documentation. I do not know the details of this feature, but there needs to be more information on the difference between the two types, "Self-service User" and "Non self-service user". Then the fields that show up when "non self-service user" is selected need to be explained. Example text of what should be added for describing the "Type" field: ----------------- If "Self service user" is selected, this means that for a user to be able to Authenticate to the Identity Router, that user must have "Self-Service" enabled. Search on "managing self-service users" in Salesforce.com help for more information. If "Non self-service user" is selected, then you must know the table name your user information can be found in. You will have to decide which field in that table contains the username and which contains their password. [question for symplified - where do they find the table name?] ---------------- Thanks.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: User is locked out of AD on first login attempt to portal
description: A user who incorrectly enters his or her password will be locked out of AD on the first incorrect login attempt to the portal.
name: Merit Medical Systems

subject: Embedded Google Doc caused Redirect Loop in eLeap Application
description:
When accessing a Google document that has been embedded within the eLeap application without first logging into Google, an infinite loop will result in a page that keeps displaying the following in Internet Explorer (only). Within Firefox, there are no issues: HTTP/1.1 200 OK Date: Mon, 11 Jan 2010 21:37:44 GMT Server: Apache/2.2.14 (Unix) mod_ssl/2.2.14 OpenSSL/0.9.8e-fips-rhel5 mod_jk/1.2.26 Set-Cookie: SPBALANCEID=balancer.10.99.1.123; path=/; domain=.merit.com Content-Length: 3778 Keep-Alive: timeout=5, max=78 Connection: Keep-Alive Content-Type: text/html

You are being redirected automatically.
If not, then you do not have JavaScript enabled. Please click here:

Within an HTTP protocol analyzer, 3 pages will loop: 1) https://www.google.com/a/merit.com/ServiceLogin?service=writely&passive=true&nui=1&continue=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google.com%3A443%2Fa%2Fmerit.com%2FView%3Fid%3Ddchmpfqx_114fmr7r352 2) https://sso.merit.com/IdPServlet?idp_id=1ae3nu4x8bi23&SAMLRequest=fVLJTsMwEL0j8Q%2BW71lcLshqgkorRCWWiAYO3Fxn0po4tvE4Lfw9bgoCDnCznp%2FfMp7pxVuvyQ48KmsKytKcEjDSNspsCvpYXyXn9KI8PZmi6LXjsyFszQO8DoCBxJcG%2BXhR0MEbbgUq5Eb0gDxIvprd3vBJmnPnbbDSakqWi4LqzrRGbsX2xboOGrVuRb92bWebzry4rmmFNZ3bOEqevmJNDrGWiAMsDQZhQoRylic5SxirJ4yfnXPGnimpPp0ulTk2%2BC%2FW%2BkhCfl3XVVLdr%2BpRYKca8HeRXdCNtRsNqbT9wb4SiGoX4VZoBEpmiOBDDDi3Boce%2FAr8Tkl4fLgp6DYEhzzL9vt9%2Bi2TiSzyVDieJdJyHCwfu%2FkfE%2F0%2FufhypuW39jT7IVV%2Bftihx3JRWa3kO5lpbfdzDyLEEsEPscOV9b0If7uxlI2IapJ2pPLBoAOpWgUNJVl5dP29GXFfPgA%3D&RelayState=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fa%2Fmerit.com%2FServiceLogin%3Fservice%3Dwritely%26passive%3Dtrue%26nui%3D1%26continue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fdocs.google.com%253A443%252Fa%252Fmerit.com%252FView%253Fid%253Ddchmpfqx_114fmr7r352 3) https://www.google.com/a/merit.com/acs

subject: Get Access Error when trying to access applications from portal or direct links
description: Kelley at Pfizer sent an email on 1/5. She could not get into the D3 application - the portal replied with 'access denied'. I called her the morning of 1/6. I shared screens with her. When she was at the portal, there was no 'Edit Keychain' button. Turns out the the 'Keychain' feature in SPS was unchecked. I re-checked it, published, and everything is fine now. Her Keychain was not deleted, thank goodness.
name: Pfizer

subject: Documentation: SimpleLink Description
description: I ran this by Jay and he agreed that this would be a good change to make. Please change the paragraph directly under the 'SimpleLink Configuration' title (currently page 91) to read: SimpleLink is a container used to run component instances. The components are used to run a variety of services. The SimpleLink container enables an ID Router to securely access resources such as user stores that reside on a separate network than where the ID Router exists. This is particularly useful when a customer chooses the fully-hosted ID Router deployment and still wants to authenticate with a user store inside the corporate firewall.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Documentation: Web Service User Store Proxy Section
description: Under setup a web service user store, step 12 reads: "If the user store is provided, check the Proxy checkbox" Step 11, 5th bullet point down, also describes the proxy check box. Please pick one and eliminate the other.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Documentation: Google SAML instructions refer to SFDC
description: Page 61 in SPUG, under the 'Configure SAML in Google' section, "Before You Begin" sub-section, 3rd bullet down - says: "Have the URL you entered in the IDP URL textbox in the Configure Salesforce.com SAML..." Should read: "Have the URL you entered in the IDP URL textbox in the Configure Google SAML..."
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Documentation: System Administrators Description
description: Under the 'Administrators' section, under 'System Administrators', the last sentence reads: "Symplified Administrators can perform all of the tasks of that other administrator can perform" Should be something like: "Symplified Administrators can perform all of the tasks that other administrators can perform" Also - do we want a description of System Administrators in the SPUG? In the Ops Help manual for sure. But I don't think it is useful info for a customer admin to know. Thanks
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Documentaiton: Configure SimpleLink section duplicated in SPUG
description: Under the "SimpleLink Configuration" section, the "Configure a SimpleLink" subsection appears twice - the exact same steps.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Kerberos Authentication not working until after logout
description: Kerberos Authentication will not fire for Windows 7 64 bit IE client after extended timeout. Logging out and back into Windows will fix this issue.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Logout/Login of Merit SSO Portal
description: Once a user has logged in to the Merit SSO portal and has logged out but has not closed the browser, a login will not work and will redirect the user to the login screen with not error messages.
name: Merit Medical Systems

subject: D3 Admin adapter not working
description: The D3 Admin application is not working with the current D3 Admin adapter.
name: Pfizer

subject: 500 Error when accessing protected application or portal
description: The Identity Router is throwing a Java Null Pointer Exception when users are accessing either the portal or salesforce.com through a direct link (with ?singlepoint-force-sso=true) that is static on their portal. When the user initially sees this, they go to the portal or to Salesforce and are presented with a portal login page in Internet Explorer. The client is configured as IWA Kerberos. After seeing this and closing the browser, upon going back to the portal, a server 500 error will appear (please see attached).
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: eLeap Session Management with IE
description: When accessing eLeap from Internet Explorer (6, 7, 8), once a session has been closed any new attempts to create a session will result in the login screen. It appears that the ?singlepoint-force-sso=true flag will not force new cookies to be sent by eLeap.
name: Merit Medical Systems

subject: Keychain Auth Error Credentials Checkbox not rendering login form
description: When an application is accessed for the first time that throws a keychain authorization error, the form to enter username and password will not render correctly when the "Use Web site-specific login." is checked in IE 6, 7, and 8. This does work fine in Firefox 3.x. In order to get the login form to render, the user has to click the checkbox and then click on the page. This is NOT an issue for IE if the user does this through the edit keychain page. It is only an issue through the keychain auth error page which renders the credential form.
name: Merit Medical Systems

subject: Redirect to Portal when clicking on application
description: Customer clicked on Application within portal and was redirected back to the portal. The logs show that the cookie wasn't valid at the time that the customer clicked on the application. After some time, the customer was able to access the application
name: Merit Medical Systems

subject: Click on application - get logged out of portal
description: This morning, I went to the internal IdR. I went to the portal, logged in, clicked on the Google link, and was logged out of the portal.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: SFDC SAML (not direct) login issues
description: Customer is having an issue when trying to access SFDC link in Orange portal, gets redirected back to the portal landing page. This can tie back to SFDC case 1386. With this behavior, SAML never gets created to be sent to SFDC and the logs show the following: ==> /var/log/symplified/symplified.log <== 2009-11-25 14:22:08,088 [TP-Processor5] WARN com.symplified.application.appliance.portal.Error[78] - Invalid authorization error: NO_COOKIE, redirect to /portal.jsf 2009-11-25 14:22:08,094 [TP-Processor5] WARN com.symplified.application.appliance.portal.Error[178] - No application provided
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Google SAML Direct Error
description: When trying to go to Google via SAML Direct adapter, you will land on a Google Error page saying that the login was invalid. The SAML assertion looks good, but you are not able to access the google endpoint.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Link for portal not working
description: Anthony is an Australian user of SFDC. He started accessing SFDC through the IdR on 11/22. On the morning of 11/23, he reported that he could get to the portal (leveraging Kerberos), but when he clicked on the Salesforce link, it just kept taking him to the portal. He as able to ping and telnet 443 to salesforce.scriptlogic.local. In the afternoon, he was asked to clear his cookies and restart his web browser. He said he already tried it, but would try again. It did make the problem go away and he can now access SFDC again.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Kerberos not working
description: Bobbi goes to symplified.scriptlogic.local and gets the sign-in page, not the portal page. If she enters her credentials, she is sent back to the login page, not the portal page. She is using IE8 running on Windows 7. The following fixed the issue on her machine: In IE 8. Cleared cookies Went to portal Still didn?t work Closed browser Opened browser Can now get to portal
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Publish Error - Unable to Access Data
description: The HTTP Invoker Service error appears to be gone since R7. Those tickets have been closed. I have recieved the attached "Unable to Access Data" error twice today in the Singlepoint02 environment. I have published probably 20 times today total.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Documentation: SFDC SAML instructions are for old UI
description: On page 54 of the SPUG (SinglePoint User Guide), are instructions for setting up SFDC SAML. The instructions seem to be old instructions and include screen shots of the old UI.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Google SAML Direct: Menu URL not properly populating
description: When you create a new Google SAML Direct application, the menu URL populates with this: https://mail.google.com/STANDIN-COMPANY-NAME If a company fills in their name at 'Standin-company-name', the app does not work. If the menu URL is initially populated with this: https://mail.google.com/a/STANDIN-COMPANY-NAME then is works. The difference is the "/a" after mail.google.com. Setting this to low priority, since is easily remedied by someone who knows what they are doing.

subject: Deep linking to protected app with IE after browser window close
description: When a user deep links into an application and then closes the browser window and goes back to a deep link, the user will be taken back to the portal or to the login page of the application (if SAML). This issue will not occur when using firefox or safari with the force-sso=true flag set but WILL occur with Internet explorer even with the flag set. To replicate: 1) Deep link into an application via IE (bookmark or shortcut should include ?singlepoint-force-sso=true) 2) Close the browser 3) Deep link back into the application from IE (bookmark or shortcut should include ?singlepoint-force-sso=true)
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Custom Portal Not Coming Up
description: Sometimes when a user logs into the portal, they do not see a list of applications - they only see the 'Edit Keychain' and 'Log Out' button. There were two applications that had self-signed certs loaded - cubetree and Projity. We loaded real certs from Projity into the cubetree application. Serena generated their certs differently, so we're not sure if the certs they loaded were actually good. They renamed a .csr to a .key. We published that, and now a 'Failed to Connect' error happens whenever we try to go to sso-portal.serena.com or sso.serena.com. Next, we tried disabling the cubetree application, then published, and we get the same error. Next, we tried removing certs altogether from the cubetree application. And now we can't publish. We got 4 publish errors in a row. I left it with Sean at that. We agreed to address it during tomorrow morning's call at 10 AM.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Concur Adapter Not prompting for login credentials
description: I just created an adapter for Concur using Handler: singlepoint-authn-adapter-form-1.0.20 and of type 'Concur'. If you click on the application in the application portal and you have not yet edited your keychain, you get an access error message, rather than the screen that asks for application-specific credentials. If you go the main portal page, then edit your keychain, and for Concur, click 'Use application specific credentials' (but don't enter any creds), then click save, go back to main portal, click on the Concur application, you get the screen that asks for application-specific credentials. If an application is clicked on from the main portal page and the SSO creds don't work, the user should see the screen that asks for specific credentials, not just an access error page. By the way, the above behavior is the same if the adapter used for the Concur application is discovered instead of using Handler: singlepoint-authn-adapter-form-1.0.20.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Mysterious Login Not Working Issue
description: Topher asked to open a ticket about this. Both he and Colin reviewed it on 5/22/09. The problem is, we don't know how to recreate it. What we know is this: Sometimes you can login and then not explicitly logout. Then when you go back to the portal (portal-12.simplemach.com) you get sent to the login page (as you should). Problem is you enter the correct credentials, but you are redirected back to the login page with the message the creds were invalid. When you look at watchlogs, it says the user is Authenticated. We know these things about this: 1. We see it on the 12DOT user and router that is currently attached to production. This is the trial environment for Serena. 2. It only happens if you don't explicitly logout (as far as we can tell). 3. It does not appear to be related to the 'Inactivity Timeout' setting at the customer level in SPS. I say this because we changed that setting to 5 seconds and let a user get a force logout and the login problem did not happen. 4. It does not appear to be related to the portal-12.simplemach.com "singlepoint" cookie. I say this because we deleted that one cookie and the problem still existed. 5. subject: Appliances exposed to continuous high load stop functioning
description: This issues is already known by KC and Colin. This ticket is being opened to provide monitoring of this issue. A singlepoint appliance exposed to high load, such as in load testing, will stop functioning, returning internal server errors and so forth. Examination of the running system shows that the utilizied memory is very high, even when no load is running after being exposed to high load, and this condition, if pushed beyond RAM limits, will utilize swap space, thus exhausting the systems ability to respond to anything in a timely manner. A "service singlepoint force-stop", followed by a "service singlepoint start" will clear out this problem, however, in one test case, the force-stop took more than 5 minutes due to the amount of swap being released.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Application types owned by Symplified don't work for children of Symplified
description: If an application type, lets say, Concur or Salesforce, is created as being owned by Symplified, this application becomes available to all child companies of Symplified. However, if an application is created using these children, any attempts to use the adapter result in unsatisfactory login results, such as broken logins, failures and so forth. If that particular application type is edited and the owner is changed to match the owner of that application using it, the application type works perfectly. If the ownership of that application type is changed back to Symplified afterwards, and the application using this adapter is re-published, that application breaks. At no point does the application appear to show any changes - so it appears that the application type remains properly connected in the scheme of things, however, the adapter seems to just not be present when it's owned by Symplified. Please note that this behavior was seen my KC and myself on-site and Data Domain, and this behavior has been verified in the demo environment on both the SalesForce and Xactly adapter types. Colin has seen this behavior and said that it should be submitted as a bug, and a fairly serious one at that.

subject: Customer1 context sees Customer2 User Store
description: Last night, I was working on setting up a new customer/POC, "Classified Ventures"I'd set context to them, and once the (new, VMWare) IDR had connected successfully, I clicked into their User Stores. There, I saw one that I hadn't set up, called "DR IdR." Clicking into it, I saw PBCS's User Store configuration (see screenshot). I have never looked at this User Store and I had not set context to that customer, earlier. When I saw this, I mentioned it to Ole, who logged in and looked and did NOT see the PBCS User Store in CV's customer context. After I reset context and then set context to Classified Ventures again, I also did not see it. At the time, I thought maybe someone had accidentally created the User Store in the wrong place temporarily and then fixed their mistake, but I checked within our team and nobody else (including the engineer working on PBCS) has set context to Classified Ventures.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Re: Salesforce Delegated Authentication
description: Hi Cameron,That adapter is now enabled. You can activate and configure it by logging into SinglePoint Studio and clicking the Applications tab. From there, click "New Trust Fabric" and you should see the Delegated Authentication icon for SFDC.Please let me know if you have any other questions.I apologize for our tardiness on the reply, we just transitioned support systems and this request got a little lost in the shuffle.Thanks,MatthewOn Tue, Jul 12, 2011 at 6:17 PM, McWethy, Cameron <[mailto:Cameron.McWethy@amylin.com] Cameron.McWethy@amylin.com> wrote:Per the information outlined below please enable the SFDC Delegated Authentication adapter for our environment so we can begin testing it.Thank you,CameronFrom: Matthew Boeckman [mailto:[mailto:mboeckman@symplified.com]] [mailto:mboeckman@symplified.com]Sent: Friday, March 18, 2011 1:00 PMTo: Reynolds, Scott; Swartz, JerryCc: Joshua FormanSubject: Salesfoce Delegated AuthenticationGuys,Thank you for your time on the call today. I've attached our baseline SFDC Delegated Authentication document for you to review. This should guide you through what's necessary from a network, SFDC, and symplified standpoint to enable that functionality.Currently this adapter is not live in your environment, when you are ready to use it, please send a request to [mailto:support@symplified.com] support@symplified.com and one of us can flip that switch for you.Please feel free to shoot any followup questions you may have my way.-Matthew-- Matthew BoeckmanSr. Solutions Engineer[tel:303.318.4156] 303.318.4156[mailto:mboeckman@symplified.com] mboeckman@symplified.comReachSymplified Support[http://www.symplified.com/supportportal] hereor call: [tel:303-318-4188] 303-318-4188 option 2Symplified |The Cloud Security Company[http://www.symplified.com] http://www.symplified.com-- Matthew BoeckmanSr. Solutions Engineer[tel:303.318.4156] 303.318.4156[mailto:mboeckman@symplified.com] mboeckman@symplified.comReachSymplified Support[http://www.symplified.com/supportportal] hereor call: [tel:303-318-4188] 303-318-4188 option 2Symplified |The Cloud Security Company[http://www.symplified.com] http://www.symplified.com

subject: Policy engine does not evaluate Boolean type from SFDC correctly.
description: SFDC "checkbox" data types are evaluated by the User store object as boolean. Building a policy from that attribute to deny when false, permit when true, permit when not false or deny when not true all fail. Logs to symplified.log at debug:2011-07-14 15:06:46,492 [TP-Processor2] DEBUG com.symplified.service.shared.policyengine.AppliancePolicyRule[217] - evaluate: (Product_Registration_Provisioned__c [true] EQUAL [true]) == INDETERMINATE2011-07-14 15:06:46,492 [TP-Processor2] DEBUG com.symplified.service.shared.policyengine.AppliancePolicy[173] - ]) == INDETERMINATE2011-07-14 15:06:46,492 [TP-Processor2] DEBUG com.symplified.service.shared.policyengine.AppliancePolicyOwner[586] - ]) == DENY_ACCESSChanging the mapped data type to string instead of boolean is worse:/var/log/symplified/symplified.log.1:2011-07-15 11:01:12,097 [TP-Processor9] DEBUG com.symplified.service.shared.policyengine.AppliancePolicyRule[217] - evaluate: (Product_Registration_Provisioned__c [<null>] EQUAL [true]) == NOT_APPLICABLE/var/log/symplified/symplified.log.1:2011-07-15 11:01:12,097 [TP-Processor9] DEBUG com.symplified.service.shared.policyengine.AppliancePolicyRule[217] - evaluate: (Product_Registration_Provisioned__c [<null>] EQUAL [true]) == NOT_APPLICABLEThis is blocking all application permissions for customer dolby.

javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:637) at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717) at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:290) at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206) at com.symplified.application.appliance.DisableSessionUrlFilter.doFilter(DisableSessionUrlFilter.java:66) at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:235) at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206) at org.apache.jk.common.ChannelSocket$SocketConnection.runIt(ChannelSocket.java:889) at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.ThreadPool$ControlRunnable.run(ThreadPool.java:690) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)Caused by: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: There is insufficient system memory in resource pool 'internal' to run this query. at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException.makeFromDatabaseError(SQLServerException.java:197) at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatement.getNextResult(SQLServerStatement.java:1493) at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerStatement.executeStatement(SQLServerStatement.java:154) at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerPreparedStatement.executeQueryInternal(SQLServerPreparedStatement.java:296) at com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDatabaseMetaData.getResultSetFromStoredProc(SQLServerDatabaseMetaData.java:284) at Failed to lookup server ip for ldap.zurichna.comjava.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1 at com.symplified.service.shared.virtualuserstore.ldap.ApplianceLdapUserStore.getServerAddress(ApplianceLdapUserStore.java:305) at com.symplified.service.shared.policyengine.ApplianceCustomer.getRoutingPolicies(ApplianceCustomer.java:750) at com.symplified.service.appliance.network.NetworkServiceImpl.loadConfig(NetworkServiceImpl.java:115) at com.symplified.service.shared.AbstractStatefulService.refresh(AbstractStatefulService.java:226) at com.symplified.service.shared.manager.ServiceManagerImpl.refreshWithDependencies(ServiceManagerImpl.java:527) at com.symplified.service.shared.manager.ServiceManagerImpl.reload(ServiceManagerImpl.java:268) at com.symplified.service.shared.manager.ServiceManagerImpl.reload(ServiceManagerImpl.java:246) at com.symplified.service.appliance.core.ApplianceServiceImpl$PushThread.run(ApplianceServiceImpl.java:882)2011-07-11 14:23:51,278 [Thread-315] WARN com.symplified.service.shared.virtualuserstore.ldap.ApplianceLdapUserStore[310] - Failed to lookup server ip for ldap.zurichna.comjava.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1 at com.symplified.service.shared.virtualuserstore.ldap.ApplianceLdapUserStore.getServerAddress(ApplianceLdapUserStore.java:305) at com.symplified.service.shared.policyengine.ApplianceCustomer.getRoutingPolicies(ApplianceCustomer.java:750) at com.symplified.service.appliance.network.NetworkServiceImpl.loadConfig(NetworkServiceImpl.java:115) at com.symplified.service.shared.AbstractStatefulService.refresh(AbstractStatefulService.java:226) at com.symplified.service.shared.manager.ServiceManagerImpl.refreshWithDependencies(ServiceManagerImpl.java:527) at com.symplified.service.shared.manager.ServiceManagerImpl.reload(ServiceManagerImpl.java:268) at com.symplified.service.shared.manager.ServiceManagerImpl.reload(ServiceManagerImpl.java:246) at com.symplified.service.appliance.core.ApplianceServiceImpl$PushThread.run(ApplianceServiceImpl.java:882)I suspect these are caused by the fact that ldap.zurichna.com resolves to 2 IPs:[root@my ~]# nslookup ldap.zurichna.comServer: 127.0.0.1Address: 127.0.0.1#53Name: ldap.zurichna.comAddress: 206.252.76.40Name: ldap.zurichna.comAddress: 206.252.76.41It seems like that particular user store does actually still work alright (those errors have been from the beginning of time), but we don't seem to be handling the multiple IPs gracefully, and I'm concerned that we wouldn't handle failover if one of the IPs went down.
