subject: Re: Salesforce Delegated Authentication
description: Cameron,Both of your IdR's are back online and have your new cert. I will follow-up in the morning with additional information.Regards,AveryOn Thu, Jul 28, 2011 at 6:11 PM, McWethy, Cameron <Cameron.McWethy@amylin.com> wrote:Please open a support case and assign a support engineer to be available for our SSL certificate upgrade this evening at 8pm Pacific.I’m requesting the following:·Contact name/number to contact in event of problems with certificate installation – The instructions below are great. We don’t need someone to walk us through the change, but we need somebody available by phone in short order if we run into problems.·Symplified support to back up our current certificate for purposes of rollback prior to the change. Thanks!Cameron McWethyPrincipal Network EngineerAmylin Pharmaceuticals, Inc.C: 858 518-7228From: Matthew Boeckman [mailto:mboeckman@symplified.com] Sent: Thursday, July 28, 2011 6:58 AMTo: McWethy, CameronCc: Swartz, JerrySubject: Re: Salesforce Delegated AuthenticationCameron -The process to upload the new key/cert pair is very straightforward and is accomplished via the UI of the SPS tool. We are happy to perform the upload for you given some lead time on scheduling. I do not know that we'd be available after midnight Mountain or before 6 Mountain to do the install, so if your maintenance has to occur between those hours you will likely have to perform the update.The procedure specifically is to login to SPS as an administrator, click the "Edit Profile" link, then upload the key and cert under the "My Company" tab. Save the changes, then Publish.We can backup the existing certs for a quick rollback in case something goes wrong.I would suggest we coordinate when you are planning to roll it over - our team is available 24x7, but prefer to be aware of potential issues in advance.Let me know how the change control discussion goes and we can plan from there.I do not have a firm commitment or answer yet on the sandbox functionality. Hope to get some better traction today.-MatthewOn Wed, Jul 27, 2011 at 4:42 PM, McWethy, Cameron <Cameron.McWethy@amylin.com> wrote:Matt,We need to discuss the certificate installation during a change control meeting tomorrow morning in order to meet SalesForce regulatory test deadlines. Please answer the bolded questions below ASAP so I can accurately describe the change and associated risks. If you aren’t the best person to work with on this deployment please let me know who I should contact. It is important we have confidence that the certificate replacement will go smoothly with limited down time. Also, any word on the roadmap for the SFDC “sandbox” capability? Thanks,CameronFrom: McWethy, Cameron Sent: Tuesday, July 26, 2011 2:33 PMTo: 'Matthew Boeckman'Cc: Swartz, JerrySubject: RE: Salesforce Delegated AuthenticationMatt,We have an existing wildcard certificate we can use. I’ve got the full cert chain including private key in a .pem file. I’ve also broken it up into a separate key and cert file with OpenSSL which includes the full certificate chain. There are lots of certificate format options. What is the preferred method for installation? Should I have a preemptive ticket open with support in case there are problems?Is there a simple way to back up the existing certificate on the appliances for rollback? Thanks,CameronFrom: Matthew Boeckman [mailto:mboeckman@symplified.com]Sent: Tuesday, July 26, 2011 10:48 AMTo: McWethy, CameronCc: Swartz, JerrySubject: Re: Salesforce Delegated AuthenticationThe wildcard approach is our heavily favored approach. You have hit the nail on the head with SAN - you need a name for every possible app. Currently, you are running:mailarchivepeoplecapitalworkdaysymssosymsso1symsso2.amylin.comSo, at the least the SAN would have to cover those + "sfdc-delegated.amylin.com" or something similar. The obvious limitation/issue here is that you have to update and resign a cert with each new app. Some customers have adopted a generic app naming convention to get around this, and just register app01, app02, app03...app0X.Either approach is valid, but if you are OK with a wildcard it is our suggested approach.-MatthewOn Tue, Jul 26, 2011 at 11:18 AM, McWethy, Cameron <Cameron.McWethy@amylin.com> wrote:Let's do option one. Your assistance in generating the CSR would only be required if there are special considerations for the certificate (including special SAN considerations). If we direct people to the IDR using FQDNs in the format of appname.amylin.com do we need a SAN for every possible app name to prevent browser warnings? If so, this might be a good candidate for using our wildcard certificate. Any risks with that approach?CameronOn Jul 26, 2011, at 9:17 AM, "Matthew Boeckman" <mboeckman@symplified.com> wrote:Cameron,Sorry for my delay, I was out sick yesterday.You can upload a new certificate and keypair in SinglePoint Studio by clicking the "Edit Profile" link in the top righthand corner of the display. The default tab presented should have thaPlease open the attachment to view the entire email.

subject: User Logged out of Taleo after opening a resume
description: When using Taleo, if a end user clicks on a resume submitted by a job applicant, they are logged out of Taleo and prompted with a Taleo login screen. This only happens when the following conditions are met.* User is using IE* IWA is enabled in IE* The document the user is opening is a Microsoft Office word document (.doc or .docx)Taleo only allows a user to have one session. If a user logs into Taleo and creates a second session, Taleo logs the user out of the first session. It appears that a second session maybe getting created when a user clicks on a MS document (only in IE). This issue does not present itself when a user opens a PDF in any browser or if a user uses IWA in Firefox to open an MS Word document.

subject: IWA Working Incorrectly
description: When a user accesses SSO using a browser with IWA enabled, they are receiving a box that prompts them for their domain credentials. If IWA is not enabled, they are not receiving this prompt box. IWA is enabled by subnets (10.0.0.0 / 255.0.0.0) and this still occurs. This was independently confirmed using multiple machines that have never been joined to the domain.
name: Palm Beach County School District

subject: Unable to log in
description: When I try to log into http://singlepoint.symplified.net, I get an error message:Session timed out either due to inactivity or max session limit (E10350643).Any ideas what may be causing this? This occurs from several computers and different browsers. Also I have cleaned out the cache.I also have been unable to log into our production site today with mailto:jeff.meanor@palmbeachschools.org. Could you please reset my password?Thanks.Jeff Meanormailto:Jeff.Meanor@PalmBeachSchools.orgHome of Florida's first LEED Gold Certified SchoolUnder Florida law, e-mail addresses are public records. If you do not want your e-mail addressreleased in response to a public records request, do not send electronic mail to this entity. Instead, contact this office by phone or in writing.
name: Palm Beach County School District

subject: Need new Runway adapter staged into SP14
description: Stephanie has been working with a new adapter called Runway for this prospect. Need it to be staged in their SP14 environment so that I can configure it.Thanks!Carla
name: Symplified SE Team

subject: Keychain Creds in Plain Text!!
description: Prospect in SP22 playing with TC. Created new app called New Balance, and is having issues. But when I looked at his keychain the pwd is in plain text! Help!Carla
name: Symplified SE Team

subject: Page Redirect for Expired Sessions
description: Is it possible to choose the page to which users aredirected once a session has expired? Currently, are users are directed to theSymplified login portal with the ribbon when the active session has timed out. Is it possible to direct users to a page within ourfirewall? Christopher CheaversHuman ResourcesSpecialist | Employee RelationsVisiting NurseService of New York(212) 609-7908
name: Visiting Nurse Service of NY

description: Huma - I have been traveling and just returned to the office. I am leaving for vacation tomorrow, and have cc'd the support team to help move this forward for you next week.In the meantime - Ashish - the current search root we are using isOU=Domain User Accounts,DC=VNSNY,DC=ORG - new attributes for these users need to be within that search root.What you sent me is not an attribute - when you define the attribute in the proper scope, please pass along the attribute name we should use. subject: Your salesforce.com Activation Email
description: Dear support@symplified.com,You have requested access to salesforce.com from an unknown device. Use the verification code below within 24 hours to activate this device.Verification Code: 78020IMPORTANT: If you have not requested to activate a device, or believe you have received this message in error, please contact salesforce.com support (support@salesforce.com) immediately.What does "activation" mean? Should I activate this computer?Activation helps reduce the risk of security issues related to login. Activating this computer helps salesforce.com recognize this computer when you use it to access salesforce.com. You should activate this computer if it is owned by you or your employer and you are confident it is free of malware.

subject: SAML only passing one of AD groups in assertion
description: VNSNY needs to pass the AD groups to a SAML application (so the application can determine what access the user should have). It appears that when using either virtualGroups or memberOf, the SAML assertion only includes the last group in the list. For example, I have a user who is a member of Domain Users, Sales, and Another Group, but only the "Another Group" is being passed in the assertion.I was able to reproduce this by creating a bogus SAML 2 Generic adapter that's IdP-initiated and extending the SAML attribute contract and adding 2 attributes -- one for memberOf and one for virtualGroups. I then attempted to access this application from the ribbon portal, which generated an assertion. I confirmed that the assertion only included the last group name in both the virtualgroups and memberof attributes.
name: Symplified, Inc.

The second uses port 7001. And it doesn't work. When I click on the icon for the second application I actually see the internal name for the first application. It is very weird. If I remove the application and web server for the application running on port 80 the application on port 7001 works. But when I re-enable the application on port 80 the one on port 7001 stops working. More details of the setup in my sandbox.Contract Management -->http://app02.singlepoint12.com/-->http://eppmr8.managedsp.com:7001/using httpP6 -->http://app03.singlepoint12.com/-->http://eppmr8.managedsp.com/using httpI can login to P6 and it all works but when I click on CM it times out. But the url that it is trying to go to is app03 which is the web server for the other application. This seems like a bug to me. subject: Potential Security Vulnerability Reported
description: Guys, We have a Security Company that does Quarterly Vulnerability scans on our Perimeter network. They came back with this vulnerability below in which the Two IDR’s were flagged with. Not sure if this is a false positive but wanted to give you guys a heads up in case it is applicable. Sean From: Charlie Kerekes [mailto:charliekerekes@pileum.com] Sent: Thursday, August 18, 2011 11:42 AMTo: Peltier, SeanCc: Elizabeth FrazierSubject: TSG new HIGH severity issue - Apache < 2.2.15 Multiple VulnerabilitiesImportance: High Sean, During the most recent monthly scan, our tools have discovered a High severity issue with two of the TSG hosts:  Apache < 2.2.15 Multiple VulnerabilitiesDescription: According to its banner, the version of Apache 2.2 installed on the remote host is older than 2.2.15. Such versions are potentially affected by multiple vulnerabilities :§ A TLS renegotiation prefix injection attack is possible. (CVE-2009-3555)§ The 'mod_proxy_ajp' module returns the wrong status code if it encounters an error which causes the back-end server to be put into an error state. (CVE-2010-0408)§ The 'mod_isapi' attempts to unload the 'ISAPI.dll' when it encounters various error states which could leave call-backs in an undefined state. (CVE-2010-0425)§ A flaw in the core sub-request process code can lead to sensitive information from a request being handled by the wrong thread if a multi-threaded environment is used. (CVE-2010-0434) Risk Factor: HIGHRemedy:§ Upgrade Apache to version 2.2.15 or later. Related Links:§ http://httpd.apache.org/security/vulnerabilities_22.html§ https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=48359§ http://www.apache.org/dist/httpd/CHANGES_2.2.15 Vulnerable Host IP Addresses:§ 24.249.95.198§ 24.249.95.199

subject: custom portal referrer question
description: Andrew Silliker is trying to ascertain the accessed application using a custom portal:Can I tell what application has been invoked to initiate the login process? For instance, if I directly access an application URL, ie https://portal.singlepoint10.com/IdPServlet?idp_id=1dd8tjsb7ppvy, can I see that I accessed that salesforce application when my login page is invoked? Another example is if I access an HTTP-Fed URL for a particular application, ie https://app02.singlepoint10.com/portal.aspWhen I dump all headers and session info that my login.jsp sees, I can't see the invoked application. Boeckman reply:We've talked about this once before with a customer, and basically what you'd have to do is manually maintain a lookup somewhere of "idp_id=xxx" || "appXX.domain.com" and check the referrer state to get at it. It's not very clean I admit, and no one is doing it currently, but that approach would, I believe, work. Andrew reply:The referrer approach was what I was initially was going to take, but it doesn't seem to bear itself out in reality.My experience is that I'm not seeing a referrer header populated at the login.jsp when an application is requested. I've placed the headers I'm seeing at the bottom of this note. I only see referrer populated if I access the main IdR URL, ie portal.singlepoint10.com, the I'll see a referrer of /portal/ribbon/iwa.htmlThe JSON blob of authorized application is passed to the configured portal pages *AFTER* authentication. I'm looking at determining the *REQUESTED* application, so I can my IdP selection *BEFORE* authentication.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Switching web servers between applications 'sticks'
description: Switching webservers between a Trust Fabric adapter and an HTTP-Fed discovery application seems to cause the web server to stick. To recreate:1. Create adapter (tested using SAP) and assign webserver2. Publish3. Create HTTP-Fed app for the same application and assign the same webserver4. Remove webserver from adapter5. PublishThe logs should show that the Trust Fabric adapter is still being used even though the webserver is now assigned to the discovered application.Tested at Forest on 8.10 using SAPPortal adapter & HTTP-Fed

subject: Shorter Recycle Bin Retention Limit & Reduction
description: Shorter Recycle Bin Retention Limit & Reduction  You are receiving this email because our records indicate you are an administrator of a Salesforce CRM Org. Product & Service Notification Org ID: 00D500000007EiFDear Symplified,At salesforce.com, Trust is our top priority, and it is our goal to improve the performance of our Recycle Bin functionality. With that in mind, we are making some changes to the Recycle Bin limits to provide you with a faster user experience.What is the change and how does it impact me? We are lowering the Recycle Bin retention period from 30 days to 15 days. The Recycle Bin link in the sidebar will now let you restore recently deleted records for 15 days before they are permanently deleted.Additionally, we are lowering the Recycle Bin record limit from 250 times your storage to 25 times your storage. For example, if your organization has 1 GB of storage then your limit is 25 times 1000 MB or 25,000 records. If your organization reaches its Recycle Bin limit, Salesforce will automatically remove the oldest records if they have been in the Recycle Bin for at least two hours.When is this change taking effect? The lower Recycle Bin retention period will go into effect with the Winter '12 Release.What action must I take? There is no action necessary on your part.How can I get more information? Please contact Customer Support or your Customer Success Manager for any additional questions or concerns.Best regards, salesforce.com Customer Support Copyright 2000-2011 salesforce.com - All rights reserved. Salesforce and the "no software" logo are registered trademarks of salesforce.com, inc., and salesforce.com owns other registered and unregistered trademarks. Other names used herein may be trademarks of their respective owners. Salesforce.com, inc. The Landmark @ One Market, Suite 300, San Francisco, CA, 94105, United States[http://notify.salesforce.com/pub/as?_ri_=X0Gzc2X%3DUQpglLjHJlTQzeBQihssQihWdQhJ8QJrzei2QGQfQ96wVXHkMX%3Dw&_ei_=.]

subject: Fwd: Symplified POC Update
description: Guys,Can I get the OWA 2007 Adapter added to Zynga's environment? It might be listed under an "alternate" name. Andrew said he used this one on the DSM deal and said it had a DSM logo (not sure if that is helpful).Brian---------- Forwarded message ----------From: Andy Lee<alee@zynga.com>Date: Tue, Aug 30, 2011 at 6:39 PMSubject: RE: Symplified POC UpdateTo: Brian Gaffney <bgaffney@symplified.com>Currently we are on OWA 2007. However, we will be moving to Exchange 2010/OWA 2010 within the next couple quarters.Thanks,AndyFrom: Brian Gaffney [mailto:bgaffney@symplified.com] Sent: Tuesday, August 30, 2011 5:41 PMTo: Andy LeeSubject: Re: Symplified POC UpdateIs that OWA 2007 or 2010? We have an adapter for the 2007 versions. If that is what you are using then I can add the adapter to your environment. I will get to these other questions this evening.BrianOn Tue, Aug 30, 2011 at 11:25 AM, Andy Lee <alee@zynga.com> wrote:Thank you very much for the info. It was pretty much what I expected but I just wanted to verify. How can we create this custom view to group AD integrated/non-AD integrated solutions and their respective passwords? Also, would it be possible for an admin to set the username and password of a user’s keychain or keychain group? This way, when a user is onboarded and needs access to a completely outside system, the admin would create the user account and an obnoxiously long yet secure password. Can this password be pre-entered into Symplified so the user would never have to change it? Can the entry be automated or batch processed?OWA version: 8.2.234.1Thanks,AndyFrom: Brian Gaffney [mailto:bgaffney@symplified.com] Sent: Tuesday, August 30, 2011 10:01 AMTo: Andy LeeSubject: Re: Symplified POC UpdateGood to hear you are making progress. Let me know if you need any help from me. See my answers inline below:On Mon, Aug 29, 2011 at 3:34 PM, Andy Lee <alee@zynga.com> wrote:Hi Brian,We were able to get to our MDM portal attached using HTTP-Fed without an issue. I actually got Crowd to partially work. It logs in, but won’t go to the correct landing page. We think it’s more of a Crowd issue than Symplified. I don’t think we need a specialized connector – we just need to figure out where to land.I was actually trying to get our webmail, Exchange Outlook Web Access, to connect with HTTP-Fed but it wasn’t picking up any fields. Any pointers there?>> What version of OWA are you using. Let me check on that one, we might have an application specific adapter for it.We’ll be working on zScaler and Blackline SAML shortly. I’ll let you know when those guys get back to us.Question: 1.)With every HTTP-Fed/SAML application, will the user need to type in an initial password or can we pass through the AD creds?>> Each user has a key chain. Each key in the key chain is an encrypted file that contains their credentials they use to login to a specific application. When an application uses SAML, the IdR does not need a key and therefore no key chain entry is required (no action by an admin or a user required).When the IdR uses HTTP-FED to sign into the application it needs to replay the login ceremony ... imitate the user's post sequence ... and therefore needs access to the clear text version of the credentials. Since AD stores a hash of the password, the IdR cannot recover the credential and therefore cannot replay the credential. By default, the setting of keys is done on an application by application basis.Setting of the key chains can also be a custom view. This allows the user to do password synchronization for a bunch of applications ... user thinks they are updating one password BUT they are actually setting up key chain entries for many different applications. You might have a form for each "family" of applications. Set here for "AD Applications", Set here for "Attlassian Crown" applications (assuming they are not driven by AD. You might just have a single page to use a universal key in all applications and make it based on AD username or password. Those choices are up to you based on your security policy.So ...either the user needs to update the key chain or the administrator updates the key chain (some companies actually block the setting of these credentials by the user) or use a mix.Does that help? 2.)How do we handle authentication if the web application pops up a Window as in standard basic web authentication. For example, in Firefox: http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/web/library/wa-pz-security/basic_auth.jpg>> No Problem, just create an Http-Basic Adapter instead of HTTP-FED. Should be on the right hand side of the Trust Connector page. It functions similar to HTTP-FED in that you have a key chain entry, the difference being in the way that information is passed to the application.3.)What can you tell me about SSO to Go. iPads, iPhones, Androids, and Android tablets are huge here.>> SSO to Go is more of a marketing campaign than a technology. The features allow you to mark some application to be accessible to mobile devices (iOS things, Andriod things, etc). The SSO is still web based (as opposed to a native OS specific application) but the form factor for the user experience is more appropriate for the device. I see customer using this when the rely heavily on IWA but now all the execs have iPads ..Please open the attachment to view the entire email.
name: Symplified SE Team

subject: SAML login from deeplink
description: We are using Cornerstone as our application, and we are trying to enable deep-linking (link within their website) with our Symplified SSO IDP. They have a feature, where we can redirect back to our Symplified Login page, and pass it redirect link as a parameter.Is it possible for the IdpServlet servlet. What we would like to see happen is for our Custom Portal Login Page to prompt for their username/password, and then do a SAML assertion login and redirect to the URL passed by parameter. I've looked at singlepoint-next-redirect parameter, but that does not seem to be a direct URL, but a GUID. Is there a way that we can have the IdpServlet redirect directly to the link after doing a IDP-Initiated SAML Login to their application. We've already configured a SAML Login to their main portal page, but would like for the SAML-based deep-linking to work as well.Thanks,Steve Bowers
name: BMC Software, Inc.

subject: Winter '12 Release Scheduled Maintenance Notification
description: Winter '12 Release Scheduled Maintenance Notification   You are receiving this email because our records indicate you are an administrator of a Salesforce CRM Org. Product & Service Notification RE: Org ID 00D500000007EiFDear Symplified, Salesforce.com is committed to providing a highly available service to our customers. We are committed to continued investments to increase the overall uptime of our service, to deliver optimal value to our customers. With that, we are excited to announce a major advancement in this area for our major releases, effective with our Winter '12 release.What is the change? We are happy to inform you that we are improving our major release upgrade process. This improvement means that your organization will be generally available during our major release upgrade windows.Note: The term "Generally Available" means that we are conducting maintenance on the system that should be seamless to the customer. However, there is the remote possibility that there could be a disruption to service during this time.When is the Winter '12 major release? The Winter '12 release for your organization on NA3 is scheduled for: Friday, October 14, 2011 8:00pm PT to Saturday, October 15, 2011 2:00am PT (Saturday, October 15, 2011 03:00 - 09:00 UTC)How will this change affect me? Previously, major release upgrades required up to six (6) hours of maintenance, during which the Salesforce service was unavailable. Effective with Winter '12, your Salesforce service will be generally available during the major release upgrade. Your organization should expect to experience a disruption of up to five (5) minutes during the timeframe listed above. Users will receive an error message informing them that the service is momentarily unavailable while we upgrade it to the latest release, and will be prompted to log back in momentarily. After that time, you will be able to access the Winter '12 release.Please note: This currently only applies to our major release windows, executed three (3) times per year. System maintenance windows are currently not part of the scope of this changeWhere can I go for further information? This information will also be posted at http://trust.salesforce.com/trust/status/#maint.We are thrilled to be able to bring these availability improvements to our customers, and look forward to continuing our investment in high availability with you and your business.Best regards, salesforce.com Customer Support Copyright 2000-2011 salesforce.com - All rights reserved. Salesforce and the "no software" logo are registered trademarks of salesforce.com, inc., and salesforce.com owns other registered and unregistered trademarks. Other names used herein may be trademarks of their respective owners. Salesforce.com, inc. The Landmark @ One Market, Suite 300, San Francisco, CA, 94105, United States[http://notify.salesforce.com/pub/as?_ri_=X0Gzc2X%3DUQpglLjHJlTQzeBQihssQiiG5QhuPQJrzei2QGQfQ9aJVXHkMX%3Dw&_ei_=.]

subject: unable to add AD objectGUID to SAML as NameID or Attribute
description: This is a hot issue as part of the Getronics POC.When retrieving the attribute list from AD, I can see the objectGUID attribute with a detected source type of String and a mapped type of String. After making it "Available to policies" I created a SAML Generic connector, and mapped the nameID to the objectGUID attribute. When attempting to invoke this SAML connector, I get "An unknown IdP error has occurred. Please try again."In the process of troubleshooting, I modified the SAML connector to use sAMAccountName as NameID, and to add objectGUID as an extended attribute. When the SAML assertion is generated, the extended attribute does not have an attribute value. I need to get the value of this attribute into the assertion, ideally as NameID. Can some please investigate and assist?The configuration can be reviewed in SP10. The connector is the Trialcloud01 SSO Connector.Thanks, Andrew

subject: Concur timeout issues
description: Avery, Symplified support team. We have number an user who is currently experiencing a time out issue with our Concur Http Fed solution. Here is the scenario. 1. She logs into Concur.2. After 20 or so minutes Concur application timeout and display a message indicating to the user please click on the link to re-connect to your session.3. On clicking the link, she is displayed with a prompt to re-enter her Concur credentials.4. Generally for most of our other users including myself, we would close our browser and the force sso option will clear our existing session and re-login into Concur application directly.However, for this user her Concur credential will be locked and she is force to ask the admin to reset her password. Max, Avery. In recent times we’ve seem more users asking for their password to be resetted it because of this issue (I had this happen to me initially as well, I was baffled as I had thought someone had changed my password). I will say it is not consistent for all users. We are pretty positive this is an issue related to the Http fed solution because this only happens when we had the user login into Concur through SSO connection, it does not happen when she goes through Concur directly. Support team please raise a Sev 1 ticket for us on this issue, it is currently impacting number of our resource with their daily work as well impacting our admin continuing with the need to reset the login for the users. Our company simply cannot continue to operate at this current pace.  Please contact me asap to discuss! ThanksMark
name: Moody's

subject: Re: Concur Password reset Sev 1 issue
description: Thanks Avery.I'll double check with Naresh but I don't believe we've ever change this nor do we have the option too. Concur's session timeout should be the same across their clients. Also I guess what I don't understand is why so random why is it not happening to me after I had resetted my password once, why is Michelle the only individual who consistently having her account locked after session time out. I do think others are getting it too but seems at least with other if we do a one time reset everything is okay but with Michelle it's been consistent. Could something have gone wrong on the identity router on storing her credentials. It just seems we somehow always manage to have these random unexplainable issues with the http fed solution.ThanksMarkFrom: Avery McGill <amcgill@symplified.com>To: Lin, MarkCc: Symplified Support <support@symplified.com>; Frey, Patricia; Vic Lanzillotti <vlanzillotti@symplified.com>; Joshua Forman <josh@symplified.com>; Nekkanti, NareshSent: Tue Sep 27 22:39:37 2011Subject: Re: Concur Password reset Sev 1 issueMark,I sent you a previous email letting you know I was available from 1 - 2 PM EDT, I can also be available at 9 AM EDT / 7 AM MDT. Please let me know if you are available and I can call you. In the interim, can you please set your Concur session timeout to match or exceed the SSO timeout (99999 seconds)? The functionality is working as expected, however I believe that because Concur's session timeout is less than our SSO timeout, this issue is occurring and the link that the user is connecting to does not have the force-sso=true tag because this occurred during a normal session. When you arrive first thing in the morning, can you please check with your team to see if anyone has made a change to Concur recently? There haven't been any changes made to your SSO portal and thus I believe that the change originated on the Concur side.Also, for future reference, please do not include Max on emails as he is not part of the Service Delivery team any longer and does not respond to support requests. Thanks Mark, talk to you in the morning.AveryOn Tue, Sep 27, 2011 at 5:18 PM, Lin, Mark <Mark.Lin@moodys.com> wrote:Avery, Symplified support team.We have number an user who is currently experiencing a time outissue with our Concur Http Fed solution.Here is the scenario.1.She logs into Concur.2.After 20 or so minutesConcur application timeout and display a message indicating to the user pleaseclick on the link to re-connect to your session.3.On clicking the link,she is displayed with a prompt to re-enter her Concur credentials.4.Generally for most ofour other users including myself, we would close our browser and the force ssooption will clear our existing session and re-login into Concur applicationdirectly.However, for this user her Concur credential will be locked andshe is force to ask the admin to reset her password.Max, Avery. In recent times we’ve seem more users asking fortheir password to be resetted it because of this issue (I had this happen to meinitially as well, I was baffled as I had thought someone had changed mypassword). I will say it is not consistent for all users. We are prettypositive this is an issue related to the Http fed solution because this onlyhappens when we had the user login into Concur through SSO connection, it doesnot happen when she goes through Concur directly.Support team please raise a Sev 1 ticket for us on this issue,it is currently impacting number of our resource with their daily work as wellimpacting our admin continuing with the need to reset the login for the users.Our company simply cannot continue to operate at this current pace.Please contact me asap to discuss!ThanksMarkMIT - Assistant Vice President212.553.4097 Office646.294.1057BB11-053mark.lin@moodys.com-----------------------------------------The information contained in this e-mail message, and any attachment thereto, is confidential and may not be disclosed without our express permission. subject: IE8 and Delete browsing history on exit
description: Workflow: Open browser, navigate to protected resource (e.g. https://znalogin.test.zurichna.com/Testpage.aspx), get redirected to login page, log in, get redirected to originally requested resource. This works correctly in most browsers, and also in IE8 IF the "Delete browsing history on exit" checkbox is NOT checked.If the checkbox IS checked, then the behavior is as follows: Open browser, navigate to protected resource (e.g. https://znalogin.test.zurichna.com/Testpage.aspx), get redirected to login page, log in, get redirected to ERROR page. If the user then retries accessing the protected resource at this time, it IS accessible.
name: Zurich North America

subject: Question regarding Apache Vulnerability
description: Hello, Jamie Domingue with the Schumacher Group here. We recently had an external contractor do a security scan against our network and they turned up this vulnerability: (See below) Is there any plans from Symplified to remedy this or have you guys already fixed this issue and we just need to be updated to resolve it. Thanks, Jamie DomingueSchumacher Group337-354-1244  Apache < 2.2.20 Multiple VulnerabilitiesDescription: According to its banner, the version of Apache 2.2 installed on the remote host is older than 2.2.20. Such versions are potentially affected by multiple vulnerabilities:§ Apache contains a vulnerability in apr_fnmatch.c used in the Apache Portable Runtime (APR) library and the Apache Portable Utility library (aka APR-util) when handling URIs with crafted wildcard patterns. An application that uses APR could be exploited by attackers to cause a denial of service condition.§ A TLS renegotiation prefix injection attack is possible. (CVE-2009-3555)§ The 'mod_proxy_ajp' module returns the wrong status code if it encounters an error which causes the back-end server to be put into an error state. (CVE-2010-0408)§ The 'mod_isapi' attempts to unload the 'ISAPI.dll' when it encounters various error states which could leave call-backs in an undefined state. (CVE-2010-0425)§ A flaw in the core sub-request process code can lead to sensitive information from a request being handled by the wrong thread if a multi-threaded environment is used. (CVE-2010-0434)Risk Factor: HIGHRemedy: § Upgrade Apache to version 2.2.19 or later. Related Links:§ http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-0419§ http://httpd.apache.org/security/vulnerabilities_22.html§ https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=48359§ http://www.apache.org/dist/httpd/CHANGES_2.2.15 Vulnerable Host IP Addresses:§ 24.249.95.199
name: Schumacher Group

subject: Away On Vacation Re: Symplified Upgrade Notification: October 2011
description: I will be out of the office on vacation from September 27th throughthe 30th. I will have limited access to email and will be respondingto messages when I return on the 10/3.-- *Darren Platt*CTO & Founder303.775.6212 | mobile*http://www.symplified.com***SymplifiedThe Cloud Security Company
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Error page should indicate resource request that caused the error
description: If users wind up on the custom portal Error page, we don't currently provide information as to why they're there -- was there a 404 on attempting to load a particular favicon.ico? was there an AuthZ problem with a particular page or resource on that page?We need to pass the URL of the resource that triggered the error to the error page so that it can consume it and (if desired) display that to the end-user. As an alternative, the resource that triggers this error should be logged. Otherwise, it's a guessing game as to why a user wound up on the error page (especially in the favicon/404 case)
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Cannot publish updated configs with broken simplelink setup
description: If a customer has a broken simplelink configuration when trying to publish in SPS 8.11 it times out. The publish of new configs fails and there are errors in the IDR logs. The errors keep repeating in the symplified.log file.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Additions to SP38
description: Please add Qantas Trust Fabric and generic OpenID IDP to SP38. ThanksCullen Landrum, CISSPSenior Systems Engineer1600 Pearl St, Suite 200Boulder, CO 80302Cell: 303-888-1576Office: 303-318-4132Symplified | The Cloud Security Company http://www.symplified.com
name: Symplified SE Team

subject: User unable to view any applications.
description: Ed Sturm reported that users are unable to see any applications. I verified this using Ed's login. I saw that Ed has the DRP_Active flag in Salesforce set to false and that there is a user named jmarr@dolby.com that is having issues retrieving attributes from Salesforce. I verified that we can connect to Salesforce as a user store and requested from Ed the following information.*********************A couple of things really quick.First, I am seeing a log of issues in the logs regarding the jmarr@dolby.com user and not being able to return attribute information for this user.Second, is everyone experiencing the same issue in production that you showed me earlier? I'm seeing this issue as being related to the flags in Salesforce (see below). I suggest double checking that all the Salesforce flags are set correctly and authenticating with another user to see if this is a systemic issue or related to specific logins.PROPERTIES=DRP_Active__c=false
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: enable handler - SP45
description: Please enable the SAML Generic IDP Handler in SP45.Thanks!
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Cross Customer Configuration's Viewable
description: When setting context from one customer to the next, you see another customers configuration.

subject: Archive Single Sign on
description: Hello All, I spoke with Ashish earlier and he told me that AD hasboth numeric and alpha logins. Currentlyit’s a mixed environment except for consultants and Partners in Care. They are only alpha sign in’s. If you have any further questions about ADI have Ashish on this email and he will be able to further assist you. ThanksHuma HalimiBC/DR Analyst5 Penn Plaza, 20th fl212-609-9615huma.halimi@vnsny.org
name: Visiting Nurse Service of NY

subject: SPS Stability in 8.11
description: We are seeing issues with flash crashing or hanging at 100% CPU usage in the 8.11 SPS on admin-2. The problem seems to be accelerated by using other sites with flash in the same browser. This can be replicated within a few minutes by opening the admin-2 SinglePoint Studio and Pandora in the same browser (gmail's use of flash can also be used)
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: lwregd init script is not executable after the 8.11.0 upgrade
description: After upgrading to 8.11.0, the /etc/init.d/lwregd script is not executable. -rw-r--r-- 1 root root 355 Jul 5 10:43 lwregdThis has occurred at Netflix and PBCS and possibly WiPro (their IdR is now down and I can't confirm until it is turned on).This permission issue results in the following error:According to http://forgeftp.novell.com/library/SUSE%20Package ~onventions/spc_init_scripts.html, init scripts should return 0, 1, 2, 3, or 4. However, '/etc/init.d/lwregd status' returned 276888832., error=null, timeout=false] for command: LinuxCommandRequest [command=[/opt/likewise/bin/domainjoin-cli query], workingDirectory=null, withShell=true, timeoutMills=0]Changing the permissions (chmod +x lwregd) fixes this issue.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Switching over new SQl Adapter
description: I wanted to Outline my Steps in switching users over from the Old SQL Reporting Http basic adapter to the New SQL Reporting Custom Adapter. Once I am sure the new adapter is working correctly and to avoid having to update everyone’s keychain I was hoping to perform the following steps:1. Delete the HTTP_Basic SQL Reporting Services adapter2. Change the name of the Dev SQL Reports Adapter to SQL Reporting Services.3. Change the portal user URL to the following: https://reports.coolsculpting.com/reports4. Save and Publish configuration[cid:image001.jpg@01CC81E3.F4473B50]Where I am a little confused is with the users keychain. If I rename the new adapter to the same name of the old adapter (SQL Reporting Services) I should not need to force an update to everyone’s keychain as this name already exists in the keychain. Is this the correct or do I need to force a key chain update and if it has the same name as the old adapter no keychain’s will be updated.Roger Roger OlivierNetwork ManagerZELTIQ(925) 474-2565 Office(650) 207-4151 Cell (925) 474-8565 Faxhttp://www.zeltiq.com/ahead of the curvePlease be COOL and consider the environment before printing this email.
name: Zeltiq

It seems like a silly question, but I can't find that info anywhere in the management UI — I feel dumb.I'm trying to configure them both for syslog, so I wanted to start with what their IPs/hostnames are.Also, I noticed that the Flash-powered admin UI sometimes doesn't respond to any clicks. Is this a known issue with Mac FireFox 7 or 8 and Safari 5.1? I'm using the latest adobe flash 11.0.1.152.Thanks,Bill

subject: 8.11 DNS update bug
description: Background: Schumacher's internal IdR became unavailable the morning after the 8.11 upgrade (10/5/11). Upon initial inspection, Schumachers IdR's was throwing IWA / Likewise errors caused by the ability to return SRV records from the domain controller which in turn resulted from using Schumacher's external DNS and not the internal DNS as we should have been. The change in DNS servers occurred as a result of the upgrade. According to conversations with Max, this was most likely caused by the lack of DNS entry in the nameserverList tag in the /usr/local/symplified/etc/appliance.property file. Since this entry was missing, the DNS server as configured in the dns.nameservers tag in the same file was used (now deprecated). This tag most likely had the incorrect DNS server because they were originally configured without IWA. Of course, we don't know this for 100%, this is our best guess.Bug: We believe their was a null value in the file listed above causing the system not to have a DNS entry after the upgrade.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: 8.11 infinite redirect loop
description: Background: We encountered an issue where a condition occurred that caused the IdR's login service to experience an infinite redirect loop that consumed all the IdR's memory and resulted in cratering the box in a matter of a few minutes (~600 auth requests per minute). This condition is very similar to a DOS attack and was a result of a user attempting to log in via IWA, the IdR redirecting to the IWA auth module, which observed a bad spnego token, and redirected the user back to the login servlet. At this point, the browser is not supposed to resend the spnego token, but it did, and thus entering the infinite loop. After restarting the IdR, services were restored. Unfortunately, the infinite redirect loop also caused the logs to rotate in a matter of minutes as well, destroying all evidence of the original issue. I had Jamie Domingue ask everyone to log out and log back in, which has apparently fixed the issue as it has not reoccurred. Topher and Max have no idea how or why this could have happened as it appears as though it was caused by a malfunctioning browser and have been unable to reproduce it.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: 8.11 SimpleLink Time out.
description: Background: SVB experienced an outage that prevented the end user from authenticating into the portal. The end users received a login servlet error when connecting to the portal. Examining the logs showed that the SimpleLink service was starting, thinking it wasn't started, and restarting, causing tun1 (SimpleLink VPN tunnel) to flap (note the PID on the SimpleLink service was constantly changing as the service constantly restarted). The SimpleLink service is a dependency of the login service and as a result, prevented the login service from always being available (intermittently a user was able to authenticate). Initially JVH and Max thought that dual SimpleLink client server processes had been initiated, but after confirming this was not the case via tcupdumps and looking at the output of ps -ef | grep vpn (showing only one SimpleLink service with a single pid), this was ruled out. After further examination with Colin (who worked on the HA SimpleLink functionality), we finally isolated it to a part of the SimpleLink HA code that restarts the SimpleLink service if the connection to the existing SimpleLink service dies (this allows for the second SimpleLink client server to establish a VPN tunnel- thus SimpleLink HA). After re-establishing the SimpleLink VPN tunnel, we looked at the network between the IdR and the SimpleLink client server and noticed that there was upwards of 20% packet loss and a lot of latency (pings in excess of 200+ ms at times). As a result of networking issues, our SimpleLink service was timing out on the first connection and attempting to fail over to the second SimpleLink server (that didn't exist) and thus stomping on the original SimpleLink service once it was able to establish a new connection. We have customized SVB's IdR to revert the SimpleLink code base to the 8.10.1 configuration by manually editing the SimpleLink application code (eek). Bug: Currently SimpleLink HA does not tolerate poor network performance. We want the ability to enable SimpleLink HA that works as currently configured and not enable HA SimpleLink- that works as it did before and thus supports existing customers with poor network performance.
name: Symplified, Inc.

Thanks,Tammy From: Avery McGill [mailto:amcgill@symplified.com]Sent: Wednesday, October 12, 2011 9:57 AMTo: Sturm, EdwardCc: Tammy Hsia; Cox, Dave; Benson Lee; Tan Matosian; Sullivan, Scott A.Subject: Re: Status of where we are with the DLN Dave / Ed,I apologize for the delay, I have been unavailable for the past few days. subject: www.accenture.com breaks display of ribbon
description: Adding www.accenture.com as either the Home or Portal background URL busts the ribbon. The speculation is that accenture may have some frame busting code (which needs to be verified). Suggested work around was to use another host in the *accenture.com domain. Need to understand how to deal with issues like this in the future and how to check and see what an issue might be. We need some documentation as to issues such as this to add to a knowledge base and to understand in the short term what the specific issue is/was here.

subject: Additional IP Addresses for Your Salesforce.com Organization
description: Additional IP Addresses for Your Salesforce.com Organization   You are receiving this email because our records indicate you are an administrator of a Salesforce CRM Org. Product & Service Notification RE: Org ID 00D500000007EiFDear Symplified,  At salesforce.com, trust is a top priority, and we are constantly improving our network to ensure high availability of our service. You are receiving this email because we have identified you as a system administrator of a salesforce.com organization that may be impacted by this change.What is the change? We are enhancing our network by adding additional Internet Protocol (IP) addresses in order to provide you with a more robust and reliable service. These additional IP addresses fall within our existing standard IP range for your instance. If you whitelist specific IP addresses for your salesforce.com or Sandbox instance, you will need to update your settings to include the standard range for your instance. You can view the standard ranges in Knowledge Article Number 102757: https://help.salesforce.com/apex/HTViewSolution?language=en&id=102757(You will have to log in using your salesforce.com credentials for security purposes.)When is this change taking effect? The additional IP addresses will be added beginning November 10, 2011.What action do I need to take? If you whitelist specific IP addresses for your salesforce.com or Sandbox instance, you will need to update your settings to include the standard range for your instance. If you do not take this action, then you will begin to experience intermittent disruptions when connecting to the salesforce.com application once these new IP addresses are added on November 10, 2011. If your organization does not whitelist or restrict salesforce.com access to certain IP addresses, then no action is required and you will not be impacted by this change. Why are we making this change? We are adding additional IP addresses to add redundancy to our network in order to increase capacity and resiliency, allowing us to provide you with a reliable and robust service.How can I get more information? Please refer to the Knowledge Base article noted above for more information regarding salesforce.com IP addresses.Please contact Customer Support for further questions you may have.Best regards, salesforce.com Customer Support Copyright 2000-2011 salesforce.com - All rights reserved. Salesforce and the "no software" logo are registered trademarks of salesforce.com, inc., and salesforce.com owns other registered and unregistered trademarks. Other names used herein may be trademarks of their respective owners. Salesforce.com, inc. The Landmark @ One Market, Suite 300, San Francisco, CA, 94105, United States[http://notify.salesforce.com/pub/as?_ri_=X0Gzc2X%3DUQpglLjHJlTQzeBQihssQiizfOQhUXQJrzei2QGQfQ730VXHkMX%3Dw&_ei_=.]

subject: Path names need to be changed
description: As part of the 9.0 branding effort we need to make sure that all path names have been updated. For example:https://intelcenter.symanteco3.com/StudioLoginServer/where "StudioLoginServer" needs to be changed.I am sure there are more than just this but this is an example.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Keychain API documentation
description: We understand that the IDR has a CLI/API that has functions such as:idr-rename-keychainwhich can be used to rename a keychainidr-delete-keychain which can be used to delete a keychain. We are evaluating a use case where an IDR can sit and act as a DR in the cloud which would communicate to a SL onprem and we have a path to the on prem IDR. We could potentially make a call from the DR to the "prod" on prem IDRto extract the keychains on a regular basis - or pickup and restore the backup to a local filesystem. We would then makea simple DNS change to "failover" to the cloud hosted IDR.We think this API may afford us some flexibility here but we need additional documentation to evaluate this.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Keychain removal when using the CLI
description: The CLI should not be removing a single users keychain when the application is specified using the -a option.The command the customer ran: C:\IDR\bin>idr-remove-keychains --server 172.18.3.108 --key **** --u tech013 --a iLMS-Prod -vThis has been verified in a test env.More details in tt 16057-3005

subject: Problem with SalesForce SFDC authentication
description: Please confirm acceptable set of characters for a password used as part of a SalesForce Delegated Authentication scenario. We have evidence from a user that was unsuccessful authenticating when using a password with a percent sign ("%") in it. Changing their password remedied the inability to login. The error this user experienced with the original password indicated that 'Your company's authentication service is down.' yet it was not. Another log presented the message, 'org.xml.sax.SAXException: Bad envelope tag: html' which made us think there was a invalid character that messed up the message transmittal of the delegated authentication request from Salesforce.com to Symplified. Is this a known issue? Are there other characters that would cause delegated authentication not to function as expected?Use of a % sign in a non-delegated authenticated account with SalesForce does not seem to cause a problem. It is only when authenticating through Symplified with a percent sign in the password that we saw this issue.
name: Amylin

subject: Update on Winter '12 Feature Availability
description: You are receiving this email because our records indicate you are an administrator of a Salesforce CRM Org. Product & Service Notification RE: Org ID 00D500000007EiFDear Symplified,At salesforce.com,customer success is our top priority and it is our goal to notify you of any changes that may affect you or your business . You are receiving this email because you are a system administrator of a Salesforce organization that will be upgraded with several new features after the Winter ‘12 major release.We’ve heard your Winter ‘12 release feedback, including some features that were not available on the major release dates. First, we apologize for any confusion this may have caused you or your organization. Second, we’d like to provide further information on the features that will be available after the major release dates.What is the change? With the introduction of reduced downtime in the Winter ‘12 release, we introduced a new way for our product teams to release features. As a result, many of the exciting features in the Winter ‘12 release were scheduled for release shortly after the major release upgrades, which recently occurred.What is the impact to me? Certain features will be available in Salesforce after the major release. Please review the chart below to understand when the features will be available for your organization. This information is now in the Winter ‘12 Release Notes. The Release Notes will continue to be the source for all new feature details, including availability and enablement.FeatureAvailability DateEnablementVisual Workflow (Beta)All Sandbox InstancesMonday, September 19, 2011NA1, NA6, NA7, NA8, NA9 Tuesday, October 11, 2011All Remaining Instances Thursday, October 20, 2011Not automatically visible. Feature is available but requires some setup.Likes on CommentsAll Sandbox Instances Monday, October 3, 2011NA1, NA6, NA7, NA8, NA9 Monday, October 17, 2011All Remaining Instances Monday, November 7, 2011Automatically visible to all users. No setup required.Social ContactsAll Sandbox Instances except CS5 & CS6 Thursday, October 27, 2011CS5 & CS6 Friday, October 28, 2011All NA & EU Instances Tuesday, November 3, 2011AP0 & AP1 Wednesday, November 4, 2011Automatically visible to all users. No setup required.Dynamic Dashboard FiltersAll Sandbox Instances except CS5 & CS6 Tuesday, November 8, 2011CS5 & CS6 Wednesday, November 9, 2011All NA & EU Instances Tuesday, November 15, 2011AP0 & AP1 Wednesday, November 16, 2011Automatically visible to all users. No setup required.Customer GroupsCS11 Tuesday, September 27, 2011CS0, CS4, CS7, CS9, CS12 Monday, October 17, 2011CS5 & NA1 Tuesday, October 18, 2011NA6, NA7, NA8, NA9 Monday, October 24, 2011CS1, CS2, CS3, CS6, CS8, CS10 Tuesday, October 25, 2011NA0, NA2, NA3, NA4 Tuesday, November 1, 2011EU0, EU1, NA5, NA10, NA11, NA12 Thursday, November 3, 2011AP0 & AP1 Friday, November 4, 2011Automatically visible to all administrators. No setup required.We’re improving our processes to ensure that all documentation clearly outlines if and when a feature will be made available after the release. We appreciate your patience as we continue to refine this process.Where can I get further information? The Winter ‘12 Release Notes include the availability, enablement, feature details and much more on all of the exciting features and functionality in the Winter ‘12 release. If you have further questions, please contact Customer Support.Best regards, salesforce.com Customer SupportCopyright 2000-2011 salesforce.com - All rights reserved. Salesforce and the "no software" logo are registered trademarks of salesforce.com, inc., and salesforce.com owns other registered and unregistered trademarks. Other names used herein may be trademarks of their respective owners. Salesforce.com, inc. subject: IDR Loclaization
description: Currently (8.10.1) the IDR has some localization support in the JS on the ribbon. Primarily related to elements to the ribbon itself. That said language settings do not effect internal IDR error messages so while the ribbon is "localized" other messages that could be displayed remain in English.What are the plans to allow for both the addition of new languages to the list currently supported on the ribbon as well as matching IDR to ribbon language context to display error messages and other dialogs in the language selected.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: SAML-Proxy support / SamlGoogle adapter
description: Following the PSO training this week it was reported that SAML-Proxy is no longer supported by the Symplified system. Slide 9 in Jay's architectural presentation indicates otherwise and both Mike and I recall support for this in previous releases.As we are relying on the context-api to be the interface between our two systems we need to insure that *all* traffic pass through the IDR in order for us to intercept the traffic. If SAML-Proxy is no longer supported our solution will be limited to only HTTP-Fed based applications.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Neohapsis audit findings requiring Symplified response

subject: Box.net mobile client authentication problems
description: Hi Dave,Any progress on what might be causing our issue? I just did a quick test on my end to see if anything had changed. I actually had a few successful logins, but then some failures. Hopefully you can use this data in your troubleshooting.10:44am - On net - Symsso4 - Successful (iPhone)10:46am - On net - Symsso4 - Failed (iPad)10:49am - On net - Symsso4 - Failed (iPad)10:58am - On net - Symsso4 - Successful (iPhone)11:01am - Off net - Symsso3 - Failed (iPhone)11:21am - Off net - Symsso3 - Failed (iPhone)11:25am – On net - Symsso4 - Successful (iPhone) Thanks,JohnFrom: Herring, John Sent: Tuesday, October 18, 2011 2:30 PMTo: 'David Lumpkin'Cc: Jessica Tong; Lenore Tumey; molly@box.net; Baughn, Jeff; McWethy, CameronSubject: RE: Box.net mobile clientHi Dave,Thanks for getting back to us. I was only able to login a few times for a short period of time last Tuesday (10/11/2011) at around 11:30am. I had first tried Jessica’s test account that she sent, which worked. I then logged out and tried my account, which worked as well for the first time. I then turned off my wireless to force my phone over 3G and logged in, but then had the issue. I switched back-n-forth between on and off wireless with the same working and not working results. These tests were all pointed to our IDRs in Phoenix using their public load balanced IP address. I think I then tested connecting to our San Diego IDR on net, but that failed. These results led me to think maybe one of the IDRs was working correctly in Phx, but because of the load balancer I didn’t know which one. I was hoping to figure that out with some additional testing on 10/14 and 10/18, but all my tests failed and I was never able to get another successful login that kicked me back to the thick client interface. I’ve tested Jessica’s test account multiple times without any issues. We also have not had any login issues with the desktop client, so it seems mobile client specific.Let me know if you need any other info.Thanks,JohnFrom: David Lumpkin [mailto:dlumpkin@symplified.com] Sent: Tuesday, October 18, 2011 1:48 PMTo: Herring, JohnCc: Jessica Tong; Lenore Tumey; molly@box.net; Baughn, Jeff; McWethy, CameronSubject: Re: Box.net mobile clientHi John,All your IDRs are definitely on the latest version, but its possible that the different networks could be causing issues with the redirect. Do you know any approximate timestamps when it has and has not worked? I'm trying to find any differences between these two use cases that might point us to the root problem. If you have seen any issues with Box on your desktop browsers that may also be relevant.Thanks for your help on this,David LumpkinOffice: 303-318-4138 Symplified | The Cloud Security Company http://www.symplified.comOn Mon, Oct 17, 2011 at 4:43 PM, Herring, John <John.Herring@amylin.com> wrote:Hi Dave, I hope all is well. We’re still waiting to hear back from you on the mobile client issue we are having. It appeared to work randomly a couple times last Tuesday, but I have not been able to get it to work since. I’ve tried various tests, forcing my client to connect to specific IDRs on and off network, but every test has had the same issue. The only test I cannot perform is taking the load balancer out of the picture for the IDRs in Phoenix due to the way the network config was architected there. I was able to do this in San Diego, but still had the issue. If you could please check our IDR configurations to make sure they are updated and properly configured to support the mobile clients and get back to us as soon as possible, I would greatly appreciate it.  Thanks,JohnOn Tue, Oct 11, 2011 at 6:20 PM, Herring, John <John.Herring@amylin.com> wrote:Thank you for the update Jessica! I tried out the test account and it worked for me also. I went back and tried it again for our account and it still had the same issue, then it started working after a few tries. Same scenario on another device I have. I’m thinking things are good from the Box.net side and that maybe we have a problem with one of our IDRs, which are load balanced.  David, can you please verify all of our IDRs are at the same version and configured properly. Tomorrow we will play with our load balancer to see if we can figure out if it’s an issue with a specific IDR. Thanks,John From: Jessica Tong [mailto:Jessica@box.net] Sent: Tuesday, October 11, 2011 10:16 AMTo: Herring, JohnCc: David Lumpkin; Lenore Tumey; molly@box.net; Baughn, Jeff; McWethy, CameronSubject: Re: Box.net mobile client Hi all, Our contact at Symplified just got back to our mobile team with working test credentials. We tried them out on our Android phone and our company iPad--it works perfectly. To try for yourself, on a mobile device, go to the Login tab > More login options > enter "test@symplified.com" > enter boxtest / passwordbox.net > logged in  For next steps, we can and should get both sides from Amylin and Symplified together, and see if there is anything different between Amylin's Symplified account and our test Symplified account. How does this Friday at 3pm look for a call? Kind Regards,Jessica_ Jessica TongJessica@box.net| Box.netDirect: 650-543-6942 | Fax: 650-327-1950 220 Portage Ave. | Palo Alto, CA 94306 Box Customers speak to a Simple, Open, & Mobile Enterprise  On Fri, Oct 7, 2011 at 3:25 PM, Jessica Tong <Jessica@box.net> wrote:Hi John, So, Hieu (integrations' engineer) has been working with Symplified to get connected to a test environment. We should be getting this soon to figure out, test and debug if necessary. We will keep you all in the loop on the progress of this. We appreciate your consideration and patience. Kind Regards,Jessica_Jessica TongJessica@box.net| Box.netDirect: 650-543-6942 | Fax: 650-327-1950 220 Portage Ave. | Palo Alto, CA 94306 Box Customers speak to a Simple, Open, & Mobile Enterprise  On Fri, Oct 7, 2011 at 3:13 PM, Jessica Tong <Jessica@box.net> wrote:Hi John, Apologies on the delay, still checking with our integration team. We'll provide any updates as soon as we can. Kind Regards,Jessica_Jessica TongJessica@box.net| Box.netDirect: 650-543-6942 | Fax: 650-327-1950 220 Portage Ave. | Palo Alto, CA 94306 Box Customers speak to a Simple, Open, & Mobile Enterprise  On Fri, Oct 7, 2011 at 2:42 PM, Herring, John <John.Herring@amylin.com> wrote:Hi Jessica, Just checking in to see if you have any info yet so I can give a status update on my end. Thanks and have a great weekend,John From: Jessica Tong [mailto:Jessica@box.net] Sent: Thursday, October 06, 2011 1:10 PMTo: Herring, JohnCc: David Lumpkin; Lenore Tumey; molly@box.net; Baughn, Jeff; McWethy, CameronSubject: Re: Box.net mobile client Hi John, We're looking into this on our side. Any updates we can provide, we'll let you know ASAP. Kind Regards,Jessica_Jessica TongJessica@box.net| Box.netDirect: 650-543-6942 | Fax: 650-327-1950 220 Portage Ave. | Palo Alto, CA 94306 Box Customers speak to a Simple, Open, & Mobile Enterprise  On Thu, Oct 6, 2011 at 11:35 AM, Herring, John <John.Herring@amylin.com> wrote:Hello Jessica and David, Our Symplified appliances were recently upgraded to support thick app mobile clients. I tested logging in from my iPad’s Box.net app using the “More login options” which brings me to the SSO Login page. I put in my Box.net user name and am redirected to our Symplified login page. I enter my network credentials there at which point I am then redirected to our Symplified web portal where I can click on links to our available apps, including Box.net. Clicking on Box.net takes me to the mobile web version of my Box.net account. I am never returned to the thick app’s interface for accessing my files, which is what I assumed would happen and is what Todd Stewart was shown a demo of. Todd was also informed that with the OAuth integration we would not need to enter our credentials for Symplified each time we use the app, that it would utilize tokens to verify access on the backend. Currently I have to enter in credentials for Symplified each time I use my thick app which makes for a long process and doesn’t give me the added features of the thick app. I’m not sure the issue is due to a lack of support on the thick app, our Box.net configuration, our Symplified configuration, or a combination of things. Would you please have your resources to look into this. If you need any additional information, please let me know. We could also setup a conference call so we can all discuss together if you feel it would be helpful. Thanks,John

subject: SAML requests land at portal rather than inside app if non-IWA browser matches IWA IP range
description: Related to Parature 16057-3250 and possibly Mantis 3413 (may have same root cause, but different test scenario to verify fix).Configuration: HA & IWA, with IWA configured for internal subnets only. However, HA configuration uses NAT which makes it so that ALL clients appear to be coming from IWA range.To reproduce the problem: From a non-IWA client that falls within the IWA IP range, clear browser cache & restart browser. Navigate to the menu URL of an SP-initiated SAML application, get redirected to the IdPServlet and then to the IDR login page. After logging in, browser lands at the portal landing page rather than at the SAML application. Note that if you log out of the portal and then re-navigate to the SAML app's menu url (without clearing cookies), you will successfully flow through the login process and wind up at the SAML app. Also note that if you use an IWA-enabled browser (on domain-joined machine), the flow is correct even the first time.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: default attribute definitions missing from Studio User Guide
description: Please update the Studio User Guide to include the following information about the default attributes available in the policy editor:authenticationSource - the name of the AuthN User Store or IdP used to log in.authenticationType - example values: SAML (includes “new IWA” since it’s an IdP), IWA, User Store, OpenID or OAuth.cookies - all the cookies that came into the login servlet. A rule could be configured to check and see if a cookie "contains" a given name (to see if that cookie is set).cookiesString - Using this, a rule can match against the whole cookie header, so could look at specific values/substrings of the cookie.IpAddress - IP address of user’s machine, as seen by the IDR (sometimes obscured by NAT, etc.)requestParametersList - example: "next-redirect=something” in one element, "last-name=Doe" in another.requestParametersString - example: "?next-redirect=something&last-name=Doe" note that requestParametersList and requestParametersString contain the same data, just in different formatsUserAgent - web browser being used to access the IDR. Can be useful to create policies to differentiate application access for mobile users vs. desktop browser users. May not be 100% accurate, given the possibility of user agent spoofing.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Need to understand more about logs and PII
description: If Personally Identifiable Information (PII) is defined as- Name- Mailing Address or email address- Phone Number- Personal Password or ID number- IP address- URLs that may contain PII- Portable executable files that may contain PII- Unique information which by itself is not PII, such as, but not limited to, personal profile unique identifier, biometric information, and/or IP address that can be associated with PIIThen our question is1) What are the fields inside an IDR log that can be considered PII?2) What are the fields inside the studio's admin login log that can be considered PII?3) what are the fields in the IDR debug log that can be considered PII?Our second set of questions is:1) what logs in IDR can be viewed in the Studio?2) How does a customer obtain their own Admin access/publish logs?3) Will the policies defined by customer's Admin, with attributes coming from customer AD, contain PII information?

subject: SAML2 Generic double URL Encoding

If you examine the raw headers POSTed with the SAMLResponse you should see that http://www.google.com becomesRelayState=https%253A%252F%252Fwww.google.com which has to be decoded twice to get the original value

subject: Issue when SQL record doesn't exist for the user
description: Hi Lenore,An issue came up this week where I believe I need your help in determiningthe fix/workaround.Here is the Scenario . . .from: Linda Frazier linda.frazier@zurichna.comto: ltumey@symplified.comcc: Md Abdul Samad <md.abdul.samad@zurichna.com>, malkod@csc.comdate: Tue, Nov 15, 2011 at 11:33 AMsubject: Issue when SQL record doesn't exist for the userWe have a user id that has a valid record in the Authentication data store- Domino ldapHowever, the ID does NOT have a corresponding record in the SQLauthorizaton data store.The user attempts to try to log into an application url that has policiesset up to determine if the user should have access. The policies arechecking for fields in the SQL datastore - Authorization datastore.When this scenario is hit, the below error page displays:To reproduce this on the Test IDR, use the following ID/PW, and URLcombination:ID/PW: upass100/Upass100!URL: http://ultraqlty.test.zurichna.com/zusI need your help because I am not clear how the IDR is handling doing thelookup to the SQL database to match the ID. Whereever that code is, can wemake a change/workaround that if the SQL record is NOT found, the user getsthe "Not authorized" message rather than the below?Thanks! - LindaP.S. This is not a high priority issue.(Embedded image moved to file: pic04327.jpg)Linda FrazierCSC-Zurich AccountiNet Application Services(847) 605-6729 – Schaumburg Office(630) 881-4831 - Celllfrazier2@CSC.com
name: Zurich North America

subject: Request for Clarificaton: Upgrade Notification: November 2011
description: Symplified Support team,Can you please kindly remind me the distinction between your Development and Test environment, vs. what you setup for us at Moody’s? We only have 1 non-Production environment, should we expect that to be upgraded by 11/29, the listed “Development Environment” upgrade? Thank you very much.................................................Ben CheungAVP / Moody’s Information Technology212.553.1974 tel347.276.2554 mobile212.298.6664 faxben.cheung@moodys.comMoody’s Corporation7 World Trade Center250 Greenwich StreetNew York, NY 10007www.moodys.com................................................. From: Symplified Support [mailto:support@symplified.com] Sent: Saturday, November 19, 2011 8:00 PMTo: Cheung, BenSubject: Symplified Upgrade Notification: November 2011  Image removed by sender. Dear Ben Cheung, We are pleased to announce the 2011 Winter Feature Release of Symplified's service. It includes the following enhancements:Strong Authentication: Support of additional strong authentication third-party providers.IDR Web Services: IDR web services will be enhanced in future releases. In preparation for this the Keychain CLI, which utilizes the IDR web services, has been modified and made more secure. The current CLI will be supported through the February release and no action is required now. More information on how to migrate CLI calls before the February release coming in December.Please consult online documentation or contact Customer Support for more information on the above enhancements. For Enterprise Upgrade customers, the release schedule is as follows:Development Environment: Will be upgraded on Tuesday, November 29, from 9 PM - 3 AM MST. Test Environment: Will be upgraded on Tuesday, December 6, from 9 PM - 3 AM MST.Production Environment: Will be upgraded on Saturday, December 10, from 8 AM - 12 PM MST.During these windows, SinglePoint Studio and Identity Routers in the targeted environment will experience short periods of unavailability. Do not attempt to make any modifications during these published times. Please contact us if you have any questions. Thank You. What is more then likely happening is when you log into staging you are getting put into the new 9.0 studio envioment. Currently we only have two customers migrated over to 9.0. subject: Case sensitivity issue between policy and login
description: The value comparison for userName during policy evaluation is case sensitive. For example, the policy, "if username = 'User2'" is not the same as "if username = 'user2'". But the userName comparison during login is case insensitive - "user2" or "User2" both would work for login at the portal.Suggestion is to enable "case insensitive comparison" in policy.

description: Hi Avery,Wehave an issue with Dolby Deliverable on Demand that hopefully you can help with. We are working with Flexera to resolve some of the issues that they were facing with our Dolby-On-Demand application. They havea question that I hope that you might have the answer to:1. Single Sign on: Can Dolby direct users to dolby.subscribenet.com at the end of the SSO process rather than ddod.dolbycustomer.com? Picture (Device Independent Bitmap) ----------------------------------In order to further troubleshoot and work towards resolution, Flexera identified three items for your review:To recap what we have confirmed to date:For the Akamai IP validation in UR, Akamai confirmed that they are getting a different Client IP than we are from the proxy.arl : /=/592/109926/30d/intrawareie.download.akamai.com/109926/731/5615731/Dolby_MS11_Impl_Documentation_v2.0.1.zip?ftpRequestID=1771467081&server=akamaiesd-ie.subscribenet.com&dtm=DTM20111123172858NzkzNTE0OTU2&ip=y&ipAddress=50.19.106.35&authparam=1322098138_48a4c3df457a564393e45c4030081e3f&ext=.zip True Client IP:84.204.78.98They get the 84…. Address whereas we get the 50… address. Possibly setting the proxy to allow transparency on the client IP would resolve this issue.The mass downloader is choking with this exception:java.io.StreamCorruptedException: invalid stream header: 1F8B0800 at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readStreamHeader(Unknown Source) at java.io.ObjectInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)Which might be the result of the content handling on the web server used in the proxy process. If we have access to modifying the configuration, we might be able to test out some scenarios. The Content-Encoding is just one difference that could be helpful, there might be other information such as re-writing, etc. which would be insightful as well. subject: SAML Validation
description: When a third party IdP sends a SAML assertion to O3 Portal, that says " this user, with this subjectID, has been authenticated by me", the O3 portal will have to check the subjectID against SOME kind of DB accessible to O3 portal to figure out if the user by this subjectID is known to the O3 gateway, right?So I am looking at the O3 gateway IdP configuration tab. It seems you have to configure a User Store that the SAML assertion will map into, and I assume you take the subjectID and you look up that UserStore to see if the user is in that store. And the way you check the user store is through a server-to-server connection, not re-bounce it through front-end connection via SAML, correct?And if there are additional attributes in a SAML assertion that you want to use for access policy settings, then you will need to map the attributes in the SAML assertion to a user store's own attributes, and then use the user store's attributes list to create the policies, correct?Further, if you don't want the user store to be your own user store, you can use a remote user store, as long as 1) you can connect to it via AD, LDAP, or WebServices, or in case of Google and SalesForce, you have created special user store connectors to connect to them, correct?And if you want to pass any SAML attributes in the assertion to any downstream SaaS applications, you can map the attributes to a user store's attributes, and then pass the user store attributes as trusted header to the downstream SaaS application, correct?
