subject: VirtualGroups is only sending one attribute and not the entire string
description: VNSNY's POS application is a SAML 2.0 application that utilizes extended attributes. One of the attributes is a multi-value attribute that is included in the SAML assertion. We are only sending the first of many values in the SAML assertion and they need all of the attributes to be sent to authenticate users.For example:Working configuration (pre 9.0) <saml2:Attribute Name="role" NameFormat="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:basic"> <saml2:AttributeValue xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:type="xs:string">SYSTEMEOS,VOSSYSTEM,VOSROLLOUT,VOSpilot,EOS Contract Admin,EOS Contract Admin_AD,PAMEX Standard,PAM Users,BPTW-NYC,INow TestUsers,ImageNow Users,BDL{VNSVMD01}{e8304568-9362-40d1-8b94-45aa083e32fa},Octel,08 ET Course Participants,VM_Everyone,Netmotion Users,Incident Tracking Approve,Dl_m02 SAI Project Analyst,IS Project Analysts,ITAP,Discoverer Reporting Users Group,Tablet Test Id's,SAI Analysts,M02 SAI,Crains BCNYC,IT_EVERYONE,Exchange Users,IVE_HATS_OWA_INTRA,IVE_HOD_OWA_INTRA,IVE_SAI,IVE_SecureMeeting,PS Pilot Issues,ScriptLogicTest</saml2:AttributeValue>Broken configuration (9.0): <saml2:Attribute Name="role" NameFormat="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:attrname-format:basic"> <saml2:AttributeValue xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:type="xs:string">SYSTEMEOS</saml2:AttributeValue> </saml2:Attribute>

subject: Support for Credential recovery in SSP
description: As noted in the original deck for the integration of Singlepoint to the SSP there is a requirement that a user can access whatever application or set of applications has Strong Auth attached to it if they have misplaced their credential. The way the current ea9.o implementation is implemented a user is locked out of their SAS application account if for whatever reason the credential is not available. This is a requirement for both SSP configurations. A suggestion was made during a review to map attributes similar to Symplified's generic SAML adapter so that the 3 options of:- Out-of-band via SMS (mobile)- Out-of-band via email- Out_of-band via voice (phone)can be supported. How Symplified chooses to support this within its framework is up to you.An example SAML assertion with the required elements is provided for reference.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Two Issues
description: Shaun, after reviewing an issue with SSO authentication for external IDR users, it appears all of the customizations I made to the External IDR config were reverted at 11AM on Dec. 10th… I do not know how or why that happened, but it completely broke the authentication handling on the IDR. The “username_short” attribute I added to our userstore settings was lost (even though it is being correctly reported by the userstore web service), as were all of the changes made to the SimPL application settings instructing it to use this attribute, as well as the access policy. Do you know what could have caused this? I have re-added the customizations required to the IDR config and published it. It is working now, and this resolved all the issues as far as I can tell – but since I do not know how the configuration was reverted I don’t know if it will happen again or not… Tyler – ignore the email I sent about the 2 users. That was due to the above issue which was not related to SimPL. However, I did find another issue with the session handling in SimPL while troubleshooting this. It appears that even on an unsuccessful login attempt to SimPL a session of some sort is created and is maintained (using a cookie perhaps, not sure). This creates the following problem: 1. A user logs into our portal and clicks the SSO link to access SimpL (call this user X).2. For whatever reason the login fails (user does not exist in SimPL, for example).3. User logs out of our portal and another user logs into it (user Y) on the same machine. It is now impossible for the 2nd user to access SimPL - because it doesn’t release the session from the first failed login attempt… It simply keeps reporting that user X could not be authenticated, even though user X is not the person attempting to access SimPL any longer. Releasing the session on logout does not fix this, since there is actually no logged in user to speak of… I do not know what is required to do this in the SimPL system, but upon a failed login attempt the current “session” need to be nullified (or better yet do not create it until after authentication is successful if possible). Krist and Keith – As of right now the SSO between the provider portal and SimPL is working correctly for all external IDR users (with the exception of the issue with session handling, but that does not affect successful logins) Heath ProvostWeb DeveloperSchumacher Group
name: Schumacher Group

Below is the information you need for your changes. Let me know if you need anything else. I don't have access to create CMs so I'm going to need some help on that. When would you be able to complete your changes? The set up in ASPEN for each user for single sign-on can be done independent of the upgrade, so it does not have to happen on Monday. subject: 9.0 SWS SDK CLI Documentation is inaccurate
description: The doc/singlepoint-idr-cli-reference.pdf and README.txt documents in the SWS SDK zip file do not appear to accurately reflect the commands required in order to set the environment up correctly.For instance:1. On page 2, step 2 of singlepoint-idr-cli-reference.pdf: The document says to set environment variable SWS_HOME to the path of the API directory. In my testing this appears to actually be SWS_SDK_HOME. It is referenced as SWS_HOME throughout the document and README.txt. When calling the command with SDK_HOME, the script returns the following result:SWS_SDK_HOME environment variable was not set correctly. This variable should be the directory name where you installed the SDK.In viewing all the bash and windows scripts, it is clear that this variable is the one being expected, NOT SWS_HOME.2. Step 7 of the PDF says to test the installation by running sws --version . There is no sws command in the bin directory. There is an idr command, and running idr --version produces the expected output (9.0). The README.txt refers to idr.Running the sws command simply returns an error from the operating system that the binary was not found."-bash: sws: command not found"3. The README file references the old SDK variables (%SINGLEPOINT_IDR_SDK_HOME%) and also mentions that Java 1.7 is required (PDF says 1.6)I can lend my assistance in getting this information properly documented.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: SumTotal Deep linking fails with new IWA
description: Deep linking fails when using new IWA. I have tested deep linking with the Biogen SumTotal application which is using deep linking with IdP initiated SAML. SumTotal is passing us an ru="relay state" parameter appended to the IdP servlet URL and ID parameter. This currently affects Biogen and VNSNY and possibly all new IWA customers that use deep linking.I have not been able to test this with an SP initiated SAML application due to SD lacking an environment to test this in. Ryan is currently setting up and environment that we can use to test this in using an SP initiated app and confirm. I am including Ryan and Lenore on this ticket as I will be on vacation next week and Lenore is going to be the Biogen point of contact in lieu of me. Also note that they have pushed the SumTotal application go-live date to Tuesday, December 27th and are hoping that we can get this fixed by then. I have not guaranteed, promised, or otherwise committed to that time line and told them I will let them know an eta as soon as I have one.Steps to replicate* Clear browser cache* Run httpfox* Log into appsnet.biogenidec.com* amcgill / B1og3n550* Go to http://stage.sumtotalsystems.com/biogen82/app/management/LMS_ActDetails.aspx?UserMode=0&ActivityId=4714 (deep link)* Note the page you are landed on and the relay state parameter* Clear browser cache* Clear httpfox * Start httpfox* Join the computer to the domain and ensure access to IWA server* Go to http://stage.sumtotalsystems.com/biogen82/app/management/LMS_ActDetails.aspx?UserMode=0&ActivityId=4714 (deep link)* You should be auto-logged in via IWA and landed on a different SumTotal page (note the page)* Examine httpfox and you will see that the relay state was not transmitted to SumTotal with the SAML assertion and will see that they passed us the relay state with the POST to the SumTotal application IdP Servlet URL* Net, we drop the relay state when using new IWA
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Lack of consistency between user stores for passing source attributes in headers
description: There seems to be a lack of consistency in the handling of passing attributes in the X-SINGLEPOINT between user stores. In the case of AD even if there are no values for source attributes that are marked to be passed they are passed with empty values typically as [0]. In the case of a user store such as SF if a source attribute is marked to be passed and there are no values nothing gets passed including the source attribute name.I believe this may have something to do with null versus empty string in the vales for a given attribute but it woudld seem that "singlepoint" broadly defined should be checking for that.

subject: Trust Connector/keychain to support multiple Password parameters
description: Customer Rewards Network has application (Ericom) with a login page that accepts two sets of username/password credentials -- one to log into the web app, and one that the web app passes along to a thick client.This works, but the Trust Connector tool only really lets you specify* one form input to be of purpose "Username" and one of purpose "Password" -- the others have to be Credential. This workaround results in the 2nd password appearing in cleartext in the keychain. Not good.*If you try and set two parameters both to be of type Password, the UI changes their labels to match one another, and the keychain editing tool (on the ribbon) only shows a single password field.Setting priority to Critical because Rewards Network can't go to production with passwords in cleartext in the keychains.

subject: Dow Jones Venture Compensation Study
description: Dear Jonti McLaren,Welcome to the Dow Jones & Co. CompensationPro Study!Our survey focuses on compiling the most up to date and definitive report on compensation and stock option practices among venture capital-backed companies in the US. We have been conducting this study for over ten years, which tracks hundreds of venture-backed companies to provide a valuable picture of the compensation landscape among startups. We appreciate your help in expanding our study. If your firm has recently participated in the study, we encourage you to complete this new survey to account for employee or salary changes. The survey data is completely anonymous, and we will never reveal company names. The resulting data from the survey will be aggregated on macro levels to calculate statistics and identify general trends. The deadline to the complete the survey is Friday, February 24, 2012.In appreciation for your participation, we will send a report free of charge just for survey participants. To see a sample copy from our recent study, please go to www.dowjones.com/privatemarkets/research/Compensation Survey_2010.xlsYou will receive a similar copy of this report approximately one month after the end of the survey. If necessary, please forward this email to the correct executive at your company. Should you have questions, please contact us via email at research.privatemarkets@dowjones.com or call (415)439-6633.Regards,Dow Jones & Co. Private Markets Research Team201 California Street, 10th Floor | San Francisco, CA 94111Email: research.privatemarkets@dowjones.comPhone: (415)439-6633Fax: (415)439-6693http://survey.fis.dowjones.com/pekosurvey/surveyform.aspx?sid=9113E3FE-54AA-460E-8C82-CCF02534ED6AThank you,The Research Team

subject: Chatter customer invitations will be automatically enabled with the Spring ’12 release
description: Chatter customer invitations will be automatically enabled with the Spring ’12 release   You are receiving this email because our records indicate you are an administrator of a Salesforce CRM Org. Product & Service Notification RE: Org ID 00D500000007EiFDear Symplified, At salesforce.com, customer success is our top priority, and it is our goal to ensure you get the most value out of our products. With that in mind, we will be automatically enabling Chatter customer invitations in the Spring '12 release to give your users the ability to invite customers and partners to collaborate in private, secure customer groups. You are receiving this email because we have identified you as a system administrator of a salesforce.com organization that will be affected by this change.What is the change? Chatter customer invitations will be automatically enabled with the Spring '12 release. Read the FAQ: http://www.salesforce.com/chatter/customer-invitations/faq/Why are we making this change? To enable end-users to take advantage of Chatter customer groups.How will this change impact me? At the time of the Spring '12 release your Salesforce users will be able to invite people from outside your organization to participate in private, secure customer groups in Chatter.What action must I take? If you would like customer invitations to be automatically enabled for your organization, you do not need to take any action. If you would not like customer invitations to be automatically enabled, you need to submit your salesforce.com Organization ID in this online form: http://www.salesforce.com/form/contact/customer-invitations.jspWhat will happen if I take no action? Chatter customer invitations will be automatically enabled in the Spring '12 release.What if I want additional external user licenses for my users? Your users may extend as many customer invitations as they would like during the promotional period between now and Dreamforce '12 (September 17, 2012). During the promotional period if you need additional external user licenses, please contact Customer Support and we will be happy to grant you additional licenses at no cost.How can I get more information? Customer Support works in conjunction with our Technology & Products team and are all equipped to answer questions you may have.Best regards, salesforce.com Customer Support  Copyright 2000-2012 salesforce.com - All rights reserved. subject: Changes in Google Docs Integration with Salesforce
description: You are receiving this email because our records indicate you are an administrator of a Salesforce CRM Org.  Org ID: 00D500000007EiF  Product & Service Notification Dear Symplified, At salesforce.com, trust is our top priority, and it is our goal to ensure that any changes we make have a minimal impact on your business processes. You are receiving this email because we have identified you as a system administrator of a salesforce.com organization that is impacted by an upcoming change to Google Docs integration with Salesforce.What is changing?  Google is constantly changing and evolving their technology infrastructure. As a result of one of these changes, we have recently learned that the Salesforce “Google Docs” tab will no longer function as of January 5, 2012. All other Google Docs integrations within Salesforce (i.e. Attachments to Salesforce records, and Salesforce CRM Content) are not affected by this change.What is the Salesforce “Google Docs” tab? The Google Docs tab allows users to access their Google Docs account from within Salesforce. This tab can be turned on by the system administrator under Setup->Google Apps->Settings. Once it is turned on, individual users can add the tab to their Salesforce interface.The tab relies on a piece of functionality provided by Google called the “Google DocList gadget”. The Google DocList gadget was part of the Google Labs program. Google decided to phase out their Google Labs program and officially announced that decision on September 11, 2011. In early December, Salesforce received notice that the DocList gadget would be retired, and that the Salesforce Google Docs tab would no longer function as of January 5, 2012. What is the impact on my organization and users? On January 5, 2012, Salesforce users who access the Google Docs tab will see an error message indicating that the tab is no longer working. To minimize any inconvenience to the user, we are providing within the error message a link that the user can simply click to log directly into Google Docs. What action must I take? No action is required. If you wish, you can turn off the Google Docs tab for all your users.How can I get more information? For general information on Google docs functionality within Salesforce, please go to Salesforce help and search for “Using Google Docs in Salesforce”. Note that it is only the first bullet point on this help page that is being affected. Please contact Customer Support for more information on this specific change. Best regards, salesforce.com Customer Support  Copyright 2000-2012 salesforce.com - All rights reserved. Salesforce and the "no software" logo are registered trademarks of salesforce.com, inc., and salesforce.com owns other registered and unregistered trademarks. Other names used herein may be trademarks of their respective owners. Salesforce.com, inc. The Landmark @ One Market, Suite 300, San Francisco, CA, 94105, United States[http://notify.salesforce.com/pub/as?_ri_=X0Gzc2X%3DUQpglLjHJlTQzeBQiiPeQizbTDQizfcQLSqkeQGQfQwBBVXHkMX%3Dw&_ei_=.]

subject: Moody's & Element-K SSO
description: - copying Symplified Support in David’s absence Team,We are preparing to run a pilot of the Element-K Knowledge Hub, beginning next week. As communicated in my prior email, we would like to have the single sign-on activate on January 10 to enable our pilot testers. We plan to upload a current version of our employee data file in advance. Please let me know what activities are required to make this happen and who will be responsible for them. If there are any activities required of Moody’s, other than the data upload, I will coordinate. Thanks in advance, ..............................................Jason Muldoon212.553.4045 tel  From: Ken Aponte [mailto:Ken_Aponte@elementk.com]Sent: Friday, December 16, 2011 11:50 AMTo: Muldoon, Jason; dlumpkin@symplified.com <dlumpkin@symplified.com> Cc: Giaritta, Damon; Managed Services(notes) <managed_services@elementk.com>Subject: RE: Moody's SSO Test Results & Observations  Hello Jason, Sorry this has been so problematic. The reason we fail these requests is to avoid replay attacks which would be an attempt by a hacker to capture the request in transit and then resend it to gain access to the system. We can’t relax this behavior. We don’t support multiple windows / tabs for the same user which be why your first use case is failing. We have never seen the problem described in the 2nd bullet before. I don’t think it is related to setup on our side. As far as production goes, it will be a quick change in settings on my side to change the URL to the production org in KHub. We do have to ensure that each PersID in your system exists in our system or else SSO will fail. I suggest sending us a dump 1 week before production in the format that Damon previously provided so we can compare accounts between systems and create what accounts we need to create. Regards,Ken  From: Muldoon, Jason [mailto:Jason.Muldoon@moodys.com]Sent: Friday, December 16, 2011 10:40 AMTo: Ken Aponte; dlumpkin@symplified.comCc: Giaritta, DamonSubject: RE: Moody's SSO Test Results & Observations Gentlemen,It seems we have reached a sticking point and I am wondering if someone is waiting for another person to take some action. As you are aware, the basic SSO is working for the pilot but fails under the following two cases:· When the user tries to launch a new session and an existing session is already open in another window or tab· When the user tries to launch a new session shortly after closing a previous session (at least 3-4 minutes) Is there anything we can do to resolve these two failures? If so, what and who should be following up? Also, wanted to let you know that we plan to go live on January 10th. Please let me know what I need to do to facilitate the deployment in the production environment. Thanks, ..............................................Jason Muldoon212.553.4045 tel From: Muldoon, JasonSent: Tuesday, December 06, 2011 11:17To: 'Ken Aponte'; dlumpkin@symplified.comCc: Giaritta, DamonSubject: RE: Moody's SSO Test Results & Observations Are there any next steps? I can definitely see the multi-tab/multi-browser issue occurring and causing confusion for some people. But more so, the session caching. Is there anything we can do, or is it simply a case of knowing the limitations and managing expectations from here? ..............................................Jason Muldoon212.553.4045 tel From: Ken Aponte [mailto:Ken_Aponte@elementk.com]Sent: Thursday, December 01, 2011 16:01To: Muldoon, Jason; dlumpkin@symplified.comCc: Giaritta, DamonSubject: RE: Moody's SSO Test Results & Observations I guess if these are valid test scenarios then the only thing it could be is that caching may be interfering (even when you open and close the browser?) It could bt the server is caching the Authentication Request and re-using it? We are seeing the same types of errors in the logs as last time: 'Response InResponseTo attribute value corresponds to an authentication request that has already been consumed'   From: Muldoon, Jason [mailto:Jason.Muldoon@moodys.com]Sent: Thursday, December 01, 2011 1:36 PMTo: Ken Aponte; dlumpkin@symplified.comCc: Giaritta, DamonSubject: Moody's SSO Test Results & Observations Gentlemen,I have conducted two test session for the SSO authentication and have included my notes below. We’re still seeing some access denied and page unavailable issues, but would defer to you for a better understanding of why. 11/22 @ 11:40AMRaghav SinghChristine DeLeonibus 1st attempt – both parties enteredhttps://moodys.elearn.com into new browser window and accessed successfullySubsequent attempts received either access denied or page unavailable errors when opening in new tabs (with Elearn still open) or new browser (with no other browsers open) 12/01 @ 12:42PMRaghav Singh 1st attempt - enteredhttps://moodys.elearn.com into new browser window and accessed Please open the attachment to view the entire email.

subject: Error in saving pages in Socialtext when going through Symplified
description: Symplified has built an adapter to our Socialtext appliance. When we are going through Symplified, and when we are in Socialtext, if I try to Create a page and save the page, it gives and error message saying the page already exists – even though there is no page by that name. It does not matter what page name we provide, the error message is the same. As a way of debugging Socialtext suggested that we bypass Symplified and then try the same process. Accordingly I put in the host IP of Socialtext appliance in my host file and did the same process. I did not get the error this time. So this indicates that somehow Symplified is causing some script to fail which is causing this issue in Socialtext.This is an extremely high priority issue for us now as no one is able to save any pages or create any pages in Socialtext. This happens in IE browsers and most of our users are on IE.I have attached a few screenshots for your reference.Please look into this and let us know if you need more information.ThanksJay312-422-2216

subject: IWA Connector documentation should include network connectivity requirements, Client configuration requirements
description: As of 9.0, the IWA Connector.pdf document didn't include important information about the network connectivity requirements for the Windows IIS server hosting the IWAConnector. For example, it should list the requirements that it be joined to the Windows domain (with the list of ports required for this), and it should list that end users need to be able to access it via https (443). The document should also include information or references to documentation on how to configure supported browsers to use IWA (e.g. adding the IIS server to the local intranet or trusted sites list).-- (Lenore opening this on behalf of Bruce Ong)
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Symplified branding in Help
description: We are seeing under some circumstances that the Symplified branding for Help is appearing in non-"uber"-admin context in customer instances. Steps to reproduce:1) Set context to a customer instance.2) When you’re there click on the life preserver icon on the main screen - you should get the Symantec branding.3) Close the tab that opens with the Help and then navigate to Edit Profile in the upper right hand corner.4) Select that and then once it opens click on the life preserver icon here and you should get the Symplified branding.5) Now close that and the tab and go back to the main screen and click on the life preserver again and you may or may not get the Symantec branding.We're not sure if this is because the "uber-admin" does not have branded Symantec and when changing context things are getting mixed up or not.

subject: Some questions re: O3 deployment
description: 1) For an IDR virtual appliance that's in the amazon AMI format, my current requirement specification says it needs a "64 bit Amazon Platform in a LARGE configuration". Is this correct? Will somebody who knows Amazon pretty well understand what this means? If not, what's the real requirement specification language?2) For AMI gateway in HA deployment, how is shared keychain file accomplished? I assume it's not done through CIFS/NFS, but rather through S3? Any documentation on Amazon AMI HA?3) For an AIM gateway image, does it need outbound access to a DNS server via TCP/UDP port 53, in order to resolve the CNAMES of the protected applications?4) For a VM gateway image, with portal and management interfaces, do both interfaces need outbound access to a DNS server via TCP/UDP 53 to resolve the CNAMES of the protected applications?5) Does the PORTAL interface for a VMware/KVM appliance need UDP outbound access on port 67 to a local DHCP server to obtain an ip address for the initial configuration, or is it only for the Management interface?Appreciate response by Friday Jan 13.

subject: KeyChain CLI - Not Specifying Subnet in SPS denies access to all
description: When configuring an Administrator in SPS, the API Configuration tab has a field called "Routes" under "Allowed Access Networks." If you do not specify a subnet/IP, the command fails with "User X is not authorized." If we wish to enforce the specification of a subnet, should we then make the "routes" field a required one?Steps to reproduce:1. Create a super admin in SPS, enable the Web Services API. Do not specify a route.2. Save and publish.3. From your workstation, run an IDR command from the CLI, such as idr-describe-keychains -s serverip -k accessid/accesskey . You should get a response from the CLI: User X is not authorized.4. Go back into studio, and add a subnet or IP that you are connecting from.5. Save and publish.6. Launch the same CLI command again. It should now work.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Custom portal can't distinguish between reasons for login page redirect (user logged out vs. session timeout vs. no session)
description: As of 9.1, it looks like users can get redirected to the defined login page with one of the following parameters:a) ?singlepoint-error-message=Not authenticated, please provide authentication information.This one seems to show up if you try and access a protected resource when you don't have a session, including after you've timed out of an existing session)b) ?logged_out=truethis one seems to show up if you click "logout" (hit the LogoutServlet)Our custom portal example php code includes logic to check for session expiration as well as invalid credentials, but it looks like the names have changed since the examples were written, and I don't see a distinguishable difference between a user who has timed out of their session and one who has never logged in.This ticket request is to:1) Add another parameter string to distinguish when a user's session timed out2) Update the Custom Portal API documentation and the custom portal example code with the current strings that can be used to detect each of these different states.Why is this important? * Because we don't have a way to log users out of SAML apps when they log out (or time out) of the IDR, we need to be able to include logic on the custom portal login page to handle these cases and trigger a user logout of SAML apps.* Because we need to be consistent in how we handle these cases and have up-to-date documentation for custom portal implementations
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: SAML Cert Generated w/Out Logging into IdR
description: The issue: A SAML cert with unique user identifying information is being generated after entering a Salesforce instances URL into a broswer-- without logging into the IdR. Note that this behavior was reported to begin after the upgrade to 9.1 and that Zynga is the only one reporting this issue. They are not using IWA and I was able to reproduce this issue using a SOCKS proxy from two different Symplified computers. Steps to reproduce* Integrate via SAML 2.0 direct with Salesforce. * Set the IdP Salesforce app in studio to add a suffix to the nameID (Zynga is using @zynga.barkbeta)* Sign the assertion only* Include the SAML cert* Use SP initiated SAML in the generic adapter* Publish configuration* Open Firefox and HTTPFox* Start HTTPFox* Go to the Saleforce instance URL (Zynga uses https://zynga--barkbeta.cs11.my.salesforce.com)* You should receive a Saleforce SAML error* Stop HTTPFox* View the http/https traffic and note that a SAML assertion is generated and sent to Salesforce without ever logging into Salesforce* In the case of Salesforce, even though I have never logged in, the nameID sent in the assertion is the unique identifier for Andy Lee, the engineer setting up this app for ZyngaPlease let me know if there are any other questions or if more information is needed.Avery

subject: Rewards Network - MCT application & companions
description: Rewards Network has an internal-only app that I'm having trouble getting working with the Trust Connector. Basically, the workflow is:Request the desired resource: http://ia.idine.com/mcat/index1.htmlGet redirected to login page: https://rn-cas.idine.com/cas/login?service=https%3A%2F%2Fia.idine.com%2Fmcat%2Fj_acegi_cas_security_checkLog in, then get redirected back to the requested resource.The application discovers cleanly, and I've added all the involved webservers to the application config, but no matter what I do, it doesn't successfully log me in. Instead, I get redirected back to the login page (under the protected URL). Behind the scenes, it looks like the POST URL includes a JSESSIONID. I've tried removing that in the trust connector, but still have no luck. I suspect we need to actually pass this through from the cookie that's set. There are some details in the thread below on how the developer/admin says the authentication piece is supposed to work.I'm hoping someone in Dev can give me a hand with getting this working, either with the Trust Connector or with a different adapter if one exists that does this. I've got some Live HTTP Headers output and screenshots, and will upload them to this Parature ticket. Start with the Word doc, then reference the headers files mentioned for each use case. Please let me know if you need any additional information. If it would be valuable to talk with the developer (Mark), Brian has offered to set that up, too.Thanks,Lenore---------- Forwarded message ----------From: Lenore Tumey<ltumey@symplified.com>Date: Fri, Feb 3, 2012 at 10:12 AMSubject: Re: FW: MCT login ceremonyTo: Mark Sage <msage@rewardsnetwork.com>Cc: Brian Paetow <bpaetow@rewardsnetwork.com>, Christopher Toledo <ctoledo@rewardsnetwork.com>, Daniel Borrego <dborrego@rewardsnetwork.com>Hi Mark,My suspicion is that if the jsessionid isn't included in the POST, that some other process grabs the jsessionid from your cookie and provides it. If you do the same test as below, but delete your JSESSIONID cookie before actually performing the POST, does it still successfully log you in?Thanks,LenoreOn Thu, Feb 2, 2012 at 11:05 AM, Mark Sage <msage@rewardsnetwork.com> wrote:It does not appear to be required and it is generated on the fly. I just logged into MCT in production successfully. I updated the action in FireBug to be the following:login;?service=https%3A%2F%2Fia.idine.com%2Fmcat%2Fj_acegi_cas_security_checkinstead of login;jsessionid=FC0D6DF0EFC4AB92574B4CC87FE71FF3?service=https%3A%2F%2Fia.idine.com%2Fmcat%2Fj_acegi_cas_security_checkYou should verify it works as you expect on your end also. Hope that helps.Mark Sage | Senior Java DeveloperRewards Network | RewardsNetwork.com2 N. subject: Missing favicon should not lead to error page
description: When we upgraded to 8.9 I think it was, we introduced a change in behavior. Basically, if a custom portal landing page or other protected h-fed resource didn't have a favicon, and a user attempted to request that resource before having established a session with the IDR, they'd get sent to the defined error page instead of the requested/landing page because the IDR would detect the 404 not found and interpret that as an error. This was a pain to diagnose because there wasn't anything in the logs really indicating why a user was suddenly at the error page, and we pretty much had to use tools like HttpFox to figure out that the browser's request for a not-present favicon.ico file was what triggered this. Despite the notes in Parature 16057-3067, this favicon behavior has not changed.The workaround has been to ask the web server admin to install a favicon, but this is brittle, and customers (Zurich) are concerned that if one web server admin misses this, it could lead to a really unpleasant user experience.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Clicking links to protected apps from MS Word lands user at portal landing page
description: To reproduce:Create a MS Word document, and type or paste in a URL to a protected application. This can be SAML, H-Fed, or No-Auth. For example, paste in a link to a bookmarked google doc.Click the link in the Word document. This will launch your default browser.If you are not logged in, you'll be redirected to the login page. Log in. You'll then land at the portal landing page (not the requested link).If you are already logged in, you'll just be redirected to the portal landing page (so just clicking the link from Word again doesn't help).Copying/pasting the URL into your browser will take you to the requested page (after login, if necessary).Zurich reported this with MS Word & Excel 2007 on Windows with IE7. I reproduced it on a Mac OS X box w/ Word for Mac 2011 & Firefox 3.6.16Theories/research info will be added as comments.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Ericom/AS400 adapter for Rewards Network
description: Rewards Network has an internally accessible web-based application to allow their users to access their AS400 systems. Ericom (the vendor) created a custom login page that accepts the following:AD usernameAD passwordAD domainAS400 usernameAS400 passwordOnly the AD username, password, and domain are required to log into the Ericom website, but if the AS400 username and password are set, they'll be put into a cookie which is then passed to the AS400 client so the user doesn't have to manually enter in their AS400 credentials.This application discovers fine with the Trust Connector, and SSO into the AS400 system works using this workflow, but since we can only support one 'password' (everything else is cleartext in the portal as well as in the keychain CLI), this is not a good fit. We can't have AS400 passwords be visible. Rather than rework the keychain handling for this one use case, Topher had an idea of creating a custom adapter for the AS400 piece that would populate the required cookie with the AS400 creds a user would enter in their keychain and launch the AS400 client directly. This would also allow us to create multiple AS400 environment 'applications' so a user could launch the one they want right from the ribbon.Because this is an internal-only application, I have collected Charles proxy output from the login ceremony (attached). I can also provide the html from the Ericom login or landing pages if needed.It looks to me like we'll need an adapter to allow for at least the following variables:- Keychain entries for the AS400 username & password, mapping to customizable cookie entry (e.g. IBMinfo=IBMUser...)- AS400 Connection Type (e.g. 5)- AS400 Connection Name (e.g. AS400_FF)We may also need something to accommodate these, if we won't be using a separate Trust Connector app:- URL to Ericom login page- URL to Ericom landing page (not sure if this is needed)- Keychain for AD username, password, & domain (if we could do sso passthru for this, that'd be best!)Please let me know if you need anything else to be able to start development of this adapter.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: HA IDRs redirecting to their own hostnames instead of to VIP portal/login pages
description: I've been seeing some strange (but unfortunately intermittent) behavior related to HA configurations.Rambus Dev and Rambus Prod are both configured for HA, with load balancers and NFS and configured VIPs. For the last several days, Rambus Dev was working fine, but Rambus Prod was redirecting any user requests that were going to the vip (https://login.rambus.com) to the IDR's own hostname (e.g. https://bcxsv-sso2.rambus.com/portal/ribbon/portal.html). I checked and double-checked the configs. Disabled/published/re-configured/published the HA settings. Still no luck. Then I cleared the cache, etc. using ops' /usr/local/bin/IDRConfigRefresh.sh script, which does the following:Stop the tomcat serviceRemove the xml files from /usr/local/symplified/cacheRemove the mavenrepoRemove the contents of the temp and work folders from /usr/local/symplified/apache-tomcatAnd will restart the tomcat service when done.Then, things magically started working! User requests now stay at the login.rambus.com hostname as they should. FYI, I took a bundlelogs on their 2nd prod IDR before and after running the IDRConfigRefresh.sh script. A bit later, we were working with them on their Dev environment. Their admin was in studio fiddling with the default portal background page settings and published the changes. At about the same time, we noticed that the Dev IDR had started behaving badly with hostname handling (users who were trying to open up https://login.rambuspc.com were getting redirected to the Dev IDR hostname, hqxsv-ssodev1.rambuspc.com). I tried using the same cache-clearing script, but this time it had no effect. Then Ryan tried it and also restarted singlepoint services after running the cache-clearing script, and things started working correctly again.All of their IDRs seem to be behaving correctly right now, but I'm not feeling confident that they should go live until we figure out what's going on. The load balancer name (VIP) for the Prod environment is login.rambus.com. Both the "before-bad" and "after-ok" versions of the customer.xml contain this name in two lines. The first is: <loadBalancerName>login.rambus.com</loadBalancerName>The second is a really long blob that I believe is related to the New IWA configuration (the SP url includes the VIP hostname):"https://login.rambus.com/SPServlet?sp_id\\\\\\\\u003daj0fa40dqbi4\\\\\\\"The bundlelogs are on tigger -- https://tigger.symplified.net/logdrop/before-bad: https://tigger.symplified.net/logdrop/symplified_bcxsv-sso2.rambus.com_2012-02-22_13-01-13.tar.gzafter-ok: https://tigger.symplified.net/logdrop/symplified_bcxsv-sso2.rambus.com_2012-02-22_13-04-20.tar.gzIt sounds like maybe the configuration is being pushed down, but somehow the httpd.conf is not being written out correctly? Both before and after, it contained this:<VirtualHost 10.60.20.157:443> ServerName bcxsv-sso2.rambus.com ServerAlias bcxsv-sso2.rambus.comNote that both names are the same, which Max indicates is not correct.The only other unique things about their configuration are that:1) They're using "new IWA" (configured as auto authN source) in both Prod and Dev2) Their prod environment has the two HA IDRs located in different datacenters (both are mounting the same NFS share, though)3) Their dev environment has just one IDR, but it is behind a load balancer w/ VIP and is using NFS to be as close to the prod configuration as possible.4) Their prod environment doesn't yet have any applications configured.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: users with same username in different domains can wind up seeing one anothers' keychains
description: Scenario: two user stores, each with its own set of users. If there are any overlapping usernames (e.g. user1/pass1 in AD1 and user1/pass2 in AD2), and if users log into the IDR using their sAMAccountName, and if policies allow these users to access the same applications, then when user1 and user2 log in, they'll have the same keychain and potentially be able to log into someone else's account/application.Workaround is to create application groups/policies to limit access to applications based on the user store. Not sure how to "fix" this without potentially breaking cases where we intentionally like to see this behavior (e.g. user store hunting for failover purposes)
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Estimate/feasibility for Netsuite proprietary SSO support
description: Netsuite has concerns around us using a reverse proxy for SSO integration with them using our HTTP-Fed adapter. Note that they haven't provided any specifics, just FUD and a recommendation that we should use their own proprietary SSO approach. To that end, they've set us up with 2 new SDN environments in which they're enabling their SSO feature.The attached PDF describes their SSO approach. Based on this information, can we estimate the level of effort it would take for us to use this method of SSO integration? Note that we are not (yet) requesting that this adapter be built, just an idea of whether it would be possible and the effort involved.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: IDR should start even if one user store is inaccessible
description: Currently (as of 9.1), if you have any User Stores configured that aren't accessible, and then publish a change to the IDR, it will take a really long time for the IDR to come back up. I understand that this can be somewhat mitigated by reducing the timeout in the user store configurations, but I don't understand why an IDR doesn't just continue to start up services even if a user store is inaccessible. You could have multiple user stores configured, another of which is working fine, and the IDR would be red just because a single user store is inaccessible.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: SinglePoint Should respect unique user Identifier
description: A low level helpdesk technician could easily manipulate LDAP attributes in order to impersonate another user's account.Consider the following:Helpdesk technician A modifies "mail" attribute in AD to that of user B. User A logs in with a known good account (test account, his own), and can now authenticate to SAML apps relying on mail attribute for authentication. User B never knows his account for SAML apps has been compromised.Additionally:User A waits after hours and renames sAMAccount name of UserB. User A renames/creates another account with the original name of UserA. UserB can then login and access all hfed apps along with UserB's keychain data.Possible Solution:Request 3887 requests an enhancement to the keychain alogrithm that respects a unique, non-mutable attribute of the directory. In the case of AD, this could potentially be objectSID or objectGUID. In openldap, this could be objectGUID.An option to prohibit login if the unique identifier/username pairing does not match what's in the SPS database would increase the security of the product. Also, generating a syslog event if this occurs would also be desirable.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Box Sync issues
description: Hello, ESPN is rolling out Box.net through the Symplified portal this coming Monday. We were hoping to be able to use the Box Sync product which allows you to drag and drop files from your computer into Box.net, but we’re running into an issue where we can’t get Box Sync to connect through SSO. There are a couple symptoms depending on your OS. In Windows 7, when you install Box Sync and try to connect for the first time, you choose login through SSO and the application tries to connect but eventually fails saying there’s no connection to the internet. If you use Mac, you again choose SSO and it pops up a window with the Symplified portal, you put in your credentials and it says it’s logging you in, then the window goes away and the Box Sync eventually times out and also says failed to connect. I’ve attached screen shots of both occurrences. Does Symplified support this feature of Box.net?  Thanks,Bill Iselin
name: ESPN

subject: Two connector for the same app in two different app folders
description: This use case does not seem to work:1. I created two app folders: Accounting, and Sales, reflecting the two AD groups I have - accounting, and sales.2. I create a Concur connector in accounting folder3. I create a Concur connector in sales folder4. At accounting folder leve, I created a policy that says "only users from my accounting group can access apps in this folder"5. At sales folder level, I created a policy that says, "only users from my sales group can access apps in this folder"6. I log in as a user in my accounting group, and I see the Concur icon in my ribbon. I click on it, I go to concur, and I enter my concur credential at the keychain prompt, and click "continue", and I am in Concur.7. I log in as a user in my sales group, and I see the Concur icon in my ribbon. I click on it. I get an error "Ooops. Unauthorized Application... You do not have permission to access the application you requested."This baffles me. The policy is defined based on the user context (memberOf in AD). As long as I satisfy the condition, I should be able to access the application. Why can't I?I have a use case where I want different "administrators" for different regions of my company to manage their own folder of applications they want their users to have access to. And different regions may have a few applications in common. What I don't want to do is to create a connector at the "top" folder and then write a global rule that says "allow access for users from accounting AND sales groups" because I want to delegate that to the regional level
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: DNS Resolves via IPV6 Before IPV4
description: DNS appears to attempt to resolve via IPV6 before IPV4. This typically isn't an issue except for when a customer is using a low DNS TTL (i.e. 30 seconds). This results in DNS resolution appearing to take up to 60 seconds. This issue is particularly magnified in Trust Cloud deployments. I have a tcpdump of this issue which I am not attaching here and can provide when requested. Steps to Reproduce (used on BMC dev IdR)From a customer IdR* initiate tcpdump on port 53 (watch DNS traffic)* wget https://<application> --no-check certificate* stop tcpdump
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Cannot Integrate with a New Salesforce Customer Portal Via SAML
description: SummaryDolby is currently trying to integrate with a new Salesforce customer portal instance via SAML and it is failing. IssueSalesforce requires that all customer portals use the same IdP URL and ID for each customer portal. Each customer portal is differentiated using the portal and organization ID that is passed as an extended SAML attribute. Symplified's IdR currently differentiates each application adapter using the SAML IdP URL. As a result, the configuration appears not to be working.

Thanks,Bill IselinESPN From: Symplified Support [mailto:support@symplified.com] Sent: Tuesday, March 27, 2012 8:00 PMTo: SAWSubject: Symplified 2012 Spring Release [https://c.na3.content.force.com/servlet/servlet.ImageServer?id=01550000000TdCn&oid=00D500000007EiF]Dear ESPN SAW, We are pleased to announce the Spring 2012 Feature Release of Symplified's IAM service offering. This release includes the following enhancements: Default Symplified Portal Customization and Enhancement: Admins will now be able to change the name and title of your default portal page, as well as error messages (ie. a phone number) that occur from incorrect user actions.HIgh Availability Enhancements: Identity Routers in HA now share session information to achieve seamless node failover. In order to enable this feature, TCP Port 9700 must be open to each node in the cluster. Please consult online documentation or contact Customer Support for more information on the above enhancements. For Enterprise Upgrade customers, the release schedule is as follows:Development Environment: Will be upgraded on Tuesday, April 3rd, from 9 PM - 3 AM MST. Test Environment: Will be upgraded on Tuesday, April 10th, from 9 PM - 3 AM MST.Production Environment: Will be upgraded on Saturday, April 14th from 8 AM - 12 PM MST. During these windows, SinglePoint Studio and Identity Routers will experience short periods of unavailability. Please do not attempt to make any modifications during these published times. Please contact us if you have any questions.  Thank You.  The Symplified Team303.318.4188 x2http://support.symplified.com[http://na3.salesforce.com/servlet/servlet.ImageServer?oid=00D500000007EiF&esid=0185000000Ic6WU]Please open the attachment to view the entire email.

subject: clean up trainingcloudXX environments
description: Hi,This might be a great New Guy<tm> task...We need to un-configure all 5 trainingcloudXX.com environments. This includes deleting all:* applications & application groups* webserver objects* user stores - note that you'll need to delete all apps and remove the user store from the default config before you can delete the user store itself* IdPs (like IWA)* SimpleLink* Administrators other than the superadmin@ account (leave that one there)* Strong Auth configsWe also need to revert the following to the default:* portal configuration (back to default ribbon, standard colors, language, & name)* AuthN sources (to list the portal only, not any external IdPs)* API keys (uncheck the box in the admins)* policies (check just in case anyone created a non-standard 'all applications' policy)* audit logging (set to file only)Once all these changes are made, please publish to the IDR.Let me know when this is done for all 5 environments, and then we'll upgrade them and then turn off the IDRs in Amazon.Thanks,Lenore--Lenore TumeySr. Solutions Engineerphone: mailto:ltumey@symplified.comReachSymplified Supporthttp://www.symplified.com/supportportalor call: 303-318-4188 option 2SymplifiedThe Cloud Identity Companyhttp://www.symplified.com/http://www.symplified.com/Symplified-In-Wall-St-Journal-Fortune-Surpasses-3p8-Million-Users

subject: IWA Connector - You receive "Please install the Windows Authentication Role Service" but you already have this option installed
description: When installing the SinglepointIWA Connector, you continually receive this error message on Windows 2008 64-bit platforms (non-R2). This happens because the installer is a 32 bit application, and when it queries the registry to ascertain if the Windows Authentication component of IIS, the Operating System queries the values in HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\InetStp\ instead of HKLM\Software\Microsoft\InetStp\ . The features are not recorded in the 32-bit section of the registry, only the 64-bit portion.The following workaround will allow you to install the connector:1. Confirm that you have actually installed the necessary components (.NET 4.0, IIS 7, Windows Authentication, IIS 6 Metabase)2. Create the following Registry Entries: HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\InetStp\WindowsAuthentication (DWORD, Value = 1)HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\InetStp\Metabase (DWORD, Value = 1) 3. Launch the installer again. You should no longer be prompted to install the Windows Authentication Role Service.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Application Test Credentials in Studio
description: In order to facilitate secure and efficient credential sharing between Symplified Customers and Engineering, it would be helpful if Studio has an input field for username/password for specific applications.This could solve multiple problems:1. The credentials could then easily passed to QA for monitoring customer applications, rather than requesting SD obtain them from the customer.2. A customer administrator can easily change a test credential if they so need to (think customer turnover)3. If discovery of an H-Fed application fails and requires an Engineering resource, a test credential is already entered into Studio, and Engineering should have the information they need to proceed on testing/building a custom adapter. Some further work might be required for exchanging to the Lohikans.4. The customer is not asked to send credentials over email, increasing the perception regarding security.

This release includes the following enhancements: Default Symplified Portal Customization and Enhancement: Admins will now be able to change the name and title of your default portal page, as well as error messages (ie. a phone number) that occur from incorrect user actions.HIgh Availability Enhancements: Identity Routers in HA now share session information to achieve seamless node failover. In order to enable this feature, TCP Port 9700 must be open to each node in the cluster. Please consult online documentation or contactCustomer Support for more information on the above enhancements.The release will be applied on Tuesday, April 10th, 2012 from 9PM MST - 3AM MST. Please contact us if you have any questions.  Thank You. subject: SYNC: User Store Service Account User Needs Elevated Persmissions
description: When using Sync, the user store service account user needs to have elevated permissions beyond what we tell our clients is currently required. I have not isolated which permissions are required. Steps to reproduce.* Setup Sync* Create two service user accounts, one as a normal user with read only privileges to the domain and one as an administrator* Attempt to sync a user with both of the users configured in the user store object* When using the read only service account user, LDAP error 50 is thrown in the symplified.logWe need to flesh out the privileges required for a sync service account user and why.

subject: Verify HTTP-Fed direct w/ 2 Oracle apps for Critigen
description: Critigen has provided us with VPN access to their internal Oracle applications. We need to test them to see if HTTP-Fed Direct will work, since there are parts of these applications with Java Applets that don't lend themselves to being proxied. We don't need to develop the HTTP-Fed Direct adapters just yet (unless the work is done in the process), but we need to know if it will work or not, so we can try and save this deal.VPN Connection:To download and install the AnyConnect VPN Client software:Click the following link:https://vpn.managedsp.com/NODOMAIN Login with your supplied VPN user credentials:Username: SYMUserPassword: SYMVPN@c33s Upon successful authentication, the VPN client will automatically be installed on your local computer. Your connection to the Critigen VPN Service will automatically connect. NOTE: After the VPN connects, the website will provide a screenshot of where you can find the AnyConnect VPN icon on your computer. To disconnect, right-click the icon and choose “Disconnect”.   To connect after the Initial Download:You can find the VPN Software by going to Start Menu>Programs>Cisco>Cisco AnyConnect VPN Client. In the Connect To list, choose the Critigen Server you wish to connect to (i.e. Critigen-Denver(NODOMAIN)). When you see the Username and Password prompt, enter your supplied VPN user credentials, then click the Connect button. The VPN will then connect and minimize to the system tray at the bottom right-hand corner of your screen. Application Details:The applications are P6 EPPM R8.1 sp1 and Primavera Contract Management 14. They are running on WebLogic 11g.Large Environment:P6 URL: http://mnusinvctgp6wt1.managed.local:7003/p6/action/loginP6 Progress Reporter URL: http://mnusinvctgp6wt1.managed.local:7003/pr/applet?lang=en P6 URL: http://mnusinvctgp6wt2.managed.local:7003/p6/action/loginP6 Progress Reporter URL: http://mnusinvctgp6wt2.managed.local:7003/pr/applet?lang=en Contract Management URL: http://mnusinvctgcmat1.managed.local:7003/exponline/logon.jsp Small Environment:P6 URL: http://mnusinvctgwp6t1.managed.local:7003/p6P6 Progress Reporter URL: http://mnusinvctgwp6t1.managed.local:7003/pr/applet?lang=enContract Management URL: http://mnusinvctgwcmt1.managed.local:7005/exponline/logon.jsp The username and password for your testing is: SymUser@CloudTest.com Welcome39This will be the same account for both the large and small Test environments. You should have access to both.Note: Username – when accessing the Primavera suite – the username should just be symuser (it is not case sensitive). The @cloudtest.com is only for logging into the portal which is not set up for your testing yet.

subject: Keychain Password Not Updated Correctly
description: When prompted to change a password on a failed keychain credentials, the password is not updated correctly.For example:User: testPassword: test55if the login fails, then the user is prompted again for the correct Username/Password.However, if they do not re-enter the entire password (example, they left off a few characters and attempt to re-enter them), the password is changed to "******NEWCHAR".i.g.**** POST SESSION ******Array( [Password] => test55 [Username] => test)<failed password, asked to re-try>**** POST SESSION ******Array( [Password] => ******1234 [Username] => test)and attempted password is now '******1234' instead of 'test551234'

subject: VIP validation fails on correct OTP

The IDR logs the following error:2012-04-19/17:39:46.156/PDT [ajp-bio-8009-exec-10] WARN com.symplified.service.appliance.strongauthservice.StrongAuthenticationServiceImpl[85] - strongauth-invalid-security-code*however* it is actually correct. Here are the steps to reproduce:1) Have an application in the ribbon bound to VIP.2) User logs in and clicks on a vip protected app and is prompted to enter OTP.3) The user enters the *correct* OTP but validation fails error message is displayed and user is then returned to the ribbon after clicking okay.3) User clicks again on the same vip protected app icon user is Logged into the app!!If the user enters the *incorrect* OTP than the user is prompted to enter an OTP again until it is correct.There seems to be an issue on the validation.

This .CSR would have been sent to RapidSSL to generate the .CER file. So it looks like we have the .CER file back from RapidSSL, but we’re perhaps missing the private key?I sent the .CER file to ADP and they accepted it, but can I upload this .PFX file as a private key into our ADP SAML adapter? subject: IDR Servlets should not allow browsers to cache them
description: Terry Finley at Zurich was testing his SAML-enabled application and inactivity timeouts. He found that his browser was caching certain of the IDR pages, which meant that instead of winding up back at the login screen after his application inactivity timeout redirected the user back to the IdPServlet URL, his browser instead re-POSTed the old assertion to the ACS URL. He found that if he changed his browser settings to not cache anything, the behavior was as expected, and the user wound up back at the IDR login screen after the timeout.Terry proposed that we add <META HTTP-EQUIV="PRAGMA" CONTENT="NO-CACHE"> in the head section of the IdPServlet to fix this problem. I suspect that we may also want to add it to the LoginServlet.Ravinder has been forwarded the email thread with screenshots and additional details (Subject: Fw: Cookie/Session Timeout)
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: SFDC Sync target should use 'mail' attribute for username, not userPrincipalName
description: In most cases, we configure SFDC SAML to use the employee's mail attribute as the NameID in the assertion. It seems only logical, then, that the Username we send over to SFDC via Sync would use this same attribute, but by default it's using the userPrincipalName, instead. We should set this to whatever the NameID is. If that's not possible, we should change the default to use 'mail' instead of the UPN.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Globoforce test issue
description: Hello,In our test system we have an application called globoforce that certain testers are seeing the same error.The first time they access the system we get a certificate warning, that is fine. But after selecting continue the testers will get an webpage cannot be found then refresh and get an internal server error. We spoke with Globoforce this morning and what they are seeing and will be providing us some logs is the XML packet is broken that they are recieving but then after the first failure the testers try again and get in successfully. We are able to reproduce this. My account gets in everytime successfully. We are not sure if there is an IE setting we are missing because the same testers get in, besides the cert warning, everytime with other browsers. We did some testing this morning 5/3/2012 about 8 - 8:30 AM EST not sure if you can see the SAML post in your logs and notice why some packets do not contain all the login info and some do?Thanks,Scott

subject: custom portal domain name
description: I have setup a custom portal (using php login, portal & error pages) on a hosted web-server for one of the Symantec O3 integration instances (through edit-profile -> portal -> custom-portal).It appears that rather than using the configured URLs (with FQDN, e.g. https://my.domain.net/login.php), the GW ends up accessing the portal site based on IP address. First problem is that the SSL certificate doesn't correspond to the IP address and secondly the web-hosting service declines access based on IP address (since it's a shared hosting environment).
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: SSL Certificate Validation
description: While the UI seems to validate the integrity of the individual files, it does not validate that the actual private key and certificate files are actually properly paired. This could be validated by computing the modulus of the private key and certificate before it is uploaded into the IDR. We have had members from SD and customers cause problems by uploading invalid certificates.

subject: Problem with Date Header Format using .NET to Access WebService API
description: The IDR is throwing a 500 error when I try to submit a webservice request. The exception is shown below. The problem is that the format of the Date Header is controlled by .NET and can't be changed. To be clear, this is the Date value in the HTTP header, not in the authorization header. I'm able to modify the requestDate in thesignature to match the format required by the webservice.The date header produced by .NET is standard according to several RFCs(822,1123.2616), although I'm not sure how closely these standards areadhered to. The format produced by .NET is:"Tue, 08 May 2012 20:33:54 GMT"The format required by the webservice is:"Tue, 08-May-12 14:15:54 -0500";Here's some info on the restrictions imposed by .NET on setting headershttp://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.webclient.headers.aspxSo, we can change the DATE to another value, we just can't change the format of the date when it is passed in the request.The best solution would be for the webservice to be able to parse either date format.Tony: [ajp-bio-8009-exec-9] ERROR com.symplified.application.appliance.api.authentication.RestAuthenticationInInterceptor[167] - Unable to parse date "Tue, 08 May 2012 20:33:54 GMT"com.symplified.platform.webservice.WebServiceApiException: code=INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR,detail=Unable to parse date "Tue, 08 May 2012 20:33:54 GMT"at name: Amylin

subject: Input validation insufficient on portal background URLs
description: When specifying a background URL to be behind the ribbon (default portal), we need to do some input validation. Currently, if you specify something other than a local file on the IDR (like content/home.html) you HAVE to enter a full URL, including the http:// or https:// portion. If you leave off the http:// or https:// portion, then you'll get a 404 error in the background of the ribbon (see attached screenshot)The easiest way to resolve this would be to do something like have a radio button for each line -- either 'use default' (the home/whatever.html) or 'specify URL' with a box where we could do real URL validation before allowing the admin to save the configuration.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: SAML IDP Request - Make IsPassive flag configurable
description: Problem: When connecting to certain IdP's via an automatic redirect to the IdP using the authN sources in SinglePoint Studio, the IdP will raise an error due to the IsPassive=”false” attribute in our SAML assertions.Solution: Allow for the IsPassive tag to be configurable in the IdP UI so the end user can set it to True or False depending on the IdP requirements. This will allow us to integrate via automatic redirect to all IdP's. I have used HTTP-Fox's Tamper Data extension to confirm that by changing this attribute to IsPassive=”false” results in the correct authentication. According to Andrew Silliker, the solution proposed would make the way we handle this compliant with the SAML spec.<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><saml2p:AuthnRequest xmlns:saml2p="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:protocol" AssertionConsumerServiceURL="https://smithandwesson.com/SPServlet?sp_id=IDRtest" ForceAuthn="false" ID="dhmkhdllanmjffhddlngfgadfacpnndhnnghepga" IsPassive="false" IssueInstant="2012-05-10T13:40:15.006Z" ProtocolBinding="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-POST" ProviderName="SYMPLIFIED" Version="2.0"><saml2:Issuer xmlns:saml2="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:assertion">Colt45</saml2:Issuer></saml2p:AuthnRequest>

subject: Store Site upgrade
description: SupportWe are updating our Store site and the update is now PCI compliant. This means that they no longer encrypt or decrypt passwords . What the software does with the password in the Store is run a hash algorithm on it and store it has a hash value. The problem is that the hash password synchs back into the data store the Store http Federate connections uses for Authentication and will not be able to update the keychain through the Symplified cli accordingly. Even if it does update the keychain it will be with the hash value and the user would not know this value. Any thoughts on how companies work around this issue?  I am also working with the company who supports the Store Website but wanted some potential thoughts from Symplified on how to work around this issue.Roger    Roger OlivierNetwork ManagerZELTIQ(925) 474-2565 Office(650) 207-4151 Cell (925) 474-8565 Fax http://www.zeltiq.com/ahead of the curve Please be COOL and consider the environment before printing this email.
name: Zeltiq

subject: Update the Adapter Release (Adapter Healing)
description: This enhancement entails updating the adapter release process so that the current adapter that is being updated does not have to be deleted from the customer object. The current customer keychains are tied to the adapter and by deleting and recreating the adapter per the adapter release process, all of the customers keychains are invalidated.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Bakers Delight - WTIS application
description: I have been working with Bakers Delight on this application for some time now. The issue is with a sub application.After authenticating scroll down to WTIS (Weekly Takings Integration System). Looking through the application it appears there is some javascript somewhere that is using the real url instead of the proxied url. Is there a way we can rewrite the url to be proxied?The Extranet application discovers with the Trust Connector. But I had to add a rewrite - Substitute "s|XsnLocation=http://app03.singlepoint01.com|XsnLocation=http://extranet.bakersdelight.com.au|i" to change the XsnLocation back to the original value to get the application to work at all. Also this application only works from IE. Firefox and Safari don't render or work correctly.url - https://extranet.bakersdelight.com.auUser: victoriagardens@bakersdelight.netPassword: applelog$74Thanks Cullen

The image was resized a couple of times to no avail and were not able to upload any size image that did not obscure the Symantec logo and it did not look good. The effort was abandoned.•Is this the expected behavior/result (both images persist & conflict with each other) when using the feature to upload a custom image?•Is it possible to replace the incumbent Symantec logo with a custom logo entirely?•Is it possible to remove the Symantec logo all together?

subject: FW: SSO Activation
description: David,This is a follow up to my email yesterday re: Live Office.Live Office has done their steps to enable SSO for our production instance. See below for their updated URLs. I tried to set up a new generic SAML adapter configured in the same fashion as the working Live Office Dev connector. Something isn’t quite right with it. Maybe I made a mistake. Attempts to authenticate don’t work. Can you take a look and see if I did anything obviously wrong?Regards,CameronFrom: Clifton Blanchard [mailto:clifton.blanchard@liveoffice.com] Sent: Thursday, May 17, 2012 11:48 AMTo: McWethy, CameronCc: Michael ColuciSubject: RE: SSO ActivationI just received word, that all the configuration pieces on our end have been completed.We can validate anytime you would like, either today or tomorrow.Just let me know what time works for you.CliffFrom: McWethy, Cameron [mailto:Cameron.McWethy@amylin.com]Sent: Thursday, May 17, 2012 9:52 AMTo: Clifton BlanchardCc: Michael ColuciSubject: RE: SSO ActivationGreat news! Let's pull the trigger tomorrow then. If I understand your integration options it sounds like the con can be addressedonce we migrate to Office 365? That should be fine.From: Clifton Blanchard [clifton.blanchard@liveoffice.com]Sent: Thursday, May 17, 2012 9:49 AMTo: McWethy, CameronCc: Michael ColuciSubject: SSO ActivationHey Cameron,It was great speaking with you yesterday.At the moment, it looks like we should be able to activate SSO on Friday, if that still works for you.Here are the new URLs that you would be using for Simplified and Cloud Archive User Access.Simplified Trusted Identityhttps://webfolder.liveoffice.comSimplified ACS URL:https://auth.lax.archivecloud.netSymantec User Access SSO URL:https://webfolder.liveoffice.com?CID=90c59c14-5da8-4a03-b63a-eed4c35d8db4I did verify that users will still be able to login to https//webfolder.liveoffice.com URL, using their Cloud Archive user name and password. At the moment, there is nothing on the roadmap to have this behaviour changed.Now here are the Pros and Cons:Pros1. We can verify the new SSO configuration changes in your production environment, prior to rolling it out to users.2. There will be no interruption in user access for those users using the non-SSO URL.3. You can selectively role out the new SSO URL to your users.Cons1. User Management – You will need to continue to manually manage your user’s identities in the cloud, unless you adopt the use of our on-premise CloudLink tool.I’ll keep you updated on our progress. description: High priority due to impending certificate expiration.Per our account rep at Box:We hope you are having a good week. Below is important information to update Box's new certificate for your SSO Integration. The Box signing and encryption certificate used for SSO will be expiring on May 23rd. In order to keep SSO working as normal for your users, you will need to replace the expiring Box certificate in your Identity Provider (IdP). New certificateThe new certificate can be downloaded here: https://www.box.com/s/e1d6d032d2c48d0017bf. If you have any problems updating the Box certificate, please let me know and I will loop you in with our technical lead to advise.3rd party providers: Okta, Symplified, Ping Identity, etcFor customers using a third party provider such as Okta or OneLogin, they'll need to ask their provider to update the certificate for them. AuthN requestsIf your Identity Provider requires signed AuthN requests, signed SAML assertions or encrypted SAML assertions, please contact Box support at business-support@box.com and the team can help update your IdP connection

subject: WebEx SAML connector configuration crashes the IdP Servlet
description: The following email is from our SE, Alin Mutu, that contains details. Also see attached screen shots. His Cell # is 650/793-4909. His email is alin_mutu@symantec.com. WE would need to get this straightened out before he goes back to the customer tomorrow late morning.-----Hi guys, I ran into an issue with the TrustFabric WebEx connector today. Configured in “SP initiated” mode, it crashes the O3 IdP servlet. I am doing this for KLA-Tencor as part of their evaluation. I was able to make it work with the generic SAML connector, so I can move this opportunity forward. However, someone should look into this and get back to me with either a defect confirmation or a different configuration that works, before I hand this over to the customer tomorrow afternoon. I attached both the broken configuration as well as the working one based on the generic SAML connector to compare and contrast, as well as the end-user error and the gateway log extract. Note that the only change on the SP side is the Idp ID and URL, everything else is identical including the test users. I am available tonight and tomorrow morning if you’d like to see this reproduced. The customer’s O3 environment (ea50) has both IdPs/connectors configured, but the SP is configured to use the working generic SAML connector right now. I’ll be changing the configuration later to look for the mail attribute in AD instead of department as I define some KLA specific test users, but that will not impact this behaviour. I wanted to route this through you so you can get a better handle on a scalable escalation process moving forward, this is going to be painful if we keep using e-mail and individuals as points of contacts. I can use the connectors DL, but I don’t know if that is the right path either as it could just raise unnecessary red flags. Thanks for looking into this, --Alin

subject: SAML redirect failure
description: In setting up another SAML direct connector for SFDC (for secondary and tertiary portals within the same org-id; this is the Symantec PartnerNet/Customer portal use-case that Brian Gaffney did in POC), the redirect-URL/target-resource gets mangled:Target Resource: https://cs4.salesforce.com/home/home.jspUpon successful authn&authz, the browser redirect goes to: https://cs4.salesforce.comhttps%3a%2f%2fcs4.salesforce.com%2fhome%2fhome.jsp/The SAML assertion is accepted and the SFDC authn succeeds, but I get a browser error since the URL is invalid. If I type in the actual target-resource in the browser, then I can get to the correct SFDC page.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Invalid certificate & signature in SFDC SAML assertion
description: In comparing the SFDC-trust-connector based SAML assertion with the Generic-SAML-direct connector, I used the SalesForce SAML validator to check the contents of the assertion.Even though the SFDC connector based assertion is accepted (authentication succeeds and the user is redirected to the correct SFDC page), the SAML validator still shows errors for both the digital signature and the certificate in the assertion. Based on those two errors one would have expected the SFDC authn to fail.See attached SAML assertion and SFDC validator
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: WebEx "Start your meeting" links not properly redirected through SSO
description: When using the WebEx Meeting Center Productivity Tools to schedule WebEx meetings via Outlook, meeting events are created on a calendar with links to start a meeting in a format like: https://amylin.webex.com/amylin/j.php?J=926676167If a user isn't pre-authenticated to WebEx, these links do not properly redirect a user and their meetings are not automatically started. When you click a meeting link to host a meeting the meeting ID seems to be lost somewhere in the redirection for SSO. Clicking the link lands you authenticated on the WebEx portal page, but it doesn’t start the meeting. It seems like the meeting ID (which should be part of the RelayState?) is lost in transit to the IdP, or it is lost on the way back. The end result is that users have a confusing experience trying to start a meeting.
name: Amylin

subject: WebEx authentication attempts result in a redirection loop when off the corporate network
description: From certain off-net systems (non-Amylin systems mainly?) attempts to authenticate result in a redirection loop where the browser bounces from IdP to WebEx to IdP to WebEx indefinitely. The iOS thick WebEx client has also always thrown a “Too many HTTP redirects” error when we try to authenticate, and I’ve come to realize that is likely caused by the same problem.
name: Amylin

subject: Memory Leaks crash JVM
description: We have seen several issues where memory leaks cause an eventual crash of the JVM heap. The only workaround to this is restarting the IDR when (or before) this occurs.This ticket is not related to any specific bug, but is a request for further QA. Currently we have to restart high volume IDRs (PBCS) at least weekly to prevent service interruptions.
name: Symplified, Inc.
