For example, you can log in as follows:1a) Navigate to custom portal login page:  http://login.stingraytst.qualcomm.com/stingray (use qes / qes0nly to get to login page)2a) Log in with a Netsuite account that was set up as a new customer: Test Username: stingrayuserh@unity.comTest Password: Qualcomm123a) Land, logged in, in Netsuite shopping cart (http://stingraytst-shopping.qualcomm.com/)However, if you log in with a Netsuite 'contact' (under a customer) as opposed to logging in as the customer login itself, it doesn't work:1b) Navigate to custom portal login page:  http://login.stingraytst.qualcomm.com/stingray (use qes / qes0nly to get to login page)2b) Log in with a Netsuite customer 'contact':Test Username: klose@qc.comTest Password: i5rHIHlg2c) Land at the custom portal defined Error page (in this case, they're using google.com as a placeholder, so you land at http://www.google.com/?singlepoint-auth-error=APPLICATION_AUTHENTICATION_ERROR&singlepoint-portal-event=auth-failed&singlepoint-error-message=An+unknown+IdP+error+has+occurred.++Please+try+again. )In the logs, I see two glaring errors for the klose@qc.com 'contact' login flow -- the first is an INFO warning about not being able to get attributes from the Netsuite user store, and the other is an ERROR com.symplified.adapter.authn.NetSuiteDirectAssertionHandler[118] - Uncaught exception occured in NetSuiteSSOAuthenticationHandler.authenticate()com.symplified.adapter.api.AuthenticationException: Unable to map remote userFYI, this user CAN get to the other SAML apps (if I start the workflow by navigating to one of their IdPServlet urls, get redirected to login page, log in, then I land at the SAML app).Is there anything special we need to do in the Netsuite Proprietary SSO connector configuration to be able to accommodate 'contacts'?

subject: SAML v1.0/v1.1 incompatiblity?
description: In trying to connect with Globoforce via SAML v1.1 (using the SAML v1.1 generic direct connector), we get a mismatch on the response "StatusCode". The Symplified (openSAML) puts out: <saml1p:Status> <saml1p:StatusCode Value="saml1p:Success" /> </saml1p:Status>whereas Globoforce expects something along the lines of as per SAML v1.1 spec (https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/download.php/3406/oasis-sstc-saml-core-1.1.pdf): <samlp:Status xmlns:saml="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:assertion"  xmlns:samlp="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:1.0:protocol"> <samlp:StatusCode Value="samlp:Success"/> </samlp:Status>The difference being the namespace being "samlp" vs. "saml1p".Since this is not configurable, we're stuck in this incompatibility.

subject: NameID transformation fails
description: When I use the SAML2direct-generic connector for GoogleApps, the nameID transformation fails in the SAML response. Instead of using emailID, I needed to use the AD sAMAccountname attribute in conjunction with a different domainname to create the unique federationID in GoogleApps (<sAMAccountname>@<alternatedomain>.Since the Google SAMLrequest cannot be processed correctly (see also 16057-4280), the resulting SAMLresponse (in essence turn it into an IdP-initiated session) does not incorporate the nameID transformation that was configured. Hence the authn would still fail.This is a secondary error/defect.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Saml2GenericDirectPost adapter pulls hostname from IDR name in database - error if not populated
description: Linda at Zurich was trying to create a new Saml2GenericDirectPost application in the Zurich Prod environment. When she tried to do this, she would get a "Unexpected Error (E27132523)" in studio.We tracked this down to a problem in the logic -- studio was trying to pull a hostname to use (presumably for the IdP URL), and was just looking in the database for an IDR hostname. Unfortunately, Zurich is an HA environment and had an IDR object for a DR IDR that had never called home, so (we presume) that field was not populated. When I deleted that IDR object from studio, I was then able to create a new SAML application.NOTE: In an HA environment, we should NOT be populating these SAML URLs with an individual IDR hostname, anyway -- it should be using the VIP name (Edit profile >> IDR clustering >> Load Balancer DNS Name).The corresponding stack trace that ops found in the logs [SymOps #1037] was this:WARN com.symplified.application.admin.PolicyOwnerServiceImpl[1100] - Thehandler Saml2GenericDirectPost specifies a default menu server which does nothave a coresponding default application server. This is due to the defaultmenu_server being popultaed but the app_servers not having the specifiedserver. subject: multi-value ambiguity
description: n one of the Symantec-IT O3 instances we are seeing a highlighted (yellow) attribute name (in the User-Store attribute list) for sAMAaccount, where the error message (when hovering with mouse) reads: "Multivalue ambiguity. check values for this property in policies." I do know that sAMAccount is used in multipel authz policies, and specifically in one of the SAML connectors (Google). There the policy is setup that if sAMAaccount contains a value that is "one of" a list, then the access is permitted. The "being one of" is setup through member-of-list policy UI as described in the policy documentation (see attached).This policy functionally works and the yellow highlight didn't show up until this past weekend.RK
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: multi User-store authz config. with VIP
description: In one of the Symantec IT instances we need to configure two different user-stores; one is AD and the other GDS (Global Directory Service, Novel LDAP). Authn occurs with just the AD (sAMAccount as the user-tag). We're trying to configure the GDS for other SAML attributes as well as (more importantly) the username/userid to be used for VIP strongAuth.We have tried to map user-store attribute by providing names, but upno authn O3 seems to timeout on the GDS service (15sec delay).How do we configure the 2nd datastore (GDS) and how do we configure the VIP user-store attribute such that when the VIP strongAuth is set in the application policy it'll pickup the authenticated user's corresponding attribute (symcLoginID) from GDS?In testing this against a plain SAML SP, it doesn't seem to succeed in querying the GDS service at all since no (or just empty) attributes are passed in the SAML assert.RKRK

subject: Two new H-Fed Adaptors
description: Hi,I have tried to configure two new H-FED adapters but have been running into difficulty when testing them. 1) Northgate2) LAM1) NorthgateWhen you launch the "normal URL" you are prompted for username, password and company. The company is ELAN all uppercase.I did the standard wizard build but I am having some trouble around what the Input values should be for the company field of the logon form in the Trust Connector. We are unable to get a test account from them, but we have had some people on our team test & they get logon errors. I attached some of these erorrs from the Syslog file. One thing to note is that after a successful manual logon and in each normal scenario, the user is brought to a screen and prompted to answer a security question.2) LAMThis looks like it could be a standard wizard build but again we are having difficulty logging in. They gave us a test account (username: 9876543J password: testpass1) however this has since expired but we are working on getting it renewed. It had worked in the past for me but when I delivered to the business to test, they were unsuccessful. We were unsure if it was due to the test account expiring, if the actual site was down or if the adapter was configured incorrectly.Could you take a look and advise if there is custom development required?We are being asked to demo these two adapters to our corporate office in Dublin, Ireland next weekMany thanks,Bernard.
name: Elan Pharmaceuticals, Inc.

subject: Netsuite Proprietary SSO adapter server error if no keychain & no SSO Passthrough enabled
description: I was setting up the Netsuite Proprietary SSO adapter in the Qualcomm Stingray Prod environment, and I had forgotten to enable SSO Passthrough for the customer object. With this configuration and nothing specified in the user's Netsuite keychain, I kept getting this error in my browser (nothing showed up in the IDR logs to shed any more light on it):HTTP Status 500 -type Exception reportmessagedescription The server encountered an internal error () that prevented it from fulfilling this request.exceptionjava.lang.NullPointerException java.util.regex.Matcher.getTextLength(Matcher.java:1233) java.util.regex.Matcher.reset(Matcher.java:308) java.util.regex.Matcher.<init>(Matcher.java:228) java.util.regex.Pattern.matcher(Pattern.java:1088) com.symplified.adapter.authn.NetSuiteDirectAssertionHandler.isEmail(NetSuiteDirectAssertionHandler.java:137) com.symplified.adapter.authn.NetSuiteDirectAssertionHandler.authenticate(NetSuiteDirectAssertionHandler.java:111) com.symplified.service.appliance.idp.IdPService.createAssertion(IdPService.java:208) com.symplified.service.appliance.idp.IdPServlet.doPost(IdPServlet.java:66) com.symplified.service.appliance.idp.IdPServlet.doGet(IdPServlet.java:58) javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:621) javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:722) com.symplified.application.appliance.IdPFilter.doFilter(IdPFilter.java:147) com.symplified.application.appliance.DisableSessionUrlFilter.doFilter(DisableSessionUrlFilter.java:66) org.springframework.web.filter.CharacterEncodingFilter.doFilterInternal(CharacterEncodingFilter.java:88) org.springframework.web.filter.OncePerRequestFilter.doFilter(OncePerRequestFilter.java:76) com.symplified.application.appliance.InjectionScrubFilter.doFilter(InjectionScrubFilter.java:39)note The full stack trace of the root cause is available in the Apache Tomcat/7.0.23 logs.Apache Tomcat/7.0.23The adapter should capture this and instead prompt the user to populate their keychain (if SSO passthrough is not enabled).Once I either populated the keychain or enabled SSO passthrough, I didn't run into this.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: RE: Symplified 2012 Summer Release
description: Including Symplified Support.Thank you very much.Ben From: Cheung, BenSent: Friday, July 13, 2012 10:05 AMTo: amcgill@symplified.comCc: Rabinovich, Zhenya; Lin, Mark; Tumoju, Rajesh; Bemby, Rakesh; Lu, ZhengSubject: RE: Symplified 2012 Summer Release Avery,Hope all is well.We received this last night. Test Environment: Will be upgraded on Tuesday, July 31st, from 9 PM - 3 AM MST. Thank you very much..................................................Ben CheungAVP / Moody’s Information Technology212.553.1974 tel347.276.2554 mobile212.298.6664 faxben.cheung@moodys.comMoody’s Corporation7 World Trade Center250 Greenwich StreetNew York, NY 10007www.moodys.com................................................. From: Symplified Support [mailto:support@symplified.com]Sent: Thursday, July 12, 2012 7:44 PMTo: Cheung, BenSubject: Symplified 2012 Summer Release [https://c.na3.content.force.com/servlet/servlet.ImageServer?id=01550000000TdCn&oid=00D500000007EiF]Dear Ben Cheung, We are excited to announce the Summer 2012 release of the Symplified solution to our customers. We strive to continually update and enhance our product in response to both user requests as well as developments in the IAM space, and the Summer 2012 release is reflective of this work. This product release contains a number of improvements and new features, and we’d like to point out some of the most notable of these below:Step-Up Re-Authentication: Administrators can now set group and application-based policies that require users to re-authenticate themselves in order to access a particular application even if they’ve already provided credentials or an OTP.CryptoCard: Added support for CryptoCard’s strong-authentication OTP service via a new solution adapter. Custom Portal: Administrators with custom portals can now discern between logouts based on active user logout requests and passive time-out session closes. Cipher Rotation: Customer administrators for studio can now perform and schedule cipher rotation for their customers based upon their security policies.IDR Clustering: Added capability that allows users to set up High Availability (HA) architectures and fail-over to a disaster recovery site.This now allows for HA deployments in the Amazon environmentThere is no longer an HA requirement for a NFS/CIFS serverThe new HA architecture increases access/write speeds when creating user profiles.Session replication within the cluster is enabledPlease consult online documentation or contactCustomer Support for more information on the above enhancements. For Enterprise Upgrade customers, the release schedule is as follows:Development Environment: Will be upgraded on Tuesday, July 24th, from 9 PM - 3 AM MST. Test Environment: Will be upgraded on Tuesday, July 31st, from 9 PM - 3 AM MST.Production Environment: Will be upgraded on Saturday, August 4th from 8 AM - 12 PM MST. During these windows, SinglePoint Studio and Identity Routers will experience short periods of unavailability. Please do not attempt to make any modifications during these published times. Please contact us if you have any questions.  Thank You.  The Symplified Team303.318.4188 x2http://support.symplified.com[http://na3.salesforce.com/servlet/servlet.ImageServer?oid=00D500000007EiF&esid=0185000000Jvh6C]-----------------------------------------The information contained in this e-mail message, and any attachment thereto, is confidential and may not be disclosed without our express permission. subject: IDR SPServlet does not respect RelayState
description: When a 9.3 IDR receives a SAML message with a RelayState POST parameter, the POST parameter is not followed. Instead the IDR redirects the user to the next-redirect url associated with the session cookie.Allegedly in 9.2 the SPServlet would process the RelayState parameter and redirect the user accordingly. I do not have a 9.2 environment available to test with however.The workflows that this affects are as follows:1. SP Initiated (ex. IWA Connector) - If a user somehow loses their session cookie during the redirect to the SAML IDP they will be returned to the portal page instead of the link originally requested.2. IDP Initiated (ex. One IDR configured to POST SAML to another IDR with a Target Resource) - If a SAML IDP spontaneously posts a SAML assertion to an IDR it will always redirect the user to the portal page and will not respect the RelayState specified (via the Target Resource in this example)
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Zurich broken portal: singlepoint cookie no longer passed to applications via header?
description: It looks like in 9.3, we no longer pass the singlepoint cookie in the Cookie header that we send to protected No-AuthN applications (such as the custom portal). Zurich has many applications that have been looking for this header, including their custom portal. Zurich has a testpage.aspx page that displays all the headers passed to it. In 9.2, it looked like this: Cookie = SPBALANCEID=balancer.10.148.72.99; ASP.NET_SessionId=fm0l1y2nft5eujwrpqzxhxuy; singlepoint=74ef91ac-120b-4fd1-8029-7081348ee1bcin 9.3:  Cookie = SPBALANCEID=balancer.10.148.72.99; ASP.NET_SessionId=i3t4tvbz24qruygtexpa3sfj;Zurich has been using this cookie-check to help ensure that end-users aren't circumventing the IDR and going directly to the back-end webservers (an option that Linda said Max offered as an alternative to network/firewall restrictions to the backend webserver, way back in the early design days).What can we do to make the IDR send the singlepoint cookie in the header, again? Could we use custom headers in some way, or will this require a patch?Note that although this is a "test" environment, Zurich is in the final stages of their UAT and planning to go live with their applications in Production on 8/3, so this needs to be treated as a high priority issue.FYI - In the Zurich Dev environment, we worked around the 400 server errors I mentioned in my email last night by upping the limit on their IIS server. In the Zurich Test (QA) environment, even that IIS config change wasn't enough to accommodate their ~100 application URLs. There, we wound up unchecking "pass headers" since their custom portal isn't consuming the x-singlepoint-applications header for any dynamic app list displaying.
name: Symplified, Inc.

description: Hello,I saw this message a bit late. I have started my IDR. Please continue testing after 10mins from receipt of this email. RgdsSunita From: Symplified Support [mailto:support@symplified.com]Sent: Saturday, July 28, 2012 12:49 AMTo: Sunita Bhat (WT01 - BAS)Subject: Symplified Singlepoint Studio Failover Testing [https://c.na3.content.force.com/servlet/servlet.ImageServer?id=01550000000TdCn&oid=00D500000007EiF]Dear Sunita Bhat, At Symplified, customer success is a top priority. As such, we routinely test our environments to ensure your expectations of uptime and performance are met. As part of this effort, we will be conducting Disaster Recovery testing during our planned maintenance window this Saturday July 28, 2012 from 8AM - 12PM MT:What is planned?The Symplified Operations team will be conducting failover testing of Singlepoint Studio in accordance with our ongoing SOC 2 Audit.What to expect?Your IDRs functionality will not be affected during the maintenance window and customer requests will be served as usualDuring the testing period IDRs may appear to have lost contact with Singlepoint Studio and show up outlined in red on the IDR listWhat do you need to know:Please avoid making any configuration changes during this maintenance window to avoid conflictsIf you require any additional information, please contact Customer Support directly.Thank You. The Symplified Team303.318.4188 x2http://support.symplified.com[http://na3.salesforce.com/servlet/servlet.ImageServer?oid=00D500000007EiF&esid=0185000000JwXwB] Please do not print this email unless it is absolutely necessary. subject: SP initiated SAML adapter
description: Hi there,I configured an SP initiated SAML adapter for Thomson Reuter's GRC (GRC QA in our studio) and SSO is working fine. However, I posed a question to them about the URLs that are contained in their notification emails that get sent out to our business users.Within these emails there are URLs like: https://client1192.paisleyhosting.com/RNJ/jsp/login.jsp?LinkTo=%2FRNJ%2Faction%2FControl%3FID%3D30294But I had said to thier team that the URLs would have to change as now users will be accessing their tool using the new URL of https://portal.elan.com/IdPServlet?idp_id=1egzdgtsrwyy3I may have misconfigured the adapter as the IdP URL should be the URL to which the SP should POST a SAML request. But I'm unsure what this should be if different from what it is now.I've attached their metadata file which contains some of their location URLs. We are due to launch this adapter August 8th and up until now, I had thought it was working correctly, but their response on the email URLs has thrown me somewhat. An easy workaround perhaps would be to ask them to remove the URLs that are in the email completely, but I do know that some of our more executive employees use them for launching directlry into their task, rather than launching the main URL and finding their task through their daskboard/menu optionsCan you help?Thanks,Bernard.
name: Elan Pharmaceuticals, Inc.

subject: SIM: Email template breaks OTP link
description: When creating an email template in 9.3, User Management changes the one time password Free Marker code and breaks the ability to provide a one time password as a parameter on a password reset link. This can be temporarily fixed by looking at the source code, and changing the link to the correct code. However, after you save and view the link again, it show the broken code, even though the correct link is in place. In addition, when you re-save the template, it re-breaks the link. This is affecting current customers.

description: When attempting to use the mass importer for importing users, it is extremely difficult to use and is essentially broken. The template that is downloaded from User Management provides incorrect sample values and an a comma delimited format that is invalid when uploading a file to User Management. In addition the confirmation message when uploading a file is always a success even when it fails. An administrator has to find the correct log (which is hard to find and inconsistent with the other UM logs) in order to see the error. In addition, the log screen is very hard to read as an administrator cannot expand columns so the entire error message

subject: SimpleLink race condition
description: Tracking in Parature for visibility. Email from Colin 8/4/2012:The issue DWR was having I believe stems from the slower processing up at EC2. When "service simplelink stop" is issued as part of a publish with a SimpleLink configuration, the actual openvpn process and kernel need to cleanup tun1 and this seems to take a non-trivial amount of time on an AMI. Since the service stop call returns quickly even though the kernel may not have disseminated the interface yet, we get into a race-condition of sorts when we do our system calls to "/sbin/ifconfig -a" to find ip information. This can be replicated by running:$ while true; do /sbin/ifconfig -a >/dev/null; RESULT="$?"; if [ "$RESULT" != "0" ]; then echo "bad: $RESULT"; break; fi; donein one window on an SimpleLink-enabled IDR and in another executing "service simplelink restart". On my KVM IDR I can get this to show up occasionally with repeated restarts, but I would wager on an AMI it shows up basically every time.This race behaviour was observed at a different point in the SimpleLink service during publish time, noted in Mantis 4671.The temporary fix for DWR was to make the "service simplelink stop" command take longer, so that the kernel could completely remove tun1 before we try to interact with ifconfig. This fix will persist until an update is made to the singlepoint-appliance package on the IDR.I have filed a new bug with this information (Mantis 5208).
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Users cannot authenticate to Concur
description: Users cannot currently authenticate to Concur. Rajat called the support line to log a ticket.Rajat - This issue appears to stem from the fact that the CIFS share that the IdR's store the Concur credentials on (keychain credentials) is currently not available. As a result of the IdR's not being able to mount this share, end users cannot authenticate to Concur until the share is made available again. It appears that the server hosting the share is running, however the share is not available. This can be caused by any of the following. * The share mount point has changed* The credentials used to access the share have changed or expired* The service allowing the share to be mounted, is not running ( or is not functioning correctly)* A number of other OS / service related issues. CIFS Share IP: 10.13.16.39Mount Point: /SSOPlease call me directly if you have any questions. 720 340 2058

subject: Users cannot click "Attach Receipt" with Concur Trust Fabric
description: In IE9 (possibly other browsers) users receive a plugin error for Adobe Acrobat Reader.This can be replicated by logging into concur (through our trust fabric adapter), adding and new expense report, then clicking the receipts button. You should receive an error that Adobe Acrobat Reader is not installed. This works correctly in direct access (the actual plugin is installed directly) but seems to fail some sort of plugin check against the IDR.This issue is affecting at least one customer (Rewards Network)
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: ADP Portal is not working using Trust Fabric Connector
description: Brian Paetow from Rewards Network called with an error in IE when trying to go to the ADP Portal through their IDR. When trying in IE they get an error popup that says "This page is accessing information that is not under its control. This poses a security risk. Do you want to continue?" and regardless of if he selects Yes or No it keeps popping up and the page doesn't load.In Firefox the it does render a page but most of it is blank. See attached "Firefox_Bad.png"See attached "Firefox_Good.png" for what the site looks like when going directly to it. As you can see the skinning and colors are entirely different. I got to this site by using the URL in the customers application config so it doesn't look like a URL change and I didn't see any server calls made to any site but portal.adp.com so I don't think it's a new server issue.I was able to replicate the issue, both Firefox screencaps are from me.I have his username and password if you don't have testing creds already.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Moody's QA issue
description: We are trying to identify the reason our QA environment has stopped working for Salesforce.com since the upgrade. We have identified a possible issue with the “NameID” being sent. In production (SFPRD.XML) the ID is sent correctly as the e-mail address whereas in QA it is sent as the username. Both Symplified devices are set to use the e-mail as the ID (see screenshots). subject: Mobile Portal Custom Theme not working in 9.3
description: Any default portal custom theme defined in 9.3 works in the browser portal but the default symplified theme shows up in the mobile portal.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: SIM: Boolean value not set correctly.
description: When creating a new boolean value in UM, the value is not set for users despite the fact the the box is not checked (indicating false). An administrator has to manually touch each record before the value is set to true or false. When viewing the attribute in the UI, the UI shows an unchecked box, which indicates false. However, when using the API to return the actual attribute value, it comes through as a blank, not a true or false value as indicated by the CSV that was used to import the end user. This results in incorrect access control policies and other issues.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: SIM: Cannot import user and all attributes correctly
description: This bug entails importing users from CSV file. When importing users into UM from CSV, if a value is boolean, the download doesn't display a proper / valid value. In addition, the import process does not properly set the boolean value. This ticket is related to 4591.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Box.com SSO in iPad app

description: For detail description please see the attached doc file.The apps is showing different behavior to handle a "linked" of an existing plain text file (non-encrypted file) that was initially uploaded from outside proxy (a.k.a those user's document that exist in their dropbox account prior to using Ozone). Note for clarification: I provided scenario #1 just to show how the apps' behave against the encrypted files. In contrast, in scenario #2 is to show how the apps' behave against the non-encrypted files.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: FW: ESX upgrade
description: Hi Avery & Symplified support. Is this ESX upgrade procedure supported by the IDRs? Thanks and regards, Joris van Antwerpen| Identity & Access Management Design Manager| DSM ICT | M +31622802471 |joris.antwerpen-van@dsm.com From: van Kessel, Ard [mailto:Ard.vanKessel@atos.net]Sent: Wednesday, August 15, 2012 9:24 AMTo: Antwerpen-van, JorisCc: van der Leeuw, GerritSubject: RE: ESX upgrade Joris, What still needs to be done is an upgrade of the virtual machine hardware version:http://pubs.vmware.com/vsphere-50/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.vmware.vsphere.upgrade.doc_50%2FGUID-9C60B56F-25A4-437F-B7E4-EE76CF62432D.html We want to make sure that this is supported by Symplified and we want to arrange a slot to implement this. We want someone from your side to test after the upgrade if everything is working as expected. Regards,Ard van Kessel  From: Antwerpen-van, Joris[mailto:Joris.Antwerpen-van@dsm.com]Sent: donderdag 9 augustus 2012 14:57To: van Kessel, ArdSubject: FW: ESX upgrade Hi Ard, Can you verify with your VMware specialist if this statement from Symplified is correct? Regards,Joris From: Avery McGill [amcgill@symplified.com]Sent: Wednesday, August 08, 2012 18:20To: Antwerpen-van, JorisSubject: Re: ESX upgradeJoris,  I believe the IdR's are upgraded during the ESX upgrade / migration process.  http://pubs.vmware.com/vsphere-50/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.vmware.vsphere.upgrade.doc_50%2FGUID-9C60B56F-25A4-437F-B7E4-EE76CF62432D.html Thanks,AveryOn Wed, Aug 8, 2012 at 1:43 AM, Antwerpen-van, Joris <Joris.Antwerpen-van@dsm.com> wrote:Hi Avery, One question about the already performed ESX upgrade from 3.5 to 5.x: Can/must/can’t the IDR be upgraded to ESX 5.x platform, or must the image be re-deployed? subject: Dropbox connector in 9.3 has wrong rewrite rules
description: The Dropbox connector in 9.3 has a different set of rewrite rules from 9.2. The consequence of this is that the Flash upload option is being displayed rather than redirecting to the basic uploader.In order to fix this in our environment we needed to remove these:Substitute "s|enhanced uploader.||qni"to the Rewrite rules for the *webserver* www.dropbox.com and *not* the application.Screenshots showing the difference attached.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: E-Biz connector in Trust Fabric does not seem to work
description: E-Biz connector in the Trust Fabric does not seem to be working - tested in both 9.2 and 9.3.To reproduce: user “testoim” and password of “Welcome2” using the following login: https://preprodiexp.autotrader.com/OA_HTML/RF.jsp?function_id=28716Tailing the logs on the IDR you'll see a couple of things getting written to the “catch-all 443” log and so I tried it with and without Cert verification but saw no difference. My suspicion is that it has to do with the fact the request is coming on 443 and then doing a redirect. If you look at the default configuration of the connector before we update it your default is http. I tried for example going to: http://careers.resmed.com/OA_HTML/RF.jsp?function_id=28716 (which is what you have as the default) but that does not seem to exist over either port 80 or 443.This has high visibility with a major customer presentation on Friday aganist Okta whose connector is working just fine.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Need HTTP-Fed Direct connector for Oracle eBusiness
description: This is for a competitive situation with Symantec. Competitor is Okta and has already shown their demo. Customer is AutoTrader. We urgentlly need an HTTP-Fed DIRECT connector only - not a full proxying connector, the soonest you can provide.Please use this Oracle eBusiness instance:https://preprodiexp.autotrader.com/OA_HTML/RF.jsp?function_id=28716credentials: testoim/Welcome2Studio can discover the site, but if you look at the Action of the form, there is a &oas=<string> parameter at the end of the long string. That seems to be dynamic for every session, similar to a session ID. With the proxy, that session ID would not be valid by the time it gets to the app. With HTTP-Fed Direct we can simple login the user, and not proxy, and still be able to compete against Okta, with the intent of creating a full proxying connector later.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: File Upload Dialog box does not close when using SFDC SAML Proxy Connector
description: Issue was originally reported by Symantec and I have replicated the issue in Singlepoint43.The issue is that the "Upload to My Files" that is displayed when uploading files to SFDC doesn't close or report success when accessed through the SFDC Proxy connector.Steps to reproduce:1. Login to Portal2. Launch SFDC SAML Proxy3. Click on Files Tab (may have to click on + if not shown in default tabs4. Click on Upload Files button.5. Select any file6. File is successfully uploaded but the Dialog does not update or close.If the file is large enough it will update the Waiting... to show a percentage, but it still won't close the box when done and it doesn't always show 100% even when the file is fully uploaded.See attached file for example of the dialog with partial upload shown. Screen shot was taken after waiting several minutes after Charles showed that the upload was complete and that the Success message had been delivered to the browser.This has been tested and fails in IE, Chrome, and Firefox.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Re: FW: HCCS SimPL Single Sign-on / SAML Update to Version 1.9.1
description: David,I have cc'd our support to create a ticket for your inquiry. I have reviewed my notes from the integration and I recommend creating a new connector in your environment for this sandbox setup. Please find below the configuration settings you would use to setup the new connector.Use the SAML2 Generic Direct Post connector in the Trust FabricName/Description/Portal Text: Can be anything you like. I believe I used 'SimplLMS Sandbox'Choose SP InitiatedMenu URL:http://schumacher.dev.dytonvhost.com/auth/saml/ACS URL:http://schumacher.dev.dytonvhost.com/auth/saml/saml2-acs.php/30b4a83dcf370f2285de34cade0cae4bSP Entity ID:30b4a83dcf370f2285de34cade0cae4bUpload your SAML private key. You can regenerate a new pair if needed for this connectorOn the Attributes tab set the followingIdentifier Type: Email AddressUser Store: your user store for your environmentProperty: sAMAccountName if using AD or a similar attribute in your user store that will correspond with the username in the SimlLMS sandboxcheck the box to Extend the SAML Attribute ContractAdd the following new attributeAttribute Source: user storeAttribute Name: uidUser Store: choose your user storeProperty/Value:sAMAccountName if using AD or a similar attribute in your user store that will correspond with the username in the SimlLMS sandboxSet any user stores on the main user store tabSet any policies you want on the main Policies tabOnce you save the new connector and publish you should be able to test with the sandbox for SimplLMS as long as you have the username you are logging into the user portal with sync'd with the username in the SimplLMS sandbox.Let me know if you have any more questions.Regards,Shaun FeakerSr. Services EngineerOffice: 303-815-1550sfeaker@symplified.comReachSymplifiedSupporthereorcall:303-318-4188option2Symplified |The Cloud Identity Companywww.symplified.comhttp://www.symplified.com/Symplified-In-Wall-St-Journal-Fortune-Surpasses-3p8-Million-UsersOn Wed, Aug 22, 2012 at 10:33 AM, Braly, David <david_braly@schumachergroup.com> wrote:Hello Shaun,Do you have any insight on this?They want to upgrade the code in SIMPL to 1.9.1Thanks,David BralyNetwork AdministratorDavid_Braly@schumachergroup.comO469.232.4014F214.706.8199schumachergroup.comFrom: Jhoselin Perez-Blanco [mailto:jperezblanco@hccs.com]On Behalf Of SupportSent: Wednesday, August 22, 2012 10:08 AMTo: Braly, DavidCc: Marrette, Lee; Hanlon, Billy; Support; Paula LaneSubject: RE: HCCS SimPL Single Sign-on / SAML Update to Version 1.9.1Hi David,To answer your question, we are changing the code we use in SIMPL to interact with Schumacher Group's Single-Sign-On Provider. The libraries that SIMPL uses for this interaction are part of an open-source package that has gone through some upgrades. We need to test that the upgraded code still works as it should before deploying it.Our development team has confirmed that in October of 2011 they worked directly with a support engineer at your provider--Shaun Feaker at Symplified. What Shaun did was set up a "test connector" on his development platform that communicated with our development platform. From what we can see, the portal our development platform points at is still available. It just does not recognize the test user we used at the time. It could be that the only thing that needs to be done is contact Symplified and get that test user re-established. However, it might also be necessary that the test-connector needs to be re-created on that end.Once that is in place, we should be able to authenticate back to our development platform once again--with the existing code. After that we can upgrade the code and confirm that things are still working. All of this tied back to Symplified's support Ticket #16057-3127; although they eventually started working directly via email and phone.Please let us know if you have any questions or need more information in order to move forward.Sincerely,Jhoselin Perez-BlancoHCCS - Experts in Healthcare Learning(516)478-4100, x114jperezblanco@hccs.comOur mission at HCCS is to help healthcare institutions survive and thrive by reducing the burden of regulatory requirements and improving the quality of patient care. We accomplish this by providingEFFECTIVE compliance training and tracking solutions which enhance job performance, improve patient outcomes, and promote compliance with ethical, legal, and accreditation guidelines. In this way, healthcare institutions can focus on their core mission of easing discomfort, healing, and saving lives.http://www.hccs.com (877) 933-HCCS.This email message is for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and contains confidential and privileged information. Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure or distribution is strictly prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient or have received this communication in error please contact the sender by reply e-mail and destroy all copies of the original message. Thank you.From: Paula LaneSent: Tuesday, August 21, 2012 1:55 PMTo: Braly, DavidCc: Marrette, Lee; Hanlon, Billy; SupportSubject: Re: HCCS SimPL Single Sign-on / SAML Update to Version 1.9.1David,Thanks for the reply.I'm out-of-the office on a personal matter for the next week. In my absence, I've asked my colleague, Jhoselin Perez-Blanco, to provide you with the necessary information in order tPlease open the attachment to view the entire email.

subject: Dropbox File Display
description: If a text file is uploaded to dropbox and then shared via a link the file will display differently directly and through the proxy.Directly the text of the file is rendered on the page by a javascript loader. When the page is proxied the javascript loader doesn't seem to run at all, instead an icon for the file is displayed.Users can download the file through either direct or proxied access so this is primarily a cosmetic issue.

subject: New login form field in Sungard PTA application
description: Moody's reported that their Sungard PTA application SSO stopped working earlier this week (around the time that the application's website was updated).In comparing the form in the handler (under Application Types --> Sungard_Moodys QA or Sungard_Moodys) with the current login form, I saw that they have added a new form field called 'st' that apears to be a dynamic value. I updated the Application Types to include 'st' as a 'use form value' input, and that seems to be a viable workaround but we should update the Trust Fabric to include this as well.

subject: FW: FW: Symplified
description: Before the most recent update when the IDR was showing available I had published some adapters and everything stopped working. I disabled them and it started working again. Please see the below information on the issue as described by one of our developers. The issue presents itself when we publish a configuration after adding a new adapter.Im honestly not sure. It doesn't break MySG.com though,it breaks the login.tsged.com (i.e. The simplified custom portal). I just want to clarify that, because the problem isn'tmysg.com – when it breaks it breaks everything (SSO logins don't work at all).If you do not configure the adapter to "display in portal" itshould be fine – I think that would avoid the issue (Im not 100% sure though)Honestly the person that needs to answer and solve this problem isSymplified… The issue is a problem occurring in infrastructure that was built to their specifications. I don't know why adding additional adapters broke it in the first place. This is similar to the original problem we had I think – it was due to a buffer configured on our web server not being big enough. I can't avoid problems like this if they don't tell us about them – they offer no documentation concerning that kind of stuff.If it is in fact an issue with the custom portal web server, I can probably fix it – but they need to tell me why adding additional adapters is breaking it in the first place. subject: Box keeps asking me to enter my password
description: Following the steps below will cause Box to keep asking me to enter my password to continue login.1. From the ribbon, click Box.2. Verify you will see that you logged in to Box successfully.3. Click "Log Out" link from within Box application.4. Close the browser tab for this Box application.5. Relaunch Box by clicking the icon from the ribbon again.6. Verify, now you stuck in the login page and cannot continue until you provide your password.7. Clear the browser cache.8. Repeat step 1-2, you'll be able to login successfully and continue further.See attachement.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Session handling when integrating with Nukona
description: In support of the Credit Suisse POC, Nukona engineers are testing the integration of their systemwith O3.Attached to this ticket is an mp4 file that shows the failure scenario that the Nukona engineers went through. In short the scenario follows these steps:- user opens a wrapped email client (iKonic)- user needs to authenticate with O3 (via webview component).- the wrapped email client "retains" the O3 session cookie such that it can be shared with other Nukona wrapped apps.- the user clicks on a proxy-URL (deep-link) into DropBox(www-dropbox-com.ea30.symanteco3.com)- The Dropbox deeplink URL opens up in the wrapped browser app ("Safe Browser"); the Nukona wrapper passes the O3 session cookie along with the deeplink URL. Since the O3 session exist, no O3 login is required.- O3 does the authn against Dropbox (again in webview component) and user ends up on the correct Dropbox webpage.- the user closes the Safe-Browser (and terminates the ipad app)- user goes back to the ikonic wrapped email app and clicks once more on the Dropbox deeplink- The Dropbox deeplnk URL opens up in the Safe-Browser (the O3 session cookie is passed again, so no O3 login required), but then Dropbox doesn't recognize the session and the O3-GW doesn'tre-authenticate against Dropbox. End-result is that the user ends up at a proxied web-page that requires the user to login on the dropbox site.Note that the movie takes about 30 secs to start so you can advance to that point.Somewhere the session cookie is getting lost I believe.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Password Expired Flag Set for User Created in User Mgt via createUser API

subject: Chrome HTTP-Fed Direct extension won't automatically install
description: In Chrome 21+, if you try and access an HTTP-Fed Direct application but don't yet have the plug-in/extension installed, you get a warning and no easy/obvious thing to click to get past it. Apparently recent versions of Chrome only allow you to automatically install extensions from the Chrome Store, not from other sites, but our IDR is presenting the link to the plug-in location on the IDR itself (not in the Chrome Store).We need to get the plug-in in the Chrome Store, and then update code so that the link presented to Chrome users goes to the Chrome Store location.FYI, Jeb's Requirements page (https://sites.google.com/a/symplified.com/requirements-information/) indicated that we support Chrome 12+ and that the URL for the Chrome extension is "located in the Chrome store with the filename: extension.crx" However, I can't find it in the Chrome Store when searching for Symplified, Singlepoint, or extension.crx.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: IDRs determining HA config based on eth0 IP, which is not always unique
description: Zurich's "disabled" DR IDR has the same management and portal IPs as its active production IDR counterpart (a configuration that was approved in an architecture review over a year ago). Unfortunately, it appears that in 9.3, the IDR's management IP is used to determine its HA configuration, and in this case it means that the production IDR with the same IP as the DR IDR is acting like it's "disabled" (running in a standalone / cluster of one mode). We need to be able to support this configuration, perhaps by determining an IDR's HA configuration based on a unique identifier (such as the IDR Activation Key) instead of using the IDR's hostname or IP address.Our interim workaround for Zurich's production environment is for us to remove the DR IDR from the customer object, but Zurich is doing DR testing in November and will need the DR IDR to be re-added to the customer object by then.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Reverse Proxy does not respect client's Accept-Encoding header
description: When a client (browser, applet, etc) makes an HTTP request, is has the option of sending an "Accept-Encoding" header that lists different encodings that the client knows how to process. If a server sees this header and finds an encoding in the list that it knows how to use, it can respond with a "Content-Encoding" header that describes how the body content is encoded when the client receives it. One of the more common uses is gzip encoding, which compresses the body content of the response to make it smaller to transmit.In Symplified releases 9.3 and earlier, if the IDR doesn't see an Accept-Encoding request header, it will still respond with a Content-Encoding of gzip and an encoded body. Common browsers typically handle this just fine, but it may cause problems for some applets. To force the IDR to respond with no encoding (as expected based on the applet's request), we can configure the following Rewrite Rule for the application: RequestHeader unset Accept-EncodingHowever, if other portions of the application DO expect to use gzip encoding, this is not possible. We can either set gzip (our default) or unset it for no compression (with the rewrite rule), but we SHOULD be honoring the request based on the Accept-Encoding header sent by the client/browser, not overriding it.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: SSO Passthrough not working

I created a test application to monitor the traffic from the IDR to the HTTP-FED app and when no credentials are entered in the keychain, no login request is submitted. I expected the login credentials to be submitted. I have been working with Shaun Feaker on this, but wanted to submit an official ticket as this is going to be a high-priority issue very soon.

subject: SYMC does not have latest IWA Connector
description: The version of the IWA connector package availanle in SYMC's SPE for 9.2 environment in EA and Production is not current to Symplified'slatest release. There are known issues in the version we currently have when the Symantec Endpoint Production is installed on the same Windows/IIS server which have been fixed in a more recent version avaiable from Symplified.The standalone IWA connector package available in SYMC's SPE for 9.2 is: O3IWAConnectorInstaller-Release-2012-01-16.msi with a file date of 2/27/2012.The one available from https://support.symplified.com/ics/support/DLSplash.asp?task=download is SinglepointIWAConnector-R2.msi with a file date of 2/15/2012.1) Will the 9.3 version when deployed include the updated version?2) Since the version available from your download location is obviously not branded SPE Symantec branded, I want to confirm that the 9.3 version not only will be the most current connector but it will also have the Symantec branding.This is a standalone package which is packaged in an MSI installation file for installing onto an Windows/IIS server and provides the functionality required by the “IWA Connector” enabled on the IDR through Studio.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Discovered HFED Connector for Avero not working
description: One of the required external applications for Caesar's is the Avero application. Currently no connector for this application exists in the Trust fabric. As a result this will require a discovered connector. We have attempted via a test system to implement a discovered connectorand have been unsuccessful. The login form doesn’t have a submit button, instead there’s a javascript call for submit. Also, the web site URL never changes. The login page has an Ajax/javascript function that dynamically loads content.The initial login form settings the wizard generates aren’t correct but once you correct them, O3 ‘authenticates’ but you just land on the login page in an unauthenticated state. URL/Credentials for Avero:harrahs.test / Welcome123https://slingshot.averoinc.comNeed some assistance to get this connector working.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Apache HTTP Server Multiple Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerabilities
description: THREAT:Apache HTTP Server modules "mod_status", "mod_imagemap", "mod_imap" and "mod_proxy_ftp" contain multiple cross-site scriptingvulnerabilities. These vulnerabilities arise from the application failing to properly sanitize user input.IMPACT:Successful exploitation will allow an attacker to launch arbitrary code in a user's browser or steal cookie-based authentication credentials.SOLUTION:Upgrade to the latest version of Apache, which is available from the Apache Software Foundation Web site at http://www.apache.org/(http://www.apache.org/).
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Zurich Followup
description: As a followup for the outages at Zurich we need the Engineering/QA team to further analyze the logs from the IDRs to try and determine the exact cause of the failure. We know that they were running performance tests right before it failed where they were using a pool of 1500 test users authenticating at roughly 300 users per minute per IDR. Zurich has an intentionally long inactivity timeout, 4 hours, so the sessions continued accumulating until the devices locked up with approximately 50,000 sessions total (they are clustered so this is for both IDRs). We addressed the immediate issue and have both devices back up and running well, but we need to take a look at this so we can avoid such a hard crash in the future.Here are the bundlelogs for both devices (after they came back online) and we can meet to discuss further if you need additional information:https://tigger.symplified.net/logdrop/symplified_my1.zurichna.com_2012-09-16_14-24-27.tar.gzhttps://tigger.symplified.net/logdrop/symplified_my2.zurichna.com_2012-09-17_00-06-43.tar.gz
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Update Oracle P6 Web HTTP-Fed Direct adapter to accommodate slower loading pages
description: Critigen is seeing intermittent problems accessing their P6 Web application via HTTP-Fed Direct -- it appears that if the landing page takes more than 5 seconds to load, we trigger the failure detection and present the "Oops... keychain failed" message.As discussed with Lohika, the solution for this application will be to change the failure detection to look for a failure string on the login page (such as something about 'invalid' username or password) instead of this:<AuthenticationFailureCriteria> <Type>VISIBLE_TEXT</Type> <Comparison>DOES_NOT_CONTAIN</Comparison> <Value>Logout</Value> </AuthenticationFailureCriteria>As a reminder, Critigen's application URL & test credentials are:https://devlgp6.eppmcloud.com/p6/action/loginUser/pass 1: DevUser01 / Welcome01User/pass 2: DevUser02 / Welcome02

subject: Support request
description: Howdy, Amylin Pharmaceuticals was purchased in late July by Bristol Myers Squibb. We expect to maintain our existing infrastructure and directory for some undetermined period of time, which may be measured in years versus months. There is a significant amount of integration work going on now to integrate our systems and processes with theirs. I’d like to schedule a support call to discuss some of the authentication options available to us with your product moving forward. Long term I’d like to understand how we can leverage using their IDs for access to our current SAML SaaS applications. Direct integration with their directory seems like one approach. Leveraging their existing IdP infrastructure seems like another approach. A third approach might be integrating our applications with more than one IdP, so users coming from Amylin pass through Symplified for auth, and users coming from BMS pass through their IdP. In the shorter term I’d also like to know what options we have for authenticating BMS identities to Salesforce using our existing delegated authentication connector, or via SAML connector if that is required. There is a business need to grant BMS users access to our Salesforce environment in the next two weeks. Thanks, Cameron McWethyPrincipal Network EngineerAmylin Pharmaceuticals LLC

subject: Amylin - Box SSO Certificate
description: The last time that Box updated their signing cert we were told by Symplified Support that no action was required on our part (see ticket 16057-4196). Can you please confirm if we (or Symplified) need to take any action for this? Thanks, Cameron From: Herring, JohnSent: Saturday, September 22, 2012 4:03 PMTo: McWethy, CameronSubject: Fwd: Box SSO Certificate FYI... ______________________________Begin forwarded message:From: Box Service Notifications <mailto:service-notifications@box.com>Date: September 22, 2012 12:46:21 PM PDTTo: <mailto:john.herring@amylin.com>Subject:Box SSO CertificateHi, The signing certificate associated to your SSO connection with Box is set to expire on October 21st. Since you have ADFS installed, that tends to generate a new token signing certificate automatically. You'll need to get the auto generate certificate or generate a new certificate manually and then send it to us. We'll want coordinate the update so SSO will continue to function without any interruptions. Let me know if you have any questions. Thanks,Nick

subject: Create EZProxy adapter for Bellevue implementation
description: Info from Tony @ ICSynergy:I talked to their EZProxy contact and they said the best (and maybe only) way to integrate with EZProxy is to use their Shibboleth integration. Since Symplfied does not have an existing Shibboleth adapter, they want a custom connector.  We need to provide Bellevue with a proposal to implement the custom connector and configure for their environment. They need to have this done by the end of October at the latest, but hopefully earlier than that. They are working on setting up an EZProxy sandbox environment.1.) Here is a link to the EZProxy Shibboleth integration informationhttp://www.oclc.org/support/documentation/ezproxy/usr/shibboleth.htm 2.) Here is a link to their EZProxy PROD environment with a test id URL: http://www.bellevue.edu/services/library/database-services.aspxUser: 00207367Pass: 1234(FYI I tried using HTTP-FED to integrate, but it didn't work. I think there is a problem since ezproxy is also acting as a proxyto their library services.) 3.) They currently don't use group information for EZProxy authorization, but they have plans to. So, we would need to have the ability to pass the group information as part of the Shibboleth request.We will be using the Shibboleth SP integration. Sympfified will be the IdP. Their PROD environment doesn't use Shibboleth at all, currently. They will setup a Sandbox that enables the Shibboleth SP integration.They are willing to pay for the custom Shibboleth connector.
name: Symplified

subject: FW: Possible bug/problem with O3 portal ribbon not rememberingstored credentials correctly
description: Hi Symplified Support team.The potential customer Ricoh in australia has discovered a bug, which I have not seen before.It appears that from time to time, if you hover the mouse over a Connector Wizard application icon on the ribbon (in this case mariner7.com), the credential popup will display the user's PASSWORD as the username. See attached screenshot where user's password is Ricoh123, and is displayed in the popup.Also see subsequent email from our SE Nick. Please follow up with him directly to see how we can resolve this. He is CC'ed here.From: Nick Savvides <Nick_Savvides@symantec.com>Date: Tue, 25 Sep 2012 22:00:30 -0700To: Bruce Ong <bruce_ong@symantec.com>, Jim Brigham <James_Brigham@symantec.com>Subject: FW: Possible bug/problem with O3 portal ribbon not remembering stored credentials correctlyGents, I urgently need your assistance on this. See below. I wouldn’t think that the ribbon populate the popup with a password! Nick. -------------------------------------------------------Nick SavvidesSenior Principal Systems Engineer,Information & Identity Protectionnick_savvides@symantec.comMobile: +61 434 600 870Fax: +61 3 9674 5574 SymantecLevel 3, 437 St. Kilda RoadMelbourne, Victoria, 3004 From:jmcnatty@ricoh.com.au [mailto:jmcnatty@ricoh.com.au] Sent: Wednesday, 26 September 2012 2:24 PMTo: Nick Savvides; Phillip LoweCc: Paul Salmon; JBerne@ricoh.com.auSubject: Possible bug/problem with O3 portal ribbon not remembering stored credentials correctly Hi Nick/Phil,I was hoping you may be able to assist with a problem I've just discovered. I've just had another try at logging in as one of the test users (ea59user2), and went to use the button to log in to our Mariner7.com system (i.e. one of our HR systems).When I hovered the mouse over the Mariner7 icon, the "User application-specific credentials" option was ticked (as per normal), however, the user name field was greyed out. So I wasn't too sure what to try, so I just typed in my password on it's own, and clicked the Mariner7 icon, which sent me through the Mariner7.com website, but just to the Mariner7 log in page.So I then logged out of O3, and logged back in again, and this time when I hovered the mouse over the Mariner7 icon, the user name field was accessible this time but for some strange reason it had my password (instead of my username) already entered in (see attached screen shot - screenshot_01.jpg). So I changed the username to "jimbo123@ricoh.com.au", entered the password in as "ricoh123" (see attached screen shot - screenshot_02.jpg), and then clicked save.However, when I then hovered the mouse over the Mariner7 icon again, again for some strange reason the username field was populated with "ricoh123" (i.e. my password, rather than username).If you could please do a bit of testing/investigation of this issue, I would very much appreciate it, as this seems to me like either possibly a bug in O3, or perhaps some kind of browser/client issue.Thanks in advance.Regards,James______________________________________________________________________James McNatty | IT Systems Engineer | Ricoh Australia Pty LtdPhone:(02) 8977 1180 | Fax:(02) 8977 1170 | Web:ricoh.com.au[cid:_1_0AE0ACF00AE0A3E40018263ACA257A85]Find out more about the Ricoh eco billboard global initiativeRicoh Australia Pty Ltd ( "Ricoh Australia")This email is private and confidential to the intended recipient. subject: BOX integration issues
description: Hello, I am still having some issues integrating the Box application please see below:For both the Sync client and the re-connection issues we are dealing with an SP initiated SAML request. Here is a typical SP Initiated SAML request: <saml2p:Response Destination="https://sso.services.box.net/sp/ACS.saml2" ID="ehdpcpdoopnmiccngcadhbpmckfmccofdapmmapn" InResponseTo="iG_oVxMsibyg1xiSBj1pFOoiJ29" IssueInstant="2012-09-26T20:44:46.759Z" Version="2.0" xmlns:saml2p="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:protocol" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">Here is the actual response that we are getting: <saml2p:Response Destination="https://sso.services.box.net/sp/ACS.saml2" ID="ehdpcpdoopnmiccngcadhbpmckfmccofdapmmapn" IssueInstant="2012-09-26T20:44:46.759Z" Version="2.0" xmlns:saml2p="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:protocol" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">It appears as though the responses we are receiving from Symplified are lacking the InResponseTo attribute. Is there a configuration for this on the Symplified config? Can we get a Symplified tech on the phone to work through this issue? We are close on getting this configured, but just need to work through these issues. I'm confident we will be able to figure it out.
name: Dentsu Network

subject: Trust Connector Doesn't Work with GET Method
description: The Trust Connector utility does not appear to work with the GET method. When viewing the connection over http via wireshark, I am not seeing the credentials being sent to the application and the end user is not authenticated. When I create a simple form with the correct parameters, I am seeing the credentials being sent to the application and the end user is authenticated. Note that the login URL accepts a POST via the parameters that can be viewed in the Login URL and the login URL also accepts the parameters UserName and password via GET (per the vendor). subject: Misleading Tooltip in Studio for 'Include Certificate" option on SAML2 Trust Connector
description: When a user hovers over the Load Certificate button that appears after checking "Include Certificate" on the Advanced tab the tooltip says: "Click to upload your public key. This should be the public key that corresponds to the private key used to sign the SAML Response (or SAML Assertion)."This tooltip should instruct the user to load the certificate file that corresponds to the private key used, not a public key. I have had multiple customers call after trying to create new SAML2 adapters and not being able to save after loading the public key.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Shared File is no longer a proxied link
description: There is a regression in functionality when upgrading to 9.3.0-21 when sharing a file using thecopy to clipboard command.Steps to reproduce:1) Upload file into root directory or to any folder other than Public.2) Share the file by clicking on the paper clip icon on the right hand side of the highlighted file.3) Browser refreshes to the file which contains the proper proxied URL.3) Select the 'Copy link to this page' button4) The resulting link that is copied is non-proxied.This is a regression in functionality as it was working previously prior to the update and is currentlyworking with the non-updated 9.2 version in EA.Email also in this view no longer works which worked previously.This is a critical item for us because we anticipate that encrypted files will be shared in this mannerand as such need to be proxied.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Missing "Destination" attribute in signed IDP SAML request
description: Per SAML v2 specification, a IDP SAML authenticationRequest must include the core SAML request attribute "Destination" when the request is signed:“If the message is signed, the Destination XML attribute in the root SAML element of the protocol message MUST contain the URL to which the sender has instructed the user agent to deliver the message. The recipient MUST then verify that the value matches the location at which the message has been received.”The current version of the O3-GW/IDR does not generate a signed authn request with the Destination attribute included, e.g.:<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><saml2p:AuthnRequest xmlns:saml2p="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:protocol" AssertionConsumerServiceURL="https://gw.ea1.symanteco3.com/SPServlet?sp_id=vyc715c75kdy" ForceAuthn="false" ID="jdnhlfpailffpbkndijonihgecfchmnecbichcpj" IsPassive="false" IssueInstant="2012-10-08T16:53:50.311Z" ProtocolBinding="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-POST" ProviderName="SYMPLIFIED" Version="2.0"><saml2:Issuer xmlns:saml2="urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:assertion">https://gw.ea1.symanteco3.com/mingo3</saml2:Issuer><ds:Signature xmlns:ds="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#"><ds:SignedInfo><ds:CanonicalizationMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n#"/><ds:SignatureMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1"/><ds:Reference URI="#jdnhlfpailffpbkndijonihgecfchmnecbichcpj"><ds:Transforms><ds:Transform Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#enveloped-signature"/><ds:Transform Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2001/10/xml-exc-c14n#"/></ds:Transforms><ds:DigestMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1"/><ds:DigestValue>b+xmVhpDG22gWeh7oh6Fz7cQjRE=</ds:DigestValue></ds:Reference></ds:SignedInfo><ds:SignatureValue></ds:SignatureValue></ds:Signature></saml2p:AuthnRequest>The inclusion of the Destination attribute is needed for a Norton-Identity service, whereby Norton acts as a SAML v2 IDP, but requires signed requests.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: HTTP-Fed to https site w/ custom port does not honor port with relative 302-redirects
description: Critigen had a sharepoint app running behind a load balancer. The load balancer was configured to perform SSL offloading, and was listening on port 444. We integrated this app via Trust Connector (HTTP-Fed discovery). When we talked to it on its non-SSL custom port (8001) it worked fine. When, after I found this bug, I had them change the load balancer to listen on 443 instead of 444, it worked fine. However, with the https://webserver:444/ config we would see a relative link in a 302 redirect and our next request dropped the custom port. subject: IDR should redirect to Error page (with a defined URL parameter) instead of displaying "Internal Server Error"
description: In a reverse proxy configuration, if the back-end webserver returns a 500 error, the IDR just displays a default "Internal Server Error" message. This is ugly. Instead, the IDR should trap this and redirect the user to the defined error page, ideally with a URL parameter so that the error page could figure out what caused the redirect.In the interim, I've worked around this with a rewrite rule like the following, but it has to be done in every H-Fed/No-AuthN application:ErrorDocument 500 https://login.eppmcloud.com/Account/Error.aspx?500-Internal-Server-Error
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: idr-rename-keychain does not work as expected
description: In my testing, I found that I could only run the idr-rename-keychain command to move an existing keychain if the new user didn't yet have a user profile. For example:/Users/ltumey/Keychain_API> idr-rename-keychain --server x.x.x.x --key "foo/bar" -u ltumey48 -n ltumey48bogus (worked) /Users/ltumey/Keychain_API> idr-rename-keychain --server x.x.x.x --key "foo/bar" -u ltumey48bogus -n ltumey48Failed to create the keychain 'ltumey48'. Make sure that the identity router is running properly. Status code = 403./Users/ltumey/Keychain_API> (attempting to move it back failed)I even tried first running the idr-remove-keychains command for the "new" user target, but that didn't work, either.Either need to fix the utility to be able to rename to any target userid (even if a user profile/keychain already exists) or to at least update the documentation to clarify exactly when/how this command can be used.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: HTTP-Fed Direct IE extension install warnings
description: Even after signing the IE extension (Parature 16057-4827), newer versions of IE (as found in Windows 8, IE9) display ugly warnings when users attempt to install it. See attached screenshot from Bill at Critigen. He also said:Seems the SmartScreen filter built into Windows 8 now is all based on reputation (download count, etc.) First step is the signing so that it can track it based on the signature… This step at least gets past the unsigned executable :) More details on the SmartScreen feature in W8: http://www.ghacks.net/2011/04/08/windows-8-to-feature-smartscreen-filter-protection/ and http://www.ghacks.net/2012/02/09/how-to-bypass-smartscreen-filter-windows-protected-your-pc-in-windows-8/

subject: This is for a High Visibility implementation in France - these are for a meeting tomorrow 10/17. IWA & IdLink general inquries
description: IWA:1. question of whether a single IWA installation can be used for multiple multiple domains or just a single domain. An extension of this question, if it supports multiple domains, is if a single IWA can support multiple forests. As an example reference, both VIP and Magnum support multiple domains within a single forest, so we only need 1 VIP gateway per forest (without redundancy of course).2. - What will be the consequence for end users if IWA server is down ?  => impact for users already connected ? => impact for users not yet connected ? => Is it possible to connect with user & password (without SSO)3. - Scalability:  What will be the method to increase users on IDlink ? What kind of loadbalancing ? What are the Load balancing policies ?IdLink:1. - What will be the size of log ( IDLink will log messages to/var/log/messages) ?- Could you confirm that IDlink could forward log to syslog ? 2. - Scalability:  What will be the method to increase users on IDlink ?3. - How is declared the IDlink server in symantec gateway ? By his IP adress ? By a DNS name ? On which DNS server (provider DNS server as a public name ? In that case, could we do round robin ?
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Saml2Generic extended attributes not accepting URL for name of user store attribute
description: Zendesk requires that the attribute names for their Just In Time provisioning (& display name handling) are:organizationphonetagshttp://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/givennamehttp://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/surnameIf you use the Saml2GenericDirectPost and try and set a User Store attribute to have the name, "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/givenname" you get an error when trying to save in studio:org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException : could not insert: [com.symplified.persistence.orm.entity.policy.StoredCredentialType]; SQL [/* insert com.symplified.persistence.orm.entity.policy.StoredCredentialType */ insert into credential_type (create_date, create_user, modified_date, modified_user, tenant, display_name, name, uuid, authentication_config_id, index_position, property_name, userstore_name, discriminator) values (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, 'STORED')]; nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.DataException: could not insert: [com.symplified.persistence.orm.entity.policy.StoredCredentialType]If you save it as a different name (like 'tempname') and then go back and change it to the full URL as the name, it acts like it saves successfully, but the assertion will contain the 'tempname' (so it's like it's not actually updating the config -- the SPS UI shows the URL, but the assertion is still using the old name).Note that you CAN save a Constant attribute with a URL name and that works, just not when you need that attribute to be from a user store.If you first save it as a Constant, and then go back to try and change to be a User Store attribute, the dropdown of user store attributes is blank so you can't save it.I have no workarounds, and this is a Zendesk requirement, which is required for Qualcomm QLabs' go-live in a couple of weeks.
name: Symplified, Inc.

subject: Invalid input to PortalImageServlet causes internal server error (9.2 code)
description: Issue: Invoke PortalImageServlet with an idp_id request when there are no configured IdPs and the result is an internal server error rather than redirecting to the error handler page. This does not seem to cause any operational issues with the gateway.Test scenarios:https://o3.gw1.tso-cloud.com/PortalImageServlet?idp_id=ITC+Domain - Scenario: Valid request- Result: HTTP 200 Image https://o3.gw1.tso-cloud.com/PortalImageServlet?idp_id=bogus Scenario: Invalid request and gateway has IdPs configuredResult: HTTP 302 Redirect to configured error page https://o3.gw2.tso-cloud.com/PortalImageServlet?idp_id=bogus- Scenario: Invalid request and gateway has no IdPs configured- Result: HTTP 500The scenario shouldn’t happen but it’s the kind of situation that would occur in an automated or directed attack against a gateway
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: O3 cannot contact management server. Audit logging is not functional.
description: Symantec directly help us set up the O3 VM that we currently have. 2 of our engineers worked with a sales person who also had an engineer assisting. They sent us the download link for the VM and then helped us configure it in our vsphere environment. It has had issues in the past, and last week it was having issues again so it was rebooted. After the reboot we were never able to get logging back. We reverted to an earlier snapshot but the server is still having issues. The only access we have to it is through the management portal. I have attached a screenshot of the console. Followup information:It did work correctly for the first couple of weeks. We have intermittent success with logging, for example syslog started working this morning for about an hour, without anyone touching the system. Last week the system became unresponsive and would not accept configuration changes. The issues now are the same as last week. One of my colleagues did the reboot. The snapshot seemed to fix some things, but not everything. It allowed configurations to be accepted, though the intermittent logging continued. The server worked fine at the time that the snapshot was taken, but we don't know why restoring to it did not resolve all the issues.What further information should I gather about this problem?Can the Customer configure in Vsphere environment and can they revert back with a snapshot?
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Duplicate AccesKey and AccessID for the Studio REST API causes issues
description: In the current Studio REST implementation if the AccessKey or AccessID is duplicated between customer instances two problems occur:- duplicate accessId will cause Studio to become unstable.- duplicate accessKey will expose other customer's data.To address this neither should be editable by the customer and instead the system should auto generate both the accessId and accessKey that is random and uniqueneither one changeable

subject: Zimbra for GridJoy Opportunity
description: GridJoy is looking to build an SSO platform around a number of services that they are offering including email by Zimbra. The users will be net-new, and hence, will not have accounts in the Zimbra service initially. What GridJoy wants is to be able to provision a new user to Zimbra when they register with GridJoy and opt-in/subscribe to the email service. Zimbra comes with a built-in LDAP Service. Ideally we would be able to provide a Service Provider enablement kit that would consume the SAML attributes and check to see if the user exists in the LDAP. If not, then create the user. If the user exists, then provide SSO through SAML.
name: Symplified SE Team

subject: Ozone: O365: showing favicon.ico after successful log in from ribbon
description: Step to reproduce:1) Click on O365 icon on the ribbon2) Click on Team Site3) Try to clear your cookies and caches (the reason why I do this is to make the session expired or you can wait until the session expired to continue)4) Click on "Add document" link5) The pop up will ask you to log in at the ribbon, log in with the same credential6) You will see smaller pop up where it said favicon.ico (16x16 pixels) or smaller size if you make your window smaller.After we are successfully log in it should take us back to the working page. Af of now, I don't really know how to exit that favicon.ico pop up except hitting refresh button.I attached 2 videos. One is from smaller size of window and one is from maximize window.https://www.dropbox.com/s/ilkf51zzh5moswa/LogInPOPUP_insmallwindow.avihttps://www.dropbox.com/s/t03jvfxx0bcpbzp/loginPOPUP_inmaximineWindow.aviThanksTrong
