subject: FW: Cisco WebEx Update REQUIRED
description: Symplified Support, We received the following notification from WebEx regarding an impending expiration of their X.509 certificate. I don’t recall us importing the certificate they are mentioning anywhere in the Symplified appliance when David Lumpkin and I were testing the connector, but I want to make sure the certificate expiration won’t impact us. Details on our WebExSAML connector configuration:· Generic SAML connector (not WebEx specific connector)· SP-Init· Verify Certificates is checked· Sign Assertion Only is checked· ALL OTHER OPTIONS UNDER ADVANCED TAB ARE UNCHECKED (including Encrypt Assertion & AuthNRequest Signed) Please confirm if we can ignore this notification from WebEx. Thanks, Cameron McWethyPrincipal Network EngineerAmylin Pharmaceuticals, Inc. From: Schmid, JohnSent: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 2:14 PMTo: McWethy, CameronCc: Caravella, Chris; Stewart, ToddSubject: FW: Cisco WebEx Update REQUIRED This looks important…I am not sure what exactly this is…I thought our webex did not expire until next April. John From: InterCall Technical Support [mailto:mcsupport@intercall.com]Sent: Tuesday, October 30, 2012 12:01 PMTo: Schmid, JohnSubject: Cisco WebEx Update REQUIRED If you are having trouble reading this email,read the online version.   Important: Service Update Dear John Schmid,You are receiving this announcement as the primary account contact for your company's Cisco WebEx meeting service for amylin.webex.com.Cisco has determined that the WebEx Centers X.509 certificate, which authorizes the communication between WebEx service and your Identity Management system, will expire on December 2, 2012.You have received this message as we have identified that you have Single Sign On (SSO) enabled and you might be using one of the following features:· Encrypting the assertion for SSO transactions· Enabled Single Logout feature· Authnsigned requestIf you have imported the WebEx certificate to your Identity Management system, your Identity Management system will need a new site level WebEx certificate in order for normal operation of WebEx Centers. Failure to update the certificate will result in service outage. Please make every effort to update your certificate on or before November 15, 2012 to prevent an outage.If you have not imported the WebEx certificate to your Identity Management system, please ignore this email.To determine which of the impacted features your site is set up with and for instruction on how to update your WebEx certificate,click here to view our frequently asked questions.If you have any questions regarding this update, InterCall technical support can be reached by phone at 800.508.8758 or +1.706.634.4551.For non-urgent questions or issues, please contact us via email atmcsupport@intercall.com.Thank you for your continued business.[http://images.e.intercall.com/eloquaimages/clients/InterCall/%7bbc3c1aee-31f2-4e2f-a49c-258a4b19719f%7d_westlogo.jpg] InterCall | 8420 West Bryn Mawr Suite 1100 Chicago, IL 60631 | 773.399.1600 |www.intercall.com Become a fan on Facebook  Follow  Connect with us on Linkedin Unsubscribe | View our Privacy PolicyBy ordering or using Services provided by or through InterCall, you agree to be bound by the Terms and Conditions set forth athttp://www.intercall.com/terms or, in the alternative if applicable, a written Service Agreement executed by you and InterCall (in either case the "Agreement"). Furthermore, you agree that (i) to the extent applicable, you shall be charged for the Services at rates specifically agreed to between you and InterCall and (ii) you shall be charged for all fees, surcharges and Services for which you do not have a specifically negotiated rate at InterCall’s standard rates. You may obtain InterCall’s standard rates through your sales or account representative or, in some cases, your web account. Your use of the Services indicates your acceptance of the above.[http://app.e.intercall.com/e/FooterImages/FooterImage1?elq=eefd0b3087994995a4d3cdd8fc3591c7&siteid=1354]Please open the attachment to view the entire email.

subject: Studio session remains active on system reboot
description: There have been reports where on system reboot the Studio system remains active.An active Studio session was open, on one of the configuration pages (e.g. in an application or user-store config page), when the system crashed (yes mac's crash too). In both cases the system was rebooted. After reboot re-opened the browser (chrome in this case), whereby the browser attempts to restart/recreate the various sessions that were open in multiple browser tabs. In both cases the IC session simply reopened and we could continue to work. This time the reboot occurred within 5 minutes. At a different time the system had been on Standby overnight before it crashed and rebooted (12+ hours later).
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Mobile Portal issues in iOS6 and 9.3
description: Testing of the updated 9.3 version resulted in the following issues being noted:1. Applications do not launch in a new tab which is a major issue esp with SAML apps where you generally can’t browse back to the portal page.2.User/Password dialog does not accept keyboard Go/Done. You must manually tap the Login button.3.Buttons painted at the lower edge of the portal are randomly missing text. Sometimes it’s there; sometimes it’s not.4. Mobile rendition of LinkedIn is not logging in. Desktop is logging in normally.Video: https://www.dropbox.com/s/9j3iynu4ik9mn2a/20121102%20-%20IOS601%20and%209_3.mp4

subject: Re: Question on code/error message from login servlet
description: Thanks David,I believe we do want this as an enhancement. It would be much moreefficient to get the error code from the Symplified login servlet than tohave to make a separate LDAP call each time the user tries to log in.Symplified Support - Please add an enhancement to allow the Login Servletto return code 775, which corresponds to Account Locked.Thank you,Linda FrazierCSC-Zurich AccountiNet Application Services(847) 605-6729 – Schaumburg Office(630) 881-4831 - Celllfrazier2@CSC.com    Re: Question on code/error message from login servlet    David Lumpkin  to:  Linda Frazier  11/06/2012 03:32 PM      Cc:  spinto2, ssingh86, sthangaraj     Hi Linda,The IDRs do not return a specific status code that would indicate thestatus of the service account. If you want to submit it as an enhancementrequest please email support@symplified.com.-David LumpkinDavid LumpkinSolutions EngineerDirect: 303-318-4138Email: dlumpkin@symplified.comSymplifiedThe Cloud Identity Companyhttp://www.symplified.comFollow us on Twitter –Twitter.com/SymplifiedRead our Blog –Blog.Symplified.comRecent News:Symplified Named Leader in Cloud-Based Identity & Access Management -Findout more!Check out our Upcoming Events!On Tue, Nov 6, 2012 at 2:22 PM, Linda Frazier <linda.frazier@zurichna.com>wrote: Thanks David, We are looking to see if the IDR login servlet can return a specific code that we can then receive and then display a specific message to the user. We don't want to have to make a separate LDAP query which will add overhead to the login. Does the IDR return a separate code in the login servlet? Thank you, Linda Frazier CSC-Zurich Account iNet Application Services (847) 605-6729– Schaumburg Office (630) 881-4831- Cell lfrazier2@CSC.com         Re: Question on code/error message from login servlet         David Lumpkin                 to:                  Linda Frazier                            11/06/2012 01:56 PM         Cc:           ssingh86, sthangaraj, spinto2 Hi Linda, When you attempt LDAP authentication and it fails it will return an LDAP error code 49, but there is also a data value returned. When we were testing last week I was seeing data 775, which corresponds to Account Locked. Below is a resource that lists all the different data codes that can be returned: http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21290631 -David Lumpkin David Lumpkin Solutions Engineer Direct: 303-318-4138 Email: dlumpkin@symplified.com SymplifiedThe Cloud Identity Company http://www.symplified.com Follow us on Twitter –Twitter.com/Symplified Read our Blog –Blog.Symplified.com Recent News: Symplified Named Leader in Cloud-Based Identity & Access Management -Find out more! Check out our Upcoming Events! On Tue, Nov 6, 2012 at 8:54 AM, Linda Frazier <linda.frazier@zurichna.com > wrote:  Hi David,  Last week while trouble-shooting our issue with Active Directory, you  were  able to see in the log that the ID/PW was locked. Is there a unique code  that is returned by the Login servlet that we can then read and then  display a message to the end user that their ID is locked?  thank you,  Linda Frazier  CSC-Zurich Account  iNet Application Services  (847) 605-6729– Schaumburg Office  (630) 881-4831- Cell  lfrazier2@CSC.com  ******************* PLEASE NOTE *******************  This E-Mail/telefax message and any documents accompanying this  transmission may contain privileged and/or confidential information and  is  intended solely for the addressee(s) named above. subject: Invalid redirection for local websites
description: So we have an application that uses header attributes for authentication. We are modifying this application to use O3 instead of COREid. The application support team has a website on the server that allows them to log in manually instead of using SSO. The site url for this purpose is http://servername:port. The site url that I need to protect is http://servername:port/appname.I configured a new web server in the Intelligence Center using the servername and port and then configured a new application connector to go along with the web server with the appropriate url for the application. And then published the configuration.After that, when we tried to go to the http://servername:port url we were taken through the O3 gateway instead of going directly to the local website. Is this normal behavior?Because this was not the desired behavior, I deleted the web server and application connector configurations and published again.I expected this to stop the undesired behavior and let us go to the site directly, but instead we are still being sent through the O3 gateway.I have flushed my DNS cache and cleared my IE cache multiple times just to make sure it wasn't something on my client.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Configuring IP address restrictions for IWA does not seem to work

subject: OWA Connector and TMG
description: We're having issues with setting up OWA connector within O3 using the 2e2 provided credentials. We can login direct (https://mail.2e2.com/owa), but using either the trust fabric OWA connector or setting up an HTTP-Fed connector we get the attached error page informing us of an issue with the credentials.We've spoken to 2e2 and they inform us that their OWA/Exchange set-up is as follows:• Microsoft Exchange Server 2010 SP2• Microsoft Threat Management Gateway v7.0.7732.100The Thread Management Gateway (TMG) sits in front of the OWA service provided by the Exchange Server.We're wondering if the inclusion of TMG is the issue here. The default OWA TC logon URL differs from the 2e2 OWA logon URL:• Default OWA Trust Fabric Logon URL: https://<OWA2010_SERVER>/owa/auth/logon.aspx• 2e2 OWA Logon URL: https://mail.2e2.com/CookieAuth.dll?GetLogon?reason=0&formdir=1&curl=Z2FowaHas an OWA connector (TF or Discovered HTTP-Fed) been successfully deployed by Symplified for a configuration using TMG?

subject: Dropbox rejecting requests with a 400 message
description: We have a user with 11 applications configured. If in the Dropbox application "pass headers' and "pass attributes" are enabled, Dropbox will respond with a 400 Bad Request message when attempting to login.The reason for this is the size of the header being sent by the IDR to Dropbox is so large that Dropbox is rejecting it as indeed a bad request (one only needs to look at the x-o3gw-applications to see this)We have "solved" the problem such that if the IGW is enabled we completely sanitize the header being passed to Dropbox. No information related to the IDR is passed to them.If Symplified is using this option without the IGW when going to Dropbox with a user with multiple applications configured you will see this issue.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Unable to get OWA 2010 TF connector to work
description: We have a customer where the PSO team is attempting to get the OWA 2010 connector to work. In this case they are using the connector in the Trust Fabric and have not attempted to use the discovered connector.Even though correct credentials are stored in the keychain, when clicking the app in the ribbon, the creds don’t get passed (no errors, just brings you to the OWA login page – unpopulated).What it looks like is happening, is the traffic is getting redirected back out of the protected domain. This suspicion is based on the URL shown in the browser displaying https://webmail-vitas-com.ea50.symanteco3.com/owa/auth/logon.aspx?replaceCurrent=1&url=https%3a%2f%2fwebmail.vitas.com%2fowa%2f That “replaceCurrent…” bit has us thinking it may be the culprit because it is not proxied. Have we seen this before? Any idea of a possible cause? Customer:https://webmail.vitas.com credentials:O3User / Admin2012I've also setup an admin account in Studio. Use jason_mcfarland2@symplified.com / welcome1The IDR being used is at:https://gw.ea38.symanteco3.com/ ea38User1 / Ozone123$
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: (Howto) retrieve list of IDP services for custom portal
description: The default portal provides access links on the (right side of the) ribbon to external IDP providers that can be configured in the Studio/IntelCenter (e.g. SamlIDP, OpenI, etc.). This appears to be achieved through the IdPRetrievalServlet that the default portal javascript calls through an XMLhttprequest call, which returns a JSON object with the list/URLs of the IDP's. There is no description of the IdPRetrievalServlet in the portal API documentation and a straight call to the servlet renders no valid response.What is the proper API call mechanism for the IdPRetrievalServlet such that we can provide the users a list of IDP's inside a custom portal?

subject: Issues with SimpleLink in HA
description: We tested a pair of Identity Links with a single gateway (gw20.tso-cloud.com). The feature doesn’t work as required. In summary, there are two key findings:1. In an HA pair scenario, each IDL has the same route. From a network perspective, the last IDL online gets all of the traffic (this is all based on host routing tables). If the IDL with the route goes offline, the gateway does not detect the state change in any reasonable time frame. Even after 20 minutes, the user store was not accessible. Sometime overnight, the situation corrected itself and the user store was again reachable. I don’t know if this correction occurred by accident or by design.2. Strange problems arose with both IDLs online. The basic TCP connection test from the Identity Link workspace worked fine, but the user store test failed. It’s going to take some deep reading of network dumps to understand what’s happening. This is so unexpected, it would best if somebody else could try to reproduce in a completely different setup.This is separate from the SYMC IT reported issue and was independently reproduced when a pair of identity links are operating. We were careful to verify that both client #1 and #2 worked when operating solo and then when both were operating things broke down. Specific details in attached document.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: Identity Link appears to be able to route traffic for proxy connectors in addition to user stores
description: In a customer POC environment it appears that they were able to successfully route application traffic through the identity link.The specific use case was hooking up Sharepoint and IIS which were located in the customer's intranet:IdentityLink IP: 10.200.2.5SP IP: 10.80.2.127IIS IP: 10.80.2.9With an HTTP basic connector the user was reverse proxied through the GW on to SP or IIS, but they could not connect these resources other than through IDLink. Our understanding is that traffic through IDLink is restricted to the GW authenticating the user against AD. But here is what happens:When the customer logged into the GW and they clicked the SP icon, using wireshark they could see the IDLink IP access the SP IP, but authentication fails.GW log output:2012-11-30/05:05:10.751/PST [http-bio-8080-exec-10] WARN org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultHttpClient[1033] - Authentication error: Unable to respond to any of these challenges: {ntlm=WWW-Authenticate: NTLM}2012-11-30/05:05:10.752/PST [http-bio-8080-exec-10] INFO com.symplified.service.appliance.core.ApplianceServiceImpl[408] - Attempt to discover authentication config returned nullWe then tested this in a lab enviornment and we can confirm that proxy traffic does indeed route through the identity link assuming the target IP matches the route specified in the IDL configuration.

subject: RE: Symplified 2013 Winter Release
description: Please remove me from this distribution list. ..............................................Jason Muldoon212.553.4045 tel From: Symplified Support [mailto:support@symplified.com]Sent: Monday, December 17, 2012 18:35To: Muldoon, JasonSubject: Symplified 2013 Winter Release [https://c.na3.content.force.com/servlet/servlet.ImageServer?id=01550000000TdCn&oid=00D500000007EiF]Dear Jason Muldoon, We are excited to announce the Winter 2013 release of the Symplified solution to our customers. We strive to continually update and enhance our product in response to both user requests as well as developments in the IAM space, and the Winter 2013 release is reflective of this work.  New Features and ChangesGrIDsure StrongAuthentication: You can now use Safenet GrIDsure as a strong authentication provider in addition to Cryptocard.CIFS and NFS Backups: The Edit Profile/Backups configuration page now lets you set up CIFS and NFS backup options.Active Directory Password Reset: The new User Password Change option adds functionality so that a user who tries to log into the portal with an expired AD password receives a notice that the password must be changed. There is also a new Change Your Login Password link on the My Settings dialog of the portal.New Identity Providers: You can now set up Facebook OAuth and AOL OpenID identity providers.Enhanced HTTP-Fed Direct Extensions: Functionality for HTTP-Fed Direct extensions now supports multi-step logins, which enables logins to more complex web forms.SOC 2 Password Standard Support: Passwords set up for Singlepoint Studio administrators must now conform to AICPA SOC 2 requirements.This release will be applied to your development environment on Friday, January 4th, 2013 from 8AM-5PM MST, your testing/QA environment on Saturday, January 12, 2013 from 8AM-Noon MST, and your production environment on Saturday, January 19, 2013 from 8MA-Noon MST. If you only have two environments they will be updated on Friday the 4th and Saturday the 19th. During these windows the Identity Routers from that day's environment will experience short periods of unavailability. Please do not attempt to make any modifications during these published times. Please contact us if you have any questions. Thank You. subject: October Usage Metrics: Symplified

subject: Decoding target to relaystate
description: Below is a email question that was asked by a venodr we are currently working on, Volunteer Match. I believe this is basically deep linking but we are doing IdP so not sure it is possible without any custom work.In going over your configuration, one more detail I'd like to go over - when a user clicks on a VolunteerMatch link, say from a bookmark, or an email, it will take them to our site, and our site will see that they are not authenticated. We redirect them to:https://saaso2lapv01-pi.biogen.com/IdPServlet?idp_id=cdcprnw6do5yWhen they return with their assertion, currently, they will be sent to the homepage after the SAML passes. We can add a parameter to this URL that includes the link they were trying to access, either fully qualified, or relative. Would you like this feature? To summarize:Step #1If that user is unauthenticated we pass them back to Biogen to get authenticated. We send them here, currently: https://saaso2lapv01-pi.biogen.com/IdPServlet?idp_id=cdcprnw6do5yWe could change the URL to something like "https://saaso2lapv01-pi.biogen.com/IdPServlet?idp_id=cdcprnw6do5y?TARGET_URL=https%3A%2F%2Fbiogenidec.stage.volunteermatch.org%2Fsome_dir%2Fsome_page.jsp%3Fopp_id%3D12345"The "TARGET_URL" name above could be configured to whatever you'd like, but you'd need to take its value, decode it and return it as RelayState.Step #2You authenticate the user and then directs them to https://biogenidec.stage.volunteermatch.org/saml/post;POSTing the SAMLResponse and the RelayState of "https://biogenidec.stage.volunteermatch.org/some_dir/some_page.jsp?opp_id=12345".Step #3VolunteerMatch processes the SAMLResponse and if all works well the user is authorized and forwarded to the RelayState URL.
name: Biogen Idec Inc.

subject: issue with IWA authentication on 03 hosted gateways
description: Description of the Issue:Customer has 2 O3 systems: Production and what they call a Sandbox environment, although both O3 Gateways are hosted on Symantec’s production infrastructure. Both accounts have been configured with IdLink and the IWA components.Correct logon behaviour:Corporate domain user (e.g. ‘castromi’) is logged into their AD domain (nead.danet), when visiting the Sandbox O3 Gateway portal they are automatically authenticated via IWA (Integrated Windows Authentication) and have access to the O3 ribbon. Issue to be resolved in this case:When a domain user (e.g. ‘castromi’) visits the Production O3 Gateway portal, it fails to automatically authenticate the user that is already logged into the domain. Instead, the user is prompted to enter his AD credentials: After submitting the AD credentials (the same used in the Sandbox environment), it yields a “Login Failure” message (“Unable to authenticate with the credentials you provided. Please try again”) and the user gets redirected back to the O3 Gateway portal login web page. The resulting browser URL is: https://gw.cloudsso.danone.com/portal/ribbon/login.html?singlepoint-portal-event=auth-failed&singlepoint-auth-error=NOT_AUTHENTICATED&singlepoint-next-redirect=f6f2b6e3a51c60baec84878fafdc5bad7358b0107146cbee1c920e2952bf4c42&singlepoint-error-message=Unable%20to%20authenticate%20using%20the%20credentials%20you%20provided.%20%20Please%20try%20again.Note, however, that the Event viewer logs on the IWA server show that the user has been successfully authenticated:Questions:Why is IWA authentication failing on the production platform?What else can we try to troubleshoot, pin-point and fix the issue?
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: 400 Bad Requests over weekend
description: Saturday morning we were unable to login to our student portal via SSO. When attempting to login the browser would receive a Bad Request error stating that a header field's length exceeded the server's capacity.The header field responsible was x-singlepoint-applications, which is a JSON string holding a bunch of internal data about the connectors we have registered on the IDR.The connectors we have registered hasn't changed since go-live on Dec 17th and this error just appeared on 01/19/2013. Removing some of the connectors seems to have brought the field's length within the limits of your server(s).We would like to know what changes were made by Symplified over the weekend that forced your servers to start saying the field was too long. (Most webservers limit the length of header fields via a configuration file).In the future Bellevue University is going to be adding more applications to our SSO Solution. Ss it currently stands having 7 connectors (as we did this weekend) causes the Bad Request errors on Symplified. We ask that a root cause analysis be done and returned to us along with how we may go about adding more connectors in the future without having the Bad Request error reappear rendering our Student Portal unusable.Please see the attached file for a preview of the error.
name: Bellevue University

subject: iOS access to OWA breaks vertical scroll bar
description: A paid POC customer, Vitas has reported a bug in the OWA connector for users accessing O3 through iOS; and our Sales team has indicated that resolution of this issue would be required for Vitas to move forward with a larger O3 purchase.When accessing O3 thru the app, safari browser or chrome browser within iOS on an iPad there is a bug which will not allow the user to scroll vertically to see older messages in their inbox or other folders. Vitas is using OWA 2010 with O3. Below are the following tests that Vitas performed:- Connected to OWA using native iOS O3 Application - no vertical scroll bar- Connected to OWA using Chrome on iOS through O3 - no vertical scroll bar- Connected to OWA using Safari on iOS through O3 - no vertical scroll bar- Connected to OWA using Safari on iOS DIRECTLY to OWA - vertical scroll bar EXISTSFor some reason going through the O3 gateway they lose the vertical scroll bar.

subject: keychain tool should be able to connect to the Public Interface

subject: Return Relaystate
description: Hello,In working on a new application that we have up and running and the vendor has just posed the following question to us. Is this something that we are able to setup on our side? Below is a their question about capturing TARGET URL and posting is as the relay state? In going over your configuration, one more detail I'd like to go over - when a user clicks on a VolunteerMatch link, say from a bookmark, or an email, it will take them to our site, and our site will see that they are not authenticated. We redirect them to:https://saaso2lapv01-pi.biogen.com/IdPServlet?idp_id=cdcprnw6do5yWhen they return with their assertion, currently, they will be sent to the homepage after the SAML passes. We can add a parameter to this URL that includes the link they were trying to access, either fully qualified, or relative. Would you like this feature? To summarize:Step #1If that user is unauthenticated we pass them back to Biogen to get authenticated. We send them here, currently: https://saaso2lapv01-pi.biogen.com/IdPServlet?idp_id=cdcprnw6do5yWe could change the URL to something like "https://saaso2lapv01-pi.biogen.com/IdPServlet?idp_id=cdcprnw6do5y?TARGET_URL=https%3A%2F%2Fbiogenidec.stage.volunteermatch.org%2Fsome_dir%2Fsome_page.jsp%3Fopp_id%3D12345"The "TARGET_URL" name above could be configured to whatever you'd like, but you'd need to take its value, decode it and return it as RelayState.Step #2You authenticate the user and then directs them to https://biogenidec.stage.volunteermatch.org/saml/post;POSTing the SAMLResponse and the RelayState of "https://biogenidec.stage.volunteermatch.org/some_dir/some_page.jsp?opp_id=12345".Step #3VolunteerMatch processes the SAMLResponse and if all works well the user is authorized and forwarded to the RelayState URL.Thanks,Scott
name: Biogen Idec Inc.

subject: password updates after 90
description: How can I configure the ribbon to automatically update the AD credentials passed to the application from the ribbon? The effect would be the user would not need to deal with password updates after 90, it would be done by the ribbon behind the scene.. Regards,Rod From: Lenore Tumey [mailto:ltumey@symplified.com] Sent: Monday, February 11, 2013 12:50 PMTo: Copeland, Rod ASubject: Re: Update Hi Rod, HTTP-Federation involves a form post as part of the login to the application. As such, the IDR needs to have the username & password for the application. Typically, this is done via a keychain on the IDR, though we do also have a feature called "SSO Passthrough" in which the IDR can use the same credentials that were used to log into the IDR for the HTTP-Fed form post. However, SSO Passthrough only works if users log into the IDR interactively (entering username & password at the login page). When you're using IWA, SSO Passthrough is not an option because the IDR won't see the user's password at any point so it won't be available to POST to an application's login form. With IWA, users would need to enter their AD credentials into their HTTP-Federation application keychains, and would need to update those keychain credentials when they change their AD password. If these are homegrown/internally developed applications, you might see if they could be configured to consume Trusted Headers from the IDR. In this SSO method, the IDR acts as a reverse proxy (as in HTTP-Federation), but instead of performing a form post on the user's behalf, the IDR injects headers into the stream that the application server can consume to check the user's identity.  Another option might be to add (non-SSO) links to the ribbon for these applications. We don't currently have a dedicated feature for this, but you can use the "No-AuthN" adapter to add a link. To configure a link in this way, log into SinglePoint Studio and navigate to Applications >> New Trust Connector >> No-AuthN. Enter a Name, the Portal URL (where you want them to land when they click the link) and a Portal Text/Tooltip. Optionally upload an icon (image). When you click "publish" you'll likely see a warning that "Application __ is not associated with any web servers," but this is expected. You should be able to click "Force publish" to push it through. Note that the IDR will append a URL parameter (?singlepoint-force-sso=true) to the end of the URL, but most applications will just ignore this. If you have any additional questions about our various SSO integration options, please contact our support organization at support@symplified.com, via the support portal, or by phone (link & phone number in my signature, below).Thanks,Lenore--Lenore TumeySr. Solutions EngineerDirect: 303-318-4126Email: ltumey@symplified.comReach Symplified Support here or call: 303-318-4188 option 2Symplified The Cloud Identity Company http://www.symplified.comFollow us on Twitter – Twitter.com/SymplifiedRead our Blog – www.symplified.com/blog On Mon, Feb 11, 2013 at 10:52 AM, Copeland, Rod A <Rod.Copeland@chartercom.com> wrote:Is a HTTP-FED trust connector the way to go for this:If the app we’re integrating with is AD aware, is there a way to pass the AD creds from the ribbon to the app without the user having to initially save them in the ribbon or having to keep updated with the pw changes? Regards,Rod From: Lenore Tumey [mailto:ltumey@symplified.com] Sent: Friday, February 08, 2013 5:36 PMTo: Copeland, Rod ACc: Brett Gabel; Carla EwingSubject: Re: Update Hi Rod, Just a quick note to let you know that the IE8 patch has been deployed to our staging environment, and we expect to be able to deploy it to your IDRs by Tuesday. Applying the patch will require us to restart services on your IDRs. How much advance notice will you need to notify pilot users before we apply the patch? I'll defer the SSPR and subscriber side architecture questions to Brett, as those sound like a separate conversation from this current implementation effort. What's your availability tomorrow? I have the password configured correctly in the IDR, therefore,I am not clear how the ID is getting locked due to in correct password?Can you please log a ticket for this issue and assist withtrouble-shooting?Thank you,Linda FrazierCSC-Zurich AccountiNet Application Services(847) 605-6729 – Schaumburg Office(630) 881-4831 - Celllfrazier2@CSC.com----- Forwarded by Linda Frazier/Contractor/ZI/USA/Zurich on 02/12/201306:37 AM -----    Re: Production EXT AD server (Document link: Linda Frazier)      Linda Frazier  to:  SanjayKumar Singh <ssingh86@csc.com>  02/12/2013  06:34 AM      Cc:  Manjunath Alkod, Siva Kumar Thangaraj, Sujit Trivedi     HI Sanjay - I believe this is the mgmt ip address of the Test UPASS Devise.I forgot about this ip address. subject: The issue is that when the app is accessed through the gateway a link to a PDF is displayed with a CookieTrapServlet URL;
description: From Bob - Symantec Supporthttps://login.portal.williams.com/CookieTrapServlet?s=b09bb7521a27a0bc08697be7d19b0943e657a34f6af1bf3144dfd06c980959cb&p1=c01be89b4bdf7792f3f2dd3dcc82c455&p2=&p3=d211eda2f7de74d82b6660095c9acb77b9c964fa065d243aa58e593041c597c8eb9920ff2c43cbe786617901de129709f84b310ff79aadf8285dd11cfa53167a&p4=0ceb92ea1686bb0e49ec1b8399cea149This link is pointing the user to a files has been moved link and then a failed authentication page.Is this something that O3 has done or is it something in the app itself? If you attempt to modify the PDF the link looks like;http://login.portal.williams.com/CookieTrapServlet?s=b09bb7521a27a0bc08697be7d19b0943e657a34f6af1bf3144dfd06c980959cb&p1=c01be89b4bdf7792f3f2dd3dcc82c455&p2=&p3=d211eda2f7de74d82b6660095c9acb77b9c964fa065d243aa58e593041c597c8dfee1f5ea584988c2990af6ad35486bcf6b5e7d7331fc5654508ba3b6233f1e0&p4=7ef30660f8cd1f1da06020199427e56cThe non https link works when copied into a browser but the https link will not authorize the user.I have suggested that the customer use the gateway as a bookmark to the URL and pass the attributes to the page, unfortunately that fails to authenticate the user. I sent these instructions to the client to accomplish the above;If you want to add an application to the user portal that functions like a bookmark in your browser use the no authN connector. This will allow control of access to applications via policies.  Please note that you will have a warning when publishing b/c you are not proxying the site nor associating any web server(s) with the connector.Symplified Configuration1. Browse to Studio -> Applications -> New Trust Connector -> No AuthN 2. Add a Name, Description, and portal text of your liking. 3. Add the real application URL to the Portal URL text box. 4. Configure any Rewrite Rules, User Stores, and Policies on the corresponding tabs that you need5. Save6. PublishIn this scenario…do the header variable values get sent to the application? The app is looking for userid in a header variable in order to identify the application, but right now with this configuration, the app doesn’t seem to be getting that value.

description: Hi Support, Can you please send a detailed list of the fixes this patch fixes? We need this for our validation.  Kind regards,Robin Gaal | Identity & Access Management Consultant | DSM ICT | M +31620237266 |robin.gaal@dsm.com   From: Symplified Support [mailto:support@symplified.com]Sent: dinsdag 12 februari 2013 1:31To: Gaal, RobinSubject: Symplified Patch Release [https://c.na3.content.force.com/servlet/servlet.ImageServer?id=01550000000UFaR&oid=00D500000007EiF]Dear Robin Gaal, We are excited to announce a patch to the Winter 2013 release of the Symplified solution to our customers. We strive to continually update and enhance our product in response to both user requests as well as developments in the IAM space, and this patch is reflective of this work.  Included in this patch are several fixes to SimpleLink routing, Strong Auth keychain support, improved redirect handling for proxied applications, and our Microsoft authentication system. After this patch has been applied to all environments, we will offer new connectors to support additional Windows SSO integration options. This patch is scheduled to be released to all environments on Saturday, March 2nd, between 8AM and Noon Mountain Standard Time. If you have development or testing environments we can install the patch on those environments one week earlier, on February 23rd, so that you can verify operation of your current configuration with the new patch. Please contact Symplified Support, by opening a ticket in our support portal athttps://support.symplified.com, to let us know which environments you want upgraded early. Thank You. We strive to continually update and enhance our product in response to both user requests as well as developments in the IAM space, and this patch is reflective of this work.  Included in this patch are several fixes to SimpleLink routing, Strong Auth keychain support, improved redirect handling for proxied applications, and our Microsoft authentication system. After this patch has been applied to all environments, we will offer new connectors to support additional Windows SSO integration options. This patch is scheduled to be released to all environments on Saturday, March 2nd, between 8AM and Noon Mountain Standard Time. If you have development or testing environments we can install the patch on those environments one week earlier, on February 23rd, so that you can verify operation of your current configuration with the new patch. Please contact Symplified Support, by opening a ticket in our support portal at https://support.symplified.com, to let us know which environments you want upgraded early. Thank You. subject: Intermitent AD connecitivy issues in EA since 9.4.1 upgrade
description: We have been experiencing intermittent issues with connectivity to AD since the 9.4.1 upgrade in EA.We are getting reports that users were not able to log into their assigned IDRs (for example ea30, 35, 43 and tsoGW35) using correct credentials.We have seen that logging into the IC and trying to "Test" the connection from the User Store page & that returned this error: Error: Appliance operation failed: Underlying user store service was not properly configured for user store 'test--6a2d6cf4:13d01181e92:-7fe9'. (E4610086)Mike has gone into the Attributes page, refreshed the attributes & Saved\Published. Once that was complete, the "Test" function completed with the expected result & were were also able to log onto ea30 afterwards without issue.Today it was reported from the EMEA SEs that they were unable to AuthN into GW ea43. I tried & had the same result.We then performed the same routine as described above and everything is back to functioning as we expect (AuthN into GW is fine & testing the US completes without error)Attaching log of GW35 when issue was reported.I'm wondering if we might have an issue with symlinks on the control server as we saw in Hamburg?

subject: effect of our IWA/IIS server going down
description: Good afternoon, We have a single windows server that is configured to support IWA for our production Symplified system. We also use it to host a custom background page behind the ribbon in the default portal. Our development environment isn’t configured for IWA. Since we only have 1 IWA server, what is the expected behavior and end user experience going to be if we took it down for OS patching? Will users simply be presented with the ribbon requiring user/pass be entered manually and the background page would 404? Will there be timeouts that cause a delay to the end user experience? I could shut the server down temporarily to ‘see what happens’ but I’d appreciate your expert opinion. The obvious follow-up question to this is can I stand up a second IWA/IIS box, stick it behind a load balancer with the first IWA/IIS box and during scheduled maintenance just take them offline 1 by 1 thus ensuring no down-time? Kind regards, Chris Christopher CurwoodApplications Support AssociateOnyx Pharmaceuticals, Inc Direct: (650) 266-2463Fax: (650) 266-0463

subject: Connecting Office365 and OWA through ADFS to Symplified withsupport of Safenet Security tokens. Best practices.
description: Dear Symplified Support, Regarding the plans we have around Office365 and OWA with strong authentication in particular, I would like you to ask for a Symplified support statement around the architecture that we have in mind. Current Architecture: 1. Within DSM we have defined an Access Management architecture which is mandatory for all access related topics including Office365. In this architecture we have a central Identity Router from Symplified that acts as a central policy point and as a federation hub.2. ADFS is currently connected to Simplified as an Identity Provider, so from the Internal Network, internal users can authenticate to Symplified connected SP’s through ADFS 2.x via Windows Authentication.3. Outlook Web App is currently connected to our ADFS 2.x System and makes use of one factor authentication (UPN + password) which also applies for ActiveSync and Outlook. At this moment we are not compliant with our security policy that states strong authentication for OWA. Due to organizational/project dependencies we postponed the implementation of OWA strong authentication.4. The relation towards the strong authentication provider is done via Symplified. We are using Safenet (before Cryptocard) for two factor authentication using an OTP. Safenet is deployed as a cloud service, where we pass through the email address as claim along with the OTP. In Exchange Online we make use of UPN’s that are identical to the user’s email address. The standard we use is SAML v2 (between Symplified and all other parties). The picture below depicts the current architecture: cid:image004.png@01CE1F25.B0EE47A0   Proposed architecture:In the proposed architecture we are changing two important items:1. We introduce strong authentication for OWA only. Outlook and ActiveSync will remain one factor (until the application supports it).2. Symplified will be the Identity Provider for ADFS and ADFS will be the IDP-HUB for OWA. The picture below depicts the proposed architecture. cid:image005.png@01CE1F26.27E488B0  Important remark is that AD FS becomes nothing more than a pass-through towards Symplified for the Microsoft application landscape. In the future we might even consider removing AD FS but this is not in scope now.  Our question:We would like to know from Symplified if this is a supported architecture for Office365/Azure. Is it possible using Symplified as the Identity Provider considering the proposed architecture? Is the 2-way federation possible between Symplified and ADFS? Since Symplified will redirect internal users to the ADFS(for Kerberos auth) and ADFS redirects users to Symplified? Is this going to end in an endless loop when trying to authenticate in the internal DSM network: will Symplified and ADFS keep redirecting to each other? What would be best practice? Vriendelijke groet / Kind regards /此致,Alain Gardier | SDM Access Management | Global Technical Infrastructure | http://www.dsm.com/en_US/cworld/public/home/images/DSM_Email_EN.jpg  DISCLAIMER:This e-mail is for the intended recipient only.If you have received it by mistake please let us know by reply and then delete it from your system; access, disclosure, copying, distribution or reliance on any of it by anyone else is prohibited.If you as intended recipient have received this e-mail incorrectly, please notify the sender (via e-mail) immediately.Please open the attachment to view the entire email.

subject: NxStage Medical: Information Request
description: Hello,My name is Jason Croteau. I work for NxStage Medical.We are currently looking for a Single Sign On solution. We are also interested in an Identity Management solution, but this would probably be a phase 2 project. The SSO piece would likely occur first as it would have a larger impact on our users.A little bit about our current environment:-Microsoft Active Directory-5 Sites across different countries (Languages: English, Spanish, Italian, and German)-Approx 1000 users-Approximately 150 remote users, who rarely connect via VPNWe are looking for these features:-Quick deployement (of Single Sign On piece), 30-60 days.-Support Windows (XP, 7, 8 Pro), MAC, and mobile (iPad/iPhone/Android)-Quick Support turn around (response w/in 4 hr, solution within 24-48 hours)-Prebuilt connectors for as many vendors as possible. Our list below-Ability to maintain passwords and handle password expiration/changes-Federated solution, ESSO solution, and Identity Management solution-Self Support in case user locked themselvesNice to have features:-Auditing/Reporting capability (active, inactive, last login, etc)-Project Manager/Deployment Manager-Finger-print scanner / Facial recognition (in place of typing initial password)-Least amount of config / admin as possible after initial set upAlso wondering what licensing model looks like. We've seen solutions that are On Prem and Cloud Hosted. We currently do not have a preference though, disaster recovery with little intervention is very important.Our current list of vendors we would require support for are:Salesforce.comwww.salesforce.comCloudThinkingPhones.com Web Portalwww.thinkingphones.comCloudThinking contact CenterJava AppThinkingCommunicatorOn PremBirstwww.birst.comCloudHostAnalyticswww.hostanalytics.comCloudHalogenwww.halogen.comCloudIFSOn PremAgileOn PremManage Engine Helpdeskhttps://helpdesk.nxstage.comOn PremConcurhttp://www.concursolutions.comCloudADP Portalwww.portal.adp.comCloudADP Pay Statementshttps://ipay.adp.com/iPay/index.jsfCloudComputersharehttps://www-us.computershare.com/CloudSchwabwww.schwab.comCloudSmartsheetswww.smartsheet.comCloudVisonexhttp://www.visonex.com/CloudMarketoCloudGooglewww.google.com / nxmail.nxstage.comCloudBackupifyCloudProsperity/Ziivahttps://nxstage.prosperitylms.com/CloudWebExnxstage.webex.com / nxstageevents.webex.comCloudTravizon?CloudWBMason?CloudCisco AnyConnect VPNOn PremTerminal Server (MS Remote Desktop)On PremFrevvo (Digiscribe/ImageSilo)On PremPathView (AppNeta)CloudPRTGOn PremVerizon Wireless Enterprise CenterCloudATT Wireless PremierCloudOutlook Gapps pluginOn Prem-- Jason CroteauNetwork Engineer IIPlease submit all requests to NxStage Help Desk: https://helpdesk.nxstage.comNxStage Medical, Inc.350 Merrimack StLawrence, MA 01843Tel: 978-687-4896jcroteau@nxstage.comThis email transmission is intended only for the use of the individual to which it is addressed and may contain information that is privileged, confidential, and exempt from disclosure under applicable law. subject: RE: Connecting Office365 and OWA through ADFS to Symplified withsupport of Safenet Security tokens. Best practices.
description: Dear Symplified, Last Tuesday I mailed the mail below asking for feedback on our new Design to connect O365 to Symplified.We already received comments from Microsoft that this connection (O365 – Symplified) is not supported from the Microsoft end. I would like to receive any feedback regarding this design from Symplified before the end of the day. A “No, this design is not possible because…” is also an answer which would help us. Thanks in advance! Vriendelijke groet / Kind regards /此致,Alain Gardier | SDM Access Management | Global Technical Infrastructure | http://www.dsm.com/en_US/cworld/public/home/images/DSM_Email_EN.jpg  From: Gardier, AlainSent: dinsdag 12 maart 2013 14:30To: support@symplified.comCc: 'Steve Pope'; amcgill@symplified.com McGill; Ivan Djordjevic; Gaal, Robin; Broeckx, MichielSubject: Connecting Office365 and OWA through ADFS to Symplified with support of Safenet Security tokens. Best practices.Importance: High Dear Symplified Support, Regarding the plans we have around Office365 and OWA with strong authentication in particular, I would like you to ask for a Symplified support statement around the architecture that we have in mind. Current Architecture: 1. Within DSM we have defined an Access Management architecture which is mandatory for all access related topics including Office365. In this architecture we have a central Identity Router from Symplified that acts as a central policy point and as a federation hub.2. ADFS is currently connected to Simplified as an Identity Provider, so from the Internal Network, internal users can authenticate to Symplified connected SP’s through ADFS 2.x via Windows Authentication.3. Outlook Web App is currently connected to our ADFS 2.x System and makes use of one factor authentication (UPN + password) which also applies for ActiveSync and Outlook. At this moment we are not compliant with our security policy that states strong authentication for OWA. Due to organizational/project dependencies we postponed the implementation of OWA strong authentication.4. The relation towards the strong authentication provider is done via Symplified. We are using Safenet (before Cryptocard) for two factor authentication using an OTP. Safenet is deployed as a cloud service, where we pass through the email address as claim along with the OTP. In Exchange Online we make use of UPN’s that are identical to the user’s email address. The standard we use is SAML v2 (between Symplified and all other parties). The picture below depicts the current architecture: cid:image004.png@01CE1F25.B0EE47A0   Proposed architecture:In the proposed architecture we are changing two important items:1. We introduce strong authentication for OWA only. Outlook and ActiveSync will remain one factor (until the application supports it).2. Symplified will be the Identity Provider for ADFS and ADFS will be the IDP-HUB for OWA. The picture below depicts the proposed architecture. cid:image005.png@01CE1F26.27E488B0  Important remark is that AD FS becomes nothing more than a pass-through towards Symplified for the Microsoft application landscape. In the future we might even consider removing AD FS but this is not in scope now.  Our question:We would like to know from Symplified if this is a supported architecture for Office365/Azure. Is it possible using Symplified as the Identity Provider considering the proposed architecture? Is the 2-way federation possible between Symplified and ADFS? Since Symplified will redirect internal users to the ADFS(for Kerberos auth) and ADFS redirects users to Symplified? Is this going to end in an endless loop when trying to authenticate in the internal DSM network: will Symplified and ADFS keep redirecting to each other? What would be best practice? Vriendelijke groet / Kind regards /此致,Alain Gardier | SDM Access Management | Global Technical Infrastructure | http://www.dsm.com/en_US/cworld/public/home/images/DSM_Email_EN.jpg  DISCLAIMER:This e-mail is for the intended recipient only.If you have received it by mistake please let us know by reply and then delete it from your system; access, disclosure, copying, distribution or reliance on any of it by anyone else is prohibited.If you as intended recipient have received this e-mail incorrectly, please notify the sender (via e-mail) immediately.Please open the attachment to view the entire email.

description: The download host location for any files on Box.com is:www.boxcloud.comIn the box connector default configuration for 9.4.1 the following webserver is identified:boxcloud.comThe lack of the specific 'www' prefix in the hostname is causing all downloads to occur in the clear and not through the proxy which can have it seem as if it is working.This could present a potential security issue as the way it is currently configued you don't need a valid session to download a file. You just need the correct link.

subject: User Store Outage
description: Okay, here is the history of the issue and the stack trace is below:Customer reported yesterday that users were unable to authenticateThey had recently added two new applications and publishedWhen I logged into Studio I tested their user store and got the following error, along with a stack trace similar the the one below:Error: Appliance operation failed: Unable to reconnect to LDAP server ldap://ctad01.dwr.com:389 (E1849899)The IDR is joined to the domain using Likewise and appeared to be authenticating properlyImmediately after the publish these errors started being thrown (apparently during the authorization process after IWA authentication)Ole and I troubleshooted this until 7PM last night and when we left it was working using their secondary domain controller, the secondary DC had been working intermittently but more consistently than the primary. They called me at 7AM this morning and the secondary domain controller was timing out as well. I touched the user store configuration and published, which seemed to fix the issue but they just reported (9AM) that it is failing again. Currently they are downI have also included at the bottom of this email some anomalies that Ole and I noticed, but they may be red herrings so ignore them if you don't want to be tainted2013-03-26/07:51:24.046/PDT [http-bio-8080-exec-2] ERROR com.symplified.service.controller.shared.ServiceErrorHandler[121] - Remote request failed with subject: IWA-Kerberos Plugin Not Working
description: We managed to get the Kerberos IWA proxy installed and configured but no joy.• The proxy is operating and we are unable to open an anonymous page in the protected network o Works: GW5.tso-cloud.com -> IWA Proxy ->Anonymous IIS 7.5• A Windows Auth site fails to open.  o Fails: GW5.tso-cloud.com -> IWA Proxy -> Windows Auth IIS 7.5 o The original IIS servers returns 401 Unauthorized o Anonymous login events are recorded in Security event  log of target web server o No helpful errors are reported by KerberosIWA component o When directly opening a the target web site using a  domain-member browser, we do see a new Kerberos ticket  issued to the client user o AD delegation is enabled and we tried service restarts  and reboots o Attached are AD events and IWALS log filesInstallation observations• The IWALS service is a ClickOnce app that installs itself into the installing user’s profile and then the service must be manually created by executing a command. Any serious customer isn’t going to be happy with that approach.• GUI and instructions refer to ‘client auth’ certificate as ‘CA’ certificate which can be very confusing. For example, this can be read as ‘Load the Certificate Authority certificate’• Instructions incorrectly claim that no web proxy needs to be configured in IC. They do. We have run out diagnostic ideas at this point.We believe the idr itself is configured correctly and its seems like the requests are being forwarded to the gateway, and that the gateway is processing and forwarding to the correct proxied machines but the proxied machines are not (obviously) accepting the requests. Need to figure out why that is.  Bundle logs for the IDR can be found here: https://www.nortonzone.com/pickup/13200?key=JqYrg7QIFRnyV1C48rPRWy_ffKIBlsM0MLYVAs0xS7L4NS4xlk4LFlxqxB27xPie&src=url All of this information has been provided to Ravinder, Josh and Topher; however my understanding is the QA person responsibnle for sign off is no longer with the company.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: DocuSign SSO
description: Hi there,I am planning to add DocuSign as a new application for SSO. They support SAML 2.0 and we decided to use that as our method of authentication. I have two concerns, 1) they prefer a certificate from a public certification authority and right now we've been using self-signed certificates and 2) the self-signed certificate we're using is about to expire in two months. I believe they will charge us extra for using a self-signed certificate vs. one generated from a well known CA. I have attached the documentation from DocuSign.Thanks!
name: Design Within Reach, Inc.

subject: Customer portal page failed as server busy
description: We had a customer gateway that failed as server busy. Investigation found that it was running around 122 httpd process and the following errors in the log: [Fri Mar 29 15:52:27 2013] [error] (70007)The timeout specified has expired: ajp_ilink_receive() can't receive header[Fri Mar 29 15:52:28 2013] [error] (70007)The timeout specified has expired: ajp_ilink_receive() can't receive header[Fri Mar 29 15:52:32 2013] [error] (70007)The timeout specified has expired: ajp_ilink_receive() can't receive header[Fri Mar 29 15:52:32 2013] [error] (70007)The timeout specified has expired: ajp_ilink_receive() can't receive header[Fri Mar 29 15:52:36 2013] [error] (70007)The timeout specified has expired: ajp_ilink_receive() can't receive header[Fri Mar 29 15:52:36 2013] [error] (70007)The timeout specified has expired: ajp_ilink_receive() can't receive header[Fri Mar 29 15:52:40 2013] [error] (70007)The timeout specified has expired: ajp_ilink_receive() can't receive header[Fri Mar 29 15:52:41 2013] [error] (70007)The timeout specified has expired: ajp_ilink_receive() can't receive headerThe server was listening on 443 and it looks like it was accepting the 443 traffic. In terms of CPU/memory it had sufficient to spare. It looked like it was not able to talk to the tomcat backend and respond to the incoming requests. The bundlelogs before and after the restart can be found here. https://www.nortonzone.com/pickup/13634?key=jaUUjnB7cNDG_GFvANb2NdJY4IjErp4-BgXyIbIWiIG433vXNUWviypAv-VBp90p&src=urlWould like to find out what is the root cause, quickly as possible. Thanks.
name: Symantec Corporation

subject: FW: SSO with multiple orgs
description: Hi, I looked in online support and didn’t find anything except for SFDC delegated auth (which we will need for the Veeva mobile app). How does Symplified support multiple SFDC orgs? - Chris From: Eric Dennison [mailto:eric.dennison@veevasystems.com]Sent: Friday, March 29, 2013 5:22 PMTo: Anthony Styczynski; Christopher Curwood; Christopher EinkornCc: Will Larter; Pablo Gersberg; Jeannie Sanchez; Mark BoyerSubject: SSO with multiple orgs Hi,As a follow up to our discussion on Thursday, I wanted to make sure we got this discussion pointed in the right direction - there are options/workarounds for having SSO enabled with multiple SFDC orgs (in your case, one for Veeva, and a separate one for Chatter). Rather than making the next discussion one with SFDC, I think it makes sense to reach out directly to your SSO vendor and pose the question to them, as they will determine the exact means by which this would be implemented (the exact approach may vary across vendors e.g Ping vs Symplicity).Best,Eric-- Eric DennisonVeeva Systems, Senior Consultant Veeva CRMCertified Veeva Administrator310-849-2975 cellmailto:eric.dennison@veevasystems.com http://www.veevasystems.com/vault/

subject: FW: SSO Link Down
description: It looks like the IDR is coming back with a cookie expired issue – the cookie the IDR is generating. Users have been contacting us on this. Can someone take a look at this? Regards,Rod From: Nottingham, Aaron J Sent: Wednesday, April 03, 2013 12:50 PMTo: Copeland, Rod A; Scherzer, KyleSubject: RE: SSO Link Down Rod,  That cookie appears to be an application cookie, not an F5 cookie, as the sso app wouldn’t ever make reference to an F5 cookie. Cookie persistence is configured on both IDR/IWA, so we should also see a BigIP cookie along with the sso cookie ( I think? ).  Is this something that works in one environment and not in the other? We can compare and see if there are any differences there.  Thanks,Aaron  From: Copeland, Rod A Sent: Wednesday, April 03, 2013 11:37 AMTo: Nottingham, Aaron JSubject: FW: SSO Link Down Hi Aaron, as we duplicate configurations from the Pilot environment to the Phase II environment, can we make sure this issue goes away? I think the F5 cookie is expiring differently on the IDR servers than it does for the IWA servers. Is there a quick way to confirm? Regards,Rod From: Cotton, Jamie L Sent: Wednesday, April 03, 2013 11:11 AMTo: Copeland, Rod ASubject: RE: SSO Link Down No it seems to be okay now.  Thanks,  Jamie Cotton, PHRHRIS Analyst charter_logo_150   From: Copeland, Rod A Sent: Wednesday, April 03, 2013 11:09 AMTo: Cotton, Jamie LSubject: Re: SSO Link Down Is this still happening.Sent from my iPhoneOn Apr 3, 2013, at 9:37 AM, "Cotton, Jamie L" <Jamie.Cotton@charter.com> wrote:Hi Rod, looks like the SSO production link is not working correctly today? https://pilot.sso.chartercom.com/portal/ribbon/login.html?logged_out=true&singlepoint-auth-error=COOKIE_EXPIRED  Thanks,  Jamie Cotton, PHR|HRIS Analyst12405 Powerscourt Dr, St. Louis, MO 63131Phone: 314-543-2543Email: jamie.cotton@chartercom.com <image001.jpg>    E-MAIL CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: The contents of this e-mail message and any attachments are intended solely for the addressee(s) and may contain confidential and/or legally privileged information.
